title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: The Foreign Minister toured this Thursday the works of the Tienditas point, in Cúcuta, which will connect Colombia with Venezuela.

title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: After observing the progress of the work, Holguín expressed her pleasure at its progress and recalled that she laid the first stone of the bridge with former Venezuelan Foreign Minister Elías Jagua, in February 2014.

title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: For the official, it is satisfactory to see that the construction of the bridge is already more than fifty percent advanced.

title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: They tell us that by September the presidents will be able to make this inauguration, the minister announced.

title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: The Tienditas bridge has three lanes to go to the neighboring country and three to return, plus two pedestrian bridges, and its construction is valued at 32 million dollars, which have been invested by the governments of Venezuela and Colombia.

title: In September opening of the Tienditas bridge
text: This is an example that we can work together and think big, said the chancellor.

title: Venezuelans, with the same rights as Colombians to apply for jobs
text: The Ministry of Labor, through the Public Employment Service (SPE), approved that Venezuelans who have arrived in the country have the same rights as Colombians when applying for available vacancies and the service portfolio of this entity.

title: Venezuelans, with the same rights as Colombians to apply for jobs
text: The Minister of Labor, Griselda Janeth Restrepo, pointed out that the entity in her charge joins the initiative that is based on the promotion of an orderly, regular and safe migration policy, guaranteeing security and respect for the rights of nationals and foreigners. , in order to avoid labor exploitation and preserve internal and social order.

title: Venezuelans, with the same rights as Colombians to apply for jobs
text: It is important to clarify that the permit is granted only to Venezuelan migrants who entered Colombian territory before July 28 with their passport and through an authorized Migratory Control post, who do not have a national and international judicial record or expulsion measure. or current deportation.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: Trucks that got stuck with their cargo, coal shipments interrupted and even the passage of private vehicles in search of mechanical services and spare parts are among the economic activities that have received an immediate impact due to the crisis that unleashed the closure of the border with Venezuela.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: It is estimated that by the time of closure some 250 Colombian trucks were stationed at the border, where 10,000 million pesos a day are moved.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: A first blow is for perishable products, says Germán Umaña, director of the ColomboVenezuelan Chamber of Commerce (CCCV), while a high number of carriers will run out of cargo during the time that there is no solution.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: The impact of the closure of the border in Cúcuta, says Javier Díaz, president of the National Association of Foreign Trade (Analdex), was lessened by the option of cargo trucks leaving for Venezuela through the Paraguachón border, in La Guajira.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: When the closure completed its first 72 hours, the governor of Norte de Santander, Édgar Díaz, estimated that by that time it had affected some 100,000 people and that the estimated losses (were) of about 400,000 dollars a day.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: In statements to Efe, Díaz said that this figure corresponds to the shipment of some 4,000 tons of coal a day to Europe that Colombia exports through the port of the Venezuelan city of Maracaibo.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: The manager of Asocarbón in Norte de Santander, Jaime Rodríguez, stated that the closure affects both countries because the mineral is produced by 7,000 Colombian families, and is then transported by Venezuelan personnel and vehicles.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: On the other hand, the president of Asopartes, Tulio Zuloaga, said that through the Cúcuta border, 250 vehicle owners go daily to Colombia from Venezuela to look for workshop services and spare parts, a dynamic that moves 154 million dollars a year.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: For this reason, it calculates the daily loss due to the closure of the border, in that sector, at about 422,000 dollars.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: From the point of view of the export industries, there are no specific complaints about the current situation, since the deterioration of their sales comes from years ago, warns the president of Analdex.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: In that sense, it is still difficult for these entrepreneurs to measure the impact.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: The closure of the market in Venezuela since 2009 has already caused a noticeable drop in exports, and this year they will only be 1,500 million dollars.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: They reached 6,000 million dollars a year, explains Díaz.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: And it is that before the recent diplomatic crises with the neighboring country, exports were the bogeyman if the Government of Venezuela threatened to restrict them.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: For example, in 2008 they represented 16.2 percent of Colombias total exports, adding up to 6,092 million dollars.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: However, in the first six months of 2015 they were only 3.2 percent, with 1,012 million.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: An important reason for the decline in sales is the lack of foreign currency to pay entrepreneurs.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: Therefore, Colombian exporters have restricted their shipments and demand cash payments.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: For his part, the director of the National Planning Department (DNP), Simón Gaviria, says that the worrying economic outlook in the neighboring country can lead to trade, exchange and logistical complications.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: To the current situation of displacement of our compatriots for political reasons is added the latent possibility of a phenomenon of economic refugees in the medium term.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: For that reason, he considers that the country must prepare for this new scenario.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: And that the Development Plan scheduled investments for the 20152018 period of the order of 57.8 billion, including initiatives such as the Norte de Santander Plan Contract and the Arauca Plan Contract, for 1.72 billion.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: Likewise, Conpes 3805 de Fronteras includes a large part of these investments.

title: Due to the closure of the border, 400,000 dollars are lost
text: Apart from this, we are already building an economic and humanitarian action plan for the next two years in case the Venezuelan economy and its politics deteriorate even more, he says.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: The surgeon Iván Santos denounced in a video published on his social networks the aggression of which he was a victim this Thursday, when he was passing with his wife through Carrera 7 with Calle 174, in the north of Bogotá, where a sitin was taking place of people who were asking for aid due to the economic crisis.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: The health professional said that when he reached that point he got out of the vehicle to explain to the protesters that he was a doctor and that circulation was allowed.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: It was at that moment that the assault occurred.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: At least eight people took me, they hit me with sticks, they took my truck, where my wife was driving, and they took it with sticks, they broke it with stones, said the doctor, who also showed the damage to the windows of his vehicle, despite being armored.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: The Secretary of Security of Bogotá, Hugo Acero, explained that men from the Bogotá Police arrived at the scene to clear the road and to attend to Dr. Santoss complaint.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: He added that in the midst of the investigative work, the videos that circulate on social networks and that show how the aggression occurred will be key.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: In fact, two people were captured for the attack on the doctor and must answer for their actions in court.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: This case, which apparently was carried out by Venezuelan migrants, once again put on the table the discussion about what to do with this population, which according to data from Migración Colombia exceeded 352,000 people before isolation.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: Official data shows that so far in the quarantine, some 6,000 have returned to their country.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: However, many continue in the city and have been involved in cases such as that of Dr. Santos, or the invasion of a disused residential complex in Soacha, where foreigners, displaced by violence, and mothers who are heads of households decided to spend the nights during this time of crisis.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: The mayor of Soacha, Juan Carlos Saldarriaga, said that the group of people, mainly Venezuelans, who took over those apartments said they did so due to economic hardship.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: The necessary police actions will be taken to restore private property and see how aid is delivered to those who really need it, but the way in which they invaded the property is not correct, said Mayor Saldarriaga.

title: Attack on a doctor, symptom of the crisis that overwhelms migrants
text: Regarding other events involving migrants, such as the five who were expelled for drinking liquor and assaulting people on April 10, or the group of 200 people who were detained at the Los Andes toll on the North highway, but between this On Thursday and Friday they managed to continue on their way to Caracas, the district and immigration authorities must reach fluid agreements that facilitate care for those who remain in the city, and manage the resources to support the departure of those who want to return to their country.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: At least twenty displaced families from the neighboring country arrived this weekend at the Bogotá transport terminal to shelter from the cold and rain.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: According to the Secretariat of Social Integration, the number of Venezuelan nationals has increased in the last two weeks, generating a true social emergency.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: The outlook is no better today.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: You see mostly children in cars with nothing to eat.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: Families tired of so much walking from the border territory settle in the surroundings of the neighborhood.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: We are on the road and we have done nothing more than beautify.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: The situation in the country is very difficult, said the father of one of the families.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: They say that Venezuela is a lawless country and that they had no other option but to leave their country, where the humanitarian crisis is growing.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: Others say that their goal is to reach Ecuador.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: Meanwhile, they do not know what to do to protect themselves from the cold that has been felt in Bogotá in recent weeks.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: The Secretariat of Social Integration assured that it has provided them with attention in the Social Supercade and in the migrant information offices.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: Families with children, pregnant women or the elderly are being offered temporary shelter, and children in begging conditions are referred to the Abrazar center.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: In the last few hours, a contingency team arrived at the terminal that is preparing to attend to migrants who come in transit to Ecuador before a visa is imposed at the end of this month.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: The contingency team is made up of the Secretaries of Health, General and Social Integration.

title: Drama of Venezuelan families in the transport terminal of Bogotá
text: There is also the presence of other entities such as Colombia Migration, IOM, Acnur, Norwegian Council.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: The humanitarian visa measure, which began to take effect from midnight on Monday, will bring together thousands of migrants on the Colombian border with Ecuador located in Rumichaca, Nariño.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: After the director of Migration Colombia, Christian Krüger Sarmiento, announced a contingency plan at the immigration control post to avoid damming at the border, the institution reported on Sunday a high flow of Venezuelans leaving through the International Bridge of more of 4,000 people.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: Days before, the lines of migrants in transit reached more than 10,000 people at the crossing of that land border.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: According to the Foreign Ministry of Ecuador, the visa, whose procedure was enabled since last August 21, aims to guarantee a safe, orderly and regular migration.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: However, the measure has been perceived as a difficulty among migrants, for whom the 50 dollars of the processing form is an unsustainable cost with their current needs.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: Among other requirements, the visa, which can be requested online on the website of the Ecuadorian consulate, requires a criminal record certificate apostilled or legalized by Venezuelan authorities and to attend a facetoface appointment at the consulates in Bogotá, Lima or Caracas. .

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: In the opinion of analyst Gilma Ballesteros, doctor in peace, conflict and democracy, Ecuadors decision has consequences for other countries at a time when each government is responding to the phenomenon with its policies and to the extent of its availability of resources, some more flexible than others.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: In his opinion, Colombia should dialogue with its brother country to understand how to facilitate the management of this visa.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: However, he points out that the region needs to agree on how the phenomenon will be handled.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: Ballesteros points out that those who are in transit seek to reach a place where family or friends with whom they have sentimental and economic ties are waiting for them.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: Therefore, at the immediate level, the procedure can result in significant sociographic pressure.

title: The impact of the humanitarian visa
text: Migrants will accumulate and settle for long days or however long it takes them to resolve their situation.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: President Juan Manuel Santos arrived this Wednesday in Cúcuta, in the border area with Venezuela, to face the harsh humanitarian crisis that exists in the area after the closure of the binational border, which has generated the deportation of more than 1,000 Colombians who they were in the territory of the neighboring country.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: The presidents intention is to know firsthand the conditions in which his government is attending to people who have had to leave Venezuelan territory abruptly, and are now located in different shelters.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: In fact, Santos toured this Wednesday one of them located, precisely, in the capital of North Santander.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Santos spoke with the refugees who are in this place, knowing their needs and the conditions that forced them to return to Colombian territory, after his Venezuelan counterpart, Nicolás Maduro, unilaterally ordered the closure of the border.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: They took me out like a dog, they didnt let me bring anything, Luisa Olaya, one of those affected, told Santos through tears.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: And Graciela Portilla, for her part, told him They told us we couldnt go back.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Santos thus heard several stories from the people who are refugees in that center, located in the city of Cúcuta.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Santos let several refugees know, after listening to them, that their situation is inconceivable and must not be repeated.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Moreover, several of these victims told him that after the illtreatment received by the Venezuelan authorities, the last thing they think about is returning to the neighboring country.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: They just asked for their things back.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: The Head of State told these deportation victims that his government is working to solve the inconvenience that has arisen after the border closure.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: He even committed himself to concrete measures that several of his officials are already carrying out.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: There are already some trucks ready to go for everything that was left, we are just waiting for the approval of the Venezuelan authorities to be confirmed, the President notified them.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Santos plans a meeting at the unified command center with the authorities in the area to learn about the results of the measures that have been adopted and how to minimize the negative effects of this humanitarian crisis.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: Here we are from the first moment.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: This government does love them and does listen to them, added the Colombian president.

title: _This government does love them and listens to them_ Santos to deportees
text: The president, while making this tour, was very attentive to the reports sent from Cartagena by the diplomatic officials who are in the highlevel meeting between the foreign ministries of Caracas and Bogotá.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: The president of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, urged his Colombian counterpart, Juan Manuel Santos, to meet soon to settle the border crisis, after Ecuador announced an appointment prior to a possible meeting between the two leaders.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: President Santos, why dont you and I apply a bit of popular wisdom and sit down face to face soon, soon

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: You are leaving things for much later, Maduro said during a public act broadcast on government television.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: The exhortation came after Ecuadorian Foreign Minister Ricardo Patiño announced that his counterparts from Venezuela, Delcy Rodríguez, and Colombia, María Angela Holguín, will meet next Saturday in Quito as a preliminary step to a presidential meeting. .

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: This meeting was requested by Bogotá and Caracas to the presidents of Ecuador, Rafael Correa, and Uruguay, Tabaré Vázquez, whose foreign ministers will be present at the meeting, said Patiño.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: Maduro reiterated his wish that in a possible meeting with Santos a peace pact and rules of coexistence can be signed so that paramilitarism, smuggling, fuel and food theft end on the binational border. and the attack on the Venezuelan currency.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: And we help you to fight drug trafficking, and if you accept it, I can teach you a little about the methods of the missions so that you can fight against poverty in Colombia.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: I offer you my hand, Maduro said.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: Previously, the Venezuelan foreign minister wrote on Twitter that at the meeting with Holguín she will expose the truth about the border and the migratory exodus of Colombian brothers to Venezuela.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: The crisis was unleashed on August 19 when unknown individuals shot three Venezuelan soldiers who were carrying out an antismuggling operation in the town of San Antonio del Táchira, after which Maduro ordered the closure of large sections of the 2,219 km border line.

title: _Hopefully very soon we will put things in their place_ Maduro to Santos
text: Since then, 1,467 Colombians have been deported, according to the Venezuelan government, for being undocumented, while some 18,000 have fled for fear of being expelled without their families or belongings, according to the United Nations.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: Federico Marín is a Colombian lawyer who denounced, through social networks, the inconvenience he had with uniformed officers of the Bogotá Metropolitan Police at the National Museum TransMilenio station when a search of a young Venezuelan ended in a confrontation, on Wednesday at the night.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: The video went viral and put into debate the xenophobia in which citizens in Colombia would be falling, due to the massive arrival of Venezuelans, who have mostly held informal jobs.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: Wednesdays case, according to Federico, was recorded at 930 p.m. m., when a young Venezuelan, approximately 25 years old, was requested by police officers for a search.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: The man was leaned against one of the doors and approached by at least three agents.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: Witnesses to the event, including his father, began to protest the treatment he was receiving and minutes later the atmosphere heated up.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: There were halonazos, rudeness, shouting and finally both the father and his son were transferred to the Transfer Center for Protection, to spend a few hours there.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: The Metropolitan Police pointed out that everything happened in the midst of the control tasks that are carried out within the system to avoid street sales, which are prohibited by the Police Code.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: However, Federico, who was recording, was also required by the Police, handcuffed, mounted on a patrol car and later, according to what he said, the victim of insults such as after the frog, crazy h. p., lawyer, faggot, among others.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: He explained that they accused him of interfering in a police procedure and they imposed a subpoena of 700,000 pesos.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: He assured that during the procedure carried out by the uniformed men, they repeatedly referred to the migrants as venecos, and that on patrol one of them told them that they were animals and not people.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: The migration expert from the Universidad del Rosario María Teresa Palacios explained that these behaviors cannot be ignored.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: The word veneco is a term that is used to refer disparagingly to Venezuelans, and for them it is an offense, he said.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: Palacios indicated that this leaves the uniformed men in a very bad position, since they are there to take care of the citizens.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: If they reproduce these terms, what can we expect from ordinary citizens

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: What this does is legitimize verbal and physical aggression against Venezuelans, in the midst of the current crisis, he said.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: She made a call to the generals who are at the head of the institution They must strengthen human rights training for their subordinates.

title: Police xenophobia complaint cannot be ignored
text: Pedagogy must be intensified because although they must enforce the Police Code and comply with the tasks of controlling street vendors, it is also true that the uniformed officers must refer to a Colombian citizen in the same way as to a Venezuelan one, he concluded.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The news that was broadcast on Thursday night in Ureña (Venezuela) that the passage for school students to Colombia would be reopened pushed the parents of 56 children to take them back to classes in Cúcuta yesterday morning.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The minors, accompanied by the mayor of Ureña, Alejandro García, were picked up by a bus at dawn at the Venezuelan end of the Francisco de Paula Santander bridge.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The transport took them to the beginning of the border between the two countries, where they were picked up by other buses that took them to the Inem schools, the Lions Club and the Padre Luis Vaviara school, in the North Santander capital.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Allowing the passage of 2,067 children living in Venezuelan border cities to national schools, through a humanitarian corridor, was one of the conditions that President Juan Manuel Santos set on Thursday to agree to meet with his Venezuelan colleague, Nicolás Maduro , to seek solutions to the crisis at the border.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The Minister of Education, Gina Parody, assured that the corridor that they requested from the Venezuelan authorities works and we hope that on Monday more children can pass.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The President has given us precise instructions to verify that this corridor is real so that children can go from Venezuela to Colombia and study here without fear, added the Minister.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: In turn, the mayor of Cúcuta, Donamaris Ramírez, thanked the Government of Venezuela for having accepted the idea for the benefit of minors, and added that he hopes that this is the beginning of a cascade of decisions that allow the reopening of the border .

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The number of absenteeism, however, continues to worry the teachers of different local schools.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The religious Adelia Abella, rector of the Padre Luis Vaviara school, told EL TIEMPO that yesterday she only received Gerson and Abraham Cooper, sons of the Peruvian Abraham Cooper, from Venezuela.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The children came from the neighboring city of Ureña.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Since the closure, 48 minors have been absent from the institution and have missed 11 days of school.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The nun sent a scolding to the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro The only owner of life is God, let him not forget that he was also a child, that he had a young life.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: At the La Frontera school, in the La Parada sector, in the municipality of Villa del Rosario, teacher Yamileth Bayona said that she has been missing 19 students since last August 20.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: According to the teacher, there are still many students who are hidden in the neighboring country for fear of being mistreated.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Jennifer Rubio, who is 14 years old and is in eighth grade at the Carlos Pérez Escalante school, said that she was absent from class because she had heard in Ureña that they were allowed to pass through San Antonio, towards Colombia, but then they were not allowed to reenter.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: His sister Mayo was afraid that he would cross yesterday.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: But I wanted to pass because we already missed two weeks of school, which is quite a lot, said the girl.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: National authorities expect that next Monday the number of children returning to classrooms will be at least 1,000.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: The Mayor of Cúcuta asked the parents on the Venezuelan side to be calm because the Venezuelan Guard is collaborating, they are friendly.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: There is no drama as humiliating as this oneThere is no other drama in history, at least in the last 50 years, as humiliating as this one.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: With this phrase, the director of the National Unit for Risk Management, Carlos Iván Márquez, summarizes his perception of the humanitarian crisis that Cúcuta is going through after the return of almost 16,000 Colombians from Venezuela.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Márquez, a man experienced in dealing with humanitarian crises, said that 1,500 officials and volunteers have been dispatched for the emergency and that they are ready in case it escalates.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Another situation of greater magnitude could arise, which already has us thinking about setting up a few more camps, outside the city, to concentrate more people.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: We are already thinking about it, revealed Márquez.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: Regarding the drama of these nationals who had to cross the border, he affirmed that many begin to remember their attachments and customs such as the Day of Love and Friendship or the preparation for the holidays.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: (The Colombians) were kicked out, in an inhumane way, and they cant even bring their things back.

title: This was the first day of the humanitarian corridor on the border
text: That is what has them so marked on the emotional issue, he said.

title: A necessary support
text: The director of the Unit specified that all the actions were carried out with the accompaniment of the Ombudsmans Office, the Attorney Generals Office and the Prosecutors Office.

title: A necessary support
text: One of the phenomena that will mark the year that ends is, without a doubt, the diaspora of Venezuelans who have come to the country in search of refuge and attention.

title: A necessary support
text: The dictatorial regime that violates human rights prevailing in that nation, and which is intended to be avoided with announcements of war, has forced millions of people to leave their land, especially in the last three years.

title: A necessary support
text: According to figures from international organizations, it is estimated that by the end of 2019, the number of refugees on Colombian soil will exceed 2 million, which represents a major challenge for the authorities.

title: A necessary support
text: For this reason, the announcement made recently by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the International Organization for Migration (IOM), in the sense of undertaking an urgent strategy to attend to the refugees, is of vital importance. thousands of refugees and migrants who arrive daily in Colombia and other Latin American and Caribbean States.

title: A necessary support
text: Initially, there has been talk of a series of programs that allow, through the governments of each nation, to provide assistance in health services, food, shelter and hygiene.

title: A necessary support
text: Likewise, it is hoped that all of this will help said population to regularize their situation in the country and that children and women will be guaranteed their legal rights, since there is evidence that several of them could be subjected to human trafficking.

title: A necessary support
text: According to the announced announcements, the resources that Colombia could count on for this purpose amount to 315 million dollars, out of a total of 738 million for the region.

title: A necessary support
text: In other words, the country would obtain 43 percent of the total assigned, given the complexity of the situation.

title: A necessary support
text: Fair, because Colombia is the first option for migrants.

title: A necessary support
text: The same organization estimates that between 2015 and 2018, the number of people who arrived from Venezuela with the purpose of rebuilding their lives here increased by 2,550 percent.

title: A necessary support
text: The official number of regularized Venezuelans who are not may today reach one million.

title: A necessary support
text: As Eduardo Stein, joint special representative of UNHCR and IOM for Venezuelan refugees and migrants, stated, this aid is just a first step that seeks to support the Government so that it responds to the massive arrival of citizens from the other side of the border. .

title: A necessary support
text: It is, of course, a much needed and welcome help, but much more is needed.

title: A necessary support
text: The demands for better conditions and, in particular, for formal jobs make the challenge for a country like ours to go through a difficult economic situation, and phenomena like this tend to add pressure to reality.

title: A necessary support
text: But there is no other way than to face in the best possible way a fact that is not exclusive to Colombia.

title: A necessary support
text: At this time, when International Migrants Day is celebrated, the figures continue to be impressive more than 25 million people in the world are in this condition or in a refugee situation, the result of totalitarian regimes and fratricidal wars, essentially.

title: A necessary support
text: That is why it is said, also with reason, that forced or voluntary migration is the main challenge facing humanity in this century.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: We need you to help us, because even though I brought some money from Venezuela, it is not enough for me.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: Attorney General Alejandro Ordóñez assured that he has already filed with prosecutor Fatou Bensouda, head of the International Criminal Court (ICC), a report in which he denounces the abuses committed on the ColombianVenezuelan border.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: According to Ordóñez, he provided information on the perpetration of crimes against humanity by Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and military and civilian agents of his government against our compatriots who are, or were, settled in their national territory.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: That information provided by the Attorney Generals Office, although fulfills the important function of denouncing serious acts committed on the border before the Chief Prosecutor of the Court, according to Ordóñez, does not automatically activate the jurisdiction of this international court because that depends on the review that do Bensouda on the case.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: The head of the Public Ministry affirmed that he welcomes the declarations of President Juan Manuel Santos in which he announces his intention to go before international organizations due to the crisis on the border.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: However, he assured that it should be the State, headed by President Santos, that goes to the ICC to formally denounce Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro for crimes against humanity.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: According to Ordóñez, if the President denounces Maduro, that act can activate the jurisdiction of the International Criminal Court.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: The documents of other state bodies (such as the Attorney Generals Office) could not have that effect (of initiating legal action) since they are not representatives of the State before the international community.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: Your complaint, Mr. President, would have that immediate effect and would not depend on the will of Prosecutor Bensouda to launch an investigation ex officio, said Ordóñez.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: The Attorney also affirmed that it is time to leave the euphemisms.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: It is vital that bodies such as the Attorney Generals Office or the Attorney Generals Office go before the Courts Attorney to present our complaints, but it is you, on behalf of the Colombian State, who have the legal tools to immediately activate the jurisdiction of the International Court , he added.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: For Ordóñez they are not only human rights violations but true crimes against humanity.

title: International Criminal Court received report on border abuses
text: It is time to firmly demand that this policy of systematic attack be dismantled and definitively ended.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: The problem is not solved by reopening the border.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: From the early hours of this Saturday morning, drivers of different types of vehicles were located on the side of the road that leads to the Francisco de Paula Santander International Bridge, which connects Cúcuta with Ureña  a Venezuelan city in the state of Táchira.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: The drivers were waiting for the announced opening of the border, which will only last five hours.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: The event was planned to take place in the three border areas Zulia State  Paraguachón (La Guajira), Táchira State  Cúcuta (Norte de Santander) and Apure State  Arauca.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: Although the governor of the state of Táchira, José Gregorio Vielma, had assured that only heavy cargo vehicles would be allowed to pass, private vehicles may also pass, since they are part of a census.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: However, those who are not registered, but meet the required documentation, will also be able to transit, as stated by the Colombian Foreign Ministry delegate for border issues, Víctor Bautista.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: The official confirmed the temporary opening of the border after meeting with the Venezuelan general, Carlos Alberto Martínez sole authority in the area in a state of emergency.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: He added that the opening was an issue managed by both countries since last November and insisted that this day will not be repeated.

title: The temporary opening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela advances
text: We hope that all those who were affected by this situation can return to their places of origin, and we can advance in other measures that will correct all these effects of the closure, Bautista concluded.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: It has a lot to do with the pandemic and returns, but we have to continue.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: The Secretary of Health will execute a Response Plan to provide guidance and care to all Venezuelans who are in a vulnerable condition.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: There will be a special measles and diphtheria vaccination day, in addition to preventive actions, information on health rights and access to the Extended Vaccination Plan for children under 6 years of age, adolescents, women of childbearing age between 10 and 49 years of age, pregnant women and adults over 60 years of age.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: Venezuelans can go to the citys Cades and Supercades and to the 19 Health Orientation and Information Centers (Cois) to learn about their options and access health services.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: From this Wednesday there will be a special day, between 8 a. m. and 4 p.m. m, at five points in the city Verbenal neighborhood (187th street with 18th street), Lourdes park (63rd street with 13th street), Supercade on 30th street, Plaza de Bolívar and Central de Abastos (80th avenue n. 251).

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: Those who are unable to attend will be able to approach the 300 vaccination posts arranged in the service units of the public network and private institutions.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: Regardless of their migratory status, legal or illegal, they will be guaranteed the provision of the emergency service The purpose of this measure is to develop preventive actions for medical cases that are occurring in the neighboring country, especially measles and diphtheria, to mitigate risks in the city.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: In Colombia no cases of measles have been recorded since 2002, and in Bogotá there have been no episodes of diphtheria since 2000.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: Citizens are recommended to verify the vaccination schedule for children under 6 years of age and to be alert to symptoms such as fever, cough, conjunctivitis and any type of rash in the case of measles.

title: Medical day for Venezuelan migrants in Bogotá
text: For diphtheria, the patient usually has nausea, difficulty eating, dizziness, and headaches.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: All these sufferings, theirs and ours, are born from the lack of recognition of the human dignity of each person, regardless of where they were born.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Colombia, through its Foreign Minister, María Ángela Holguín, considers that our country, as never before, must be in solidarity with the people of Venezuela because the situation they are experiencing is dramatic.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: And the poverty they suffer is tragic and unfortunate.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The Chancellor reveals that she has already responded to the Prosecutor regarding his requirements for the participation of Venezuelans in crimes and announced that all Venezuelans indicated by the Prosecutors Office will be deported.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: How many Venezuelans are there today in Colombia, legal and illegal

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Precisely, to have a clear picture, that characterization that President Santos announced will be made.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We want to know who they are, where they are and what kind of documentation they have.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: All Venezuelans who are currently in the country, regular and irregular, must go to the personerías and ombudsmen to register for free.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: From when should they do it

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: In the next few days we will inform you and publish how to do it.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: As a general policy, will Colombia help Venezuelans who need its help and who come to our country in search of it

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Colombia will help Venezuelan migrants under a framework of greater regularity and legality.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Therefore, the importance of registration in the shortest possible time.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: With this information and characterization, the Government will be able to define the type of aid that the country is capable of providing.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Today all Venezuelans are receiving emergency health service in public hospitals and all children have been received in educational institutions.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Is it true that refugee camps will be authorized on the border

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: No refugee camps are going to be authorized in our country under todays circumstances.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Given the migratory complexity of the problems with which Venezuelan brothers and sisters arrive in our territory, there are currently some transitory attention centers for migrants in Maicao, Cúcuta and Villa del Rosario.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We are going to add a reception center with greater capacity, which will be for 2,000 people and will be located in a rural area, between Cúcuta and the municipality of Puerto Santander, and which can be quickly expanded if required.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Apart from the aid to Venezuelan refugees, the Prosecutor sent you a letter about the increase in complaints against Venezuelans who have committed crimes in the country.Yes.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: With two specific requirements one was about the concern of the Border Mobility Card as an identity document for Venezuelans and the second, on the need to have more immigration officers to carry out deportations.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: I answered the letter on Friday with the explanations you requested.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: In your response, do you mean that, according to the Prosecutor, many of them have been arrested for committing crimes

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: It is important to keep in mind that not all Venezuelans who enter the country do so to commit crimes the vast majority do so looking for a quality of life that they cannot find in their country.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: There are those who have come to work, even some to invest, and thereby help the development of the country.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: But what about those who come and commit crimes

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: They will be prosecuted with the full weight of the law and we will be deporting them as soon as the Prosecutors Office tells us to.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: In this I want to be very clear and emphatic the foreign citizen who commits a crime in Colombia will be prosecuted, and we are going to work together with the authorities to take the corresponding judicial and migratory measures.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: But look I do want to tell you one thing, we cannot fall into stigmatization and say that everyone is the same.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: I believe that the country, like never before, should show solidarity The situation that Venezuelans are experiencing is dramatic.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Could the Andean migration card be used by the Colombian government to allow Venezuelans who leave their country to transit through Colombia to Peru, Chile and Ecuador

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Venezuelans who want to move to another country like the ones you mention, and if the country of destination allows them to enter with the Venezuelan identity card, may do so and will be accompanied by migration officials to the means of transportation.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: One of the measures that was taken after the meeting held in Cúcuta last Thursday was to reinforce immigration controls, how will it be done

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We will ensure that the entry of Venezuelans has certain characteristics, that it be controlled, that it be orderly and that it be done within the law.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We are going to have, for example, a greater number of immigration officials, there is a number already present, but it falls short compared to the volume of migrants that we are having.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Another decision is that Border Mobility Cards (TMF) were no longer issued.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: That card was for those Venezuelans who wanted to enter border areas they could stay for up to 7 days and come back in and out later.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The reality is that it deviated from that initial objective and that is why it was no longer issued.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Now only those who have a passport or those who already had that card in their possession can enter, but no new cards will be issued.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: In addition, we are going to carry out a characterization session that will allow us to see if it is necessary to apply other measures in the future.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: But I confess that I dont understand how they are going to deal with such a serious situation. Look, this is a state issue, the implications of the migratory problem impacts cities, impacts the management of other national sectors such as health and The education It affects companies, commerce and the population itself.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Only effective articulation can help us resolve this difficult circumstance and make this crisis an opportunity to grow as a country and, in turn, help a population that left their homeland not because they wanted to, but because of difficult circumstances.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: And has there also been a return of Colombians to our country

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Thats how it is The studies that we have carried out with the United Nations during 2016 and 2017 show us percentages of more than 50 of Colombians in return and a high degree of population with dual nationality.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Our compatriots who went to Venezuela for decades today return with their families, many of them Venezuelans, and due to conditions of roots they are supported by our norms.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: You well know that this is not just an issue for Cúcuta, but for an entire region as complex as the ColombianVenezuelan border. Thats right our border with Venezuela has in addition to Cúcuta, another 53 municipalities in 7 departments.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The border of La Guajira, Norte de Santander or Arauca are very different, not to mention the particularities of Guainía or Vichada and without forgetting the tip of Boyacá with its municipality of Cubará or the department of Cesar.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The media has focused a lot on Cúcuta, where, obviously, there is a very large flow of income at the three border posts, but it is important that we think about all the border municipalities and the entire country, and therefore, the importance of these measures.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Could this management that the Foreign Ministry has been carrying out be affected by our electoral time

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The temptation to make proposals without seeing the consequences is very great.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The President made a call to face this issue as a State and with responsibility, which I believe is the way in which we can react as a country.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: But do you believe that there are perfect solutions that satisfy everyone

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: No, there are not, and sometimes it is very exhausting that everything seems bad.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: They question why they are invading their public space, but if we enable temporary homes for them, it is also bad because they say that we encourage them to stay.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: They say its unfortunate that we dont help them to get some livelihood, but if we give them a Special Permanence Permit to work, they also say its bad because they are taking jobs away from Colombians.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Despite the questioning, we must prioritize responsible measures with the country, that greatly protect the border areas and that mainly seek the greatest possible common interest.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: And in this sense, what has been the support of the international community

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: For more than a year we have been working permanently with the agencies of the United Nations system and applying some tools in migration facilitation processes, such as support in temporary care centers for migrants, in transportation and guidance in care systems from Colombia.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: It is known that the Foreign Ministry has had special contacts with Brazil and Turkey.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We have worked with the governments of Brazil and Turkey to have the best practices in such complex issues and until now little experienced in our country as this type of migration.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: With Turkey we have learned how to serve migrants in the best way How the reception of migrants is carried out makes the difference between having chaos and having a challenge that can be managed.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Couldnt the comments that the President has made about the Venezuelan situation be classified as intervention in the internal affairs of other nations

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: I dont see it that way, and I want to refer to a saying that some use When Venezuela has a cold, Colombia sneezes or vice versa.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We believe that the situation in Venezuela has an enormous impact on Colombia today and that is why the wellbeing of Venezuela will have all our interest, as well as the need to restore democracy.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Presidential elections were called for April 22 in that country.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Does Colombia maintain its position of ignorance of the results

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We will establish the position next Tuesday, at the meeting of the Lima Group.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Precisely, President Maduro announced that he will attend the Lima summit.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: President Maduro has accused Colombia of preventing the entry of food and medicine into Venezuela. It has never been like this.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: A single example demonstrates this at the end of December we learned that there were some trucks full of pork legs at the border, we checked and they had not carried out any formalities for the foreign trade customs operation.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: What happened is that we have an institutional framework and officials who comply with the procedures, and that is how it should be.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: After many protests in the media, the export was done as it should be.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: And the other accusation is that the Government of Colombia holds meetings with the opposition here in Bogotá The Venezuelan opposition has links with many sectors in Colombia and they have been coming to different meetings for a long time.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The Venezuelan opposition has been coming to different activities in Colombia for many years.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: On this subject, was there not and is there no dialogue with the Venezuelan government

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We wanted to, but it has not been possible to advance effectively.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We have sent them the message that we are ready to help them, but they have not accepted the humanitarian situation they have.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: Are you in favor of this dialogue taking place

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: We have always been in favor, but of a dialogue with results, with will, with decision, so that things change, but this has not been what has happened in the dialogues.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: I believe that the way out of this structural crisis that they have must be for the Venezuelans.

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: What do you think in general of the situation that the Venezuelan people are experiencing today

title: 'Colombia must show solidarity with the people of Venezuela' Holguín
text: The poverty in which we see thousands of Venezuelans spend is devastating the deterioration of the health of Venezuelans is impressive.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: According to the complaints, the foreigners were transported in a dump truck.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: Lilia del Carmen Rueda Olarte swore 339 times that she met and saw 339 countrymen born in Colombia who approached the Malambo Registry Office, Atlántico, to process their IDs and then their passports.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: A man who identified himself as Francisco Correa arrived at that same office and said he had known 1,759 people since childhood who were doing the same errand.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: In the list of his acquaintances there are names that are not very Creole, such as Chaban Mualem Mohamad, Guo Liqiang, Weng Keming and Yu Xieyong, who requested extemporaneous civil registries whose only requirement according to Law 1260 of 1970 is to bring two witnesses who attest of his birth in Colombia.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: But the supposed citizens of Malambo turned out to be foreigners and some of them paid between 700,000 pesos and a million to obtain papers, with the purpose of allowing them to jump to Europe, Mexico or Central America, where Colombians do not require a visa.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: Some of them have already had their false registration cancelled, and there are others under investigation.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: That is the case of two Lebanese citizens  El Jhandour Waked and Saty Waked Khaled  who obtained their civil records without witnesses and without providing basic information, such as the name of their parents and their addresses.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: This Wednesday, the Prosecutors Office, Migration Colombia and the National Registry of Civil Status announced the capture of seven registrars in Atlántico accused of being part of a network that has processed at least 8,000 of these false citizenships.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: But EL TIEMPO, which had access to the file, established that this is just one of the tentacles of the business, which has been operating for more than a decade in other departments, such as Valle del Cauca, Nariño, Amazonas, Cundinamarca and Antioquia.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: In an initial audit we found traces of 68,000 of these cases in the country.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: We know that many of the false Colombians managed to travel, but there are others who stayed, especially Venezuelans, explained an investigator.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: This means that the network has moved more than 470,000 million pesos in false documents.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: The alert about this mafia was raised at least a year and a half ago by Migración Colombia, after capturing several foreigners who swore to be Colombians, but did not speak Spanish, did not know the anthem and had never heard of a changua.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: Although the Registrars Office was alerted immediately, it was only when Juan Carlos Galindo arrived that an internal investigation was ordered.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: On June 7, after an audit of the Atlántico registries, we filed the complaint with the Prosecutors Office.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: The CTI traveled to the area and collected the evidence that, as revealed by the prosecutor Néstor Humberto Martínez, allowed part of the network to be dismantled, explained the registrar Galindo.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: The Antitrafficking and Trafficking Investigation Group, of Migración Colombia, and the CTI carried out the captures of the syndicated registrars.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: And he added that he ordered a systematic nationwide sweep to identify new cases.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: In addition, a circular was issued to the registrars so that they apply the socalled reasonable doubt when processing these registrations.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: Additionally, Christian Krüger Sarmiento, director of Migration Colombia, promotes a decree in this same sense.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: We seek to strengthen controls when issuing untimely birth registrations that are being used for immigrant trafficking.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: We are going to start demanding other documents that prove citizenship, Krüger said.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: As part of the investigation, the CTI and Immigration captured this Wednesday the special registrars of Barranquilla, Boris de Jesús Polo Padrón and Carlos Arturo González Torres the Malambo registrar, Arturo Jacinto Camargo Jiménez the Santo Tomás registrar, Hernando Antonio Peña Romero, and the Ponedera registrar, Juan Bautista Merino Mercado.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: The former officials of the Warner Bolívar Cueto Registrars Office, former registrar of Candelaria, and Luis Eduardo Manjarrés Moncada, who until four months ago worked as registrar of Luruaco, were also captured.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: According to the investigations, the network was led by Arturo Jacinto Camargo Jiménez, registrar of Malambo.

title: Network of registrars has _manufactured_ 68,000 false Colombians
text: It appears as the common thread and they point to setting rates to charge for the different illegal procedures.

title: ‘It was an exodus to earn a living at any cost’
