text: Fear of rejection and discriminationWhen Junior arrived in Colombia, his first destination was Barranquilla.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: There he stayed with some friends that he was able to contact from Venezuela, but during the five months that he was staying in their house he hid his situation for fear that he would be rejected, singled out or judged for his state of health.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: For Ricardo García, coordinator of the HIVAIDS prevention area of the Colombian League for the Fight against AIDS, silence due to fear of rejection or singling out is the biggest obstacle in the fight against prevention and care for HIVAIDS patients. .

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: There are many people who choose silence and prefer to live with the anguish of not saying anything for fear of deportation or rejection, it is a complex situation and we have experienced it as a team in the League.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: We have found that the Venezuelans who have arrived are very shy and very afraid to talk about their situation for fear of being deported.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: We in the League try to open the doors so that they feel confident in expressing themselves and talking about whatever they want, Ricardo asserts.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: The Ministry of Health ensures that the care for a person who has HIVAIDS infection must guarantee prevention, timely diagnosis and adequate treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: The basic services package in Colombia includes the provision of condoms, diagnostic tests, complementary tests including CD4 lymphocyte counts and viral load, as well as antiretroviral drugs and the supply of milk formulas for children born to mothers infected pregnant women.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: This package of services is guaranteed through the General Social Security System and is granted without copays or moderating fees to affiliates.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: However, many of the refugees and migrants with HIVAIDS are unaware that rapid tests exist in Colombia and do not know that they have the right to do them for free.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: In addition to this, the biggest problem faced by refugees and migrants with HIVAIDS is that most of them are irregularly in the country, which prevents their registration in a General Social Security System, hindering their care and treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: And I have to choose between paying them or paying the rentRefugees and migrants with irregular immigration status in the country are only entitled to emergency medical care, which does not include access to antiretroviral drugs.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Foundations such as Liga Sida, which has been working with the refugee and migrant population for eight years, offers personalized guidance and makes international aid alliances to provide better care.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: When a patient arrives in Colombia, you have to start treating them from scratch to find out what treatment they need.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: A patient with hepatitis B and HIV is different from a patient with tuberculosis, so the conditions of the patient for treatment have to be determined.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: When a patient arrives at our League, we listen to their situation, we see their panorama, not only their disease but their emotional environment  the test is taken  and depending on the result, it is channeled to the hospitals of the public network and the connection is made with the medical institution, points out Ricardo García, from Liga Sida.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: According to the UN Refugee Agency (Acnur), each person with HIVAIDS has the right to be treated in a nondiscriminatory manner, as well as to reserve and privacy regarding their health status.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Additionally, the State must ensure their access to asylum procedures and protection against refoulementexpulsion for refugees and asylum seekers, their protection against arbitrary detention and freedom from being forced to take HIV tests.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Access to health care, antiretroviral treatment, counseling and voluntary testing should be, as far as possible, guaranteed by the State.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: In some cases, HIVAIDS can be a legitimate case of refuge, as well as the situation of persecution due to a diagnosis of HIVAIDS.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: What steps must a refugee and migrant with HIVAIDS follow to receive care in Colombia

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: After five months of living in Barranquilla, Junior decided to travel to Bogotá in search of help for his treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Once in the capital and after spending a few nights in the transit camp at the Salitre terminal, he turned to the EUDES Foundation where he received his first orientation.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: For many refugees and migrants in a situation of HIVAIDS, the lack of information about a care route is the first obstacle in seeking treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: The most important, according to Acnur, is that the refugee or the migrant can regularize their migratory status in Colombia, either by requesting the Special Permanence Permit (PEP) or the refugee status if they have a legitimate case this in order that they can join the Colombian Health System (Sisbén).

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: All refugees and migrants who have the PEP or are asylum seekers have the right to the health system.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Even so, Colombian policy allows the treatment of those who do not have access to Sisbén only in the case of an emergency, which does not include continuous treatment for HIVAIDS.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: However, in the case of a medical emergency, everyone has the right to medical care regardless of their immigration status.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: If it is not possible to regularize your status, you can approach organizations that provide care for people with HIVAIDS who may be able to provide treatment, counselling, accommodation andor other support, depending on your situation.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Improvement in public policies to care for the refugee and migrant population with HIVAIDSFor UNHCR, HIVAIDS treatment must be recognized as an emergency so that people who are infected and do not have documents can access antiretroviral treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: It is recommended that the State ensure primary care for this population, particularly for those in the most advanced stages of the disease given their vulnerability to opportunistic infections.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: For this reason, the State could also provide sanitary accommodation for people with HIVAIDS or provide additional support to nongovernmental organizations that are already doing this work, states the Agency.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Added to this, there is a lack of capacity on the part of medical institutions to manage with the scale of the crisis of refugees and migrants from Venezuela, much less to manage with a population that is highly mobile, than for people living with HIVAIDS causes serious problems in the continuity of their medical treatment.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: It is necessary to guarantee an adequate amount of antiretrovirals, strengthen the capacity of medical institutions in response to HIVAIDS, and support organizations providing services to the Venezuelan population in the border area.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Ricardo García, from Liga Sida, states that it is necessary to improve the institutional conditions to admit those Venezuelan refugees and migrants with HIVAIDS to a health system where they can be provided with guarantees of quality in health care.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: This is a reality for which Colombia was not prepared, advances are being made with working groups of the organizations involved with the issue, but even so the resources are not enough, says García.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Foundations such as Eudes have a presence in seven cities in the country the League Against AIDS, in Bogotá the Censored Foundation, in Norte de Santander AIDS Healthcare Foundation, in Bogotá, Leticia and Cúcuta, and Pastoral Social, throughout the country, through its attention to asylum seekers.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: These organizations also have the function of guiding, informing and supporting the situation of refugees and migrants with HIVAIDS.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: According to the Ministry of Health, international cooperation resources are being mobilized to address the situation of the Venezuelan population in the country, including those with HIVAIDS.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: To date, there is an agreement of understanding signed between the Ministry of Health and Social Protection and the AIDS Healthcare Foundation, which, added to the donation of treatments for 500 people by the Brazilian government, has made it possible to start caring for patients in Cucuta.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Currently 174 people are being treated.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Through the same organization and with the support of the Presidential Program for Aid in AIDS (Pepfar, for its acronym in English) it is expected to expand care to nearly 3,000 more patients in the short term.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: For his part, Junior continues to fight in the streets of Bogotá selling cereal with yogurt to save money and thus buy his treatment pills.

title: Colombia, a life opportunity for Venezuelans with HIV-AIDS
text: Currently, he has a regular status in Colombia and hopes that he can survive his situation.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: The massive arrival of Venezuelans and Colombians residing in the neighboring country is a reality and a challenge for society and institutions.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: In the face of this phenomenon, there are many ways to react, from disastrous xenophobia to denial, passing through solidarity and the challenge of turning this migration crisis into an opportunity.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Decree 1288 signed last week by President Juan Manuel Santos makes it fortunately clear that this last option, with a humanitarian sense, continues to be the one assumed by the country.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: And this is good news hopefully this line is also that of the new government.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: The signals seen so far allow us to be optimistic.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: The measure guarantees access to basic services to 442,462 Venezuelans who registered in the registry set up by the Government at the beginning of the year, while offering Colombians who have returned the possibility of finding new directions for their lives.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Thanks to the decree, Venezuelans will be able to access emergency care, join the social security system through Sisbén, in addition to giving prenatal care to pregnant women.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: The norm also establishes facilities to validate educational titles and opens the doors to children to primary and secondary education.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Likewise, it provides opportunities for job orientation services.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Good to remember that all citizens of the neighboring country who were registered can legally work in the country.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Of course, not everything is rosy.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: It is true that this decision, worthy of applause and that contrasts with other walls that are erected around the world for migrants, must be seen in the light of the countrys own realities.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Here the crisis of the health system appears with its failures and delays in care and an unemployment figure that is already around 10 percent.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: But the foregoing must lead to the search for alternatives that allow balancing the solidarity that those who arrive in almost always precarious, if not dramatic, conditions on the other side of the border deserve, with the provision of basic goods and services by the Colombian State to its citizens. .

title: Migration and opportunities
text: It cannot lead, and this must be said forcefully, to discriminatory attitudes or situations  which are already beginning to be seen, unfortunately  of abuse of those who are in a situation of vulnerability.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: In other words to hire Venezuelan labor under illegal and cheap conditions, marginalizing national candidates along the way, feeding the vicious circle of xenophobia along the way.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: For this reason, the path of formalization, which is what this decree opens, is the one that must be taken even with the obstacles it presents, for which an open, constructive and fraternal attitude is required.

title: Migration and opportunities
text: Of course, it is possible to turn this migratory boom into an opportunity for the country to incorporate foreign talent into its economy and thus reach a scenario in which we all win.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: It belongs to us not only for humanitarian reasons, but for the social balance of the country.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: It is not about questioning the autonomy of Venezuela to take measures that allow it to solve serious problems in its regions, in this case smuggling and insecurity in the state of Táchira.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: They are not recommended, either, in the face of the crisis that is being faced there and that this week worsened  on both sides  after Nicolás Maduros decision to close the border crossings, those facile positions that seek to obtain electoral revenues.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Those that are based on readings that propose disrespectful and incendiary generalizations that ignore the complex reality that exists in a historically neglected area.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: It is also necessary to avoid the Manichean visions that put the good guys on one side and the bad guys on the other, that deny that both nations have their part, once the distribution of blame has arrived.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: That said, it must be affirmed, with total force, that the way in which the Venezuelan authorities have acted has crossed a line.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: The one that separates the regimes that understand that respect for human dignity prevails over any consideration and those that for the sake of their objectives  survival, sometimes  are capable of incurring the most infamous abuses.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: And it is that the way in which the members of the Public Force of the neighboring country have proceeded against the Colombians whom they have decided to deport can be described in no other way.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: As President Juan Manuel Santos stated, at times they have been treated not as human beings, but as animals.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: At the time of writing these lines, there were nearly six thousand compatriots who had returned, including deportees, returnees, even refugees and those who decided to return.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Instead of their belongings, they arrived loaded with stories of aggression, dispossession, and xenophobic attitudes from the Venezuelan authorities, which include a refusal to respect the right to due process of those who wanted to stay there and had legal arguments to do so.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: That is what cannot be accepted.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: The gratuitous stigmatization, the incitement to hatred for reasons of nationality, the aberrant procedures in which the houses of Colombians were marked with a letter to identify those that were requisitioned and those that were going to be demolished.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: An attack that was sufficiently documented.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Hence, the attitude of the Venezuelan Foreign Minister, Delcy Rodríguez, of suggesting that everything had been a setup by the media in our country, was so unfortunate.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Such a picture of forced exodus and abuses of those that humanity has proposed to leave behind so many times would force much more than trying to duck the nations of the area that have opted for a silence, not complicit, but at least functional. for Caracas.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: As if those who have traditionally held the baton of regional leadership Brazil and Mexico are so overwhelmed by their internal problems that waiting for them to show interest is a utopia.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: In this same sense, the attitude of the general secretary of Unasur, what a paradox, the former president Ernesto Samper, of aligning himself with Miraflores when a more open and fair stance was expected from him, which would allow building bridges rather than erecting barriers, has been reprehensible.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Now, the above has another side.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: And it is the exhaustion of the leadership that at the best moment of the Bolivarian revolution wanted to build Venezuela, starting with lowpriced oil.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: This weakening, which may well evolve into isolation, is one among several factors that determine the difficult present that the brave people are experiencing, and which in turn prevent them from looking optimistically at the immediate future.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Hopelessness that could well be translated into an adverse result for the official hosts in the December 6 elections.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: Hence, not a few see a relationship between what is happening now and the proximity of that date.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: A bet that Juan Manuel Santos has been able to read, who, it must be recognized, has acted correctly, giving alternatives to those who have returned through a management that will be in charge of providing them with both humanitarian aid and opportunities in terms of employment and education. .

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: At the same time, in the diplomatic field he has shown firmness against Caracas, but without falling into the game of provocations raised by his counterpart.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: The fact that the number of those who return has not increased after the governments decision to resort to the Unasur foreign ministers is encouraging.

title: Editorial On the border of provocation
text: It is also important to highlight the unity that was woven around the Government, with the parties and unions in the forefront.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Download the new version of our app and activate it so you dont miss out on our best content.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: When she arrived in Medellín, Irulú Labarca, a Venezuelan university professor with a doctorate in entrepreneurship and 18 years of experience in business creation, crashed into a wall that she thought was insurmountable she called it the paisa code for doing business.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: She, a seasoned and skillful merchant in her country, once again felt like a beginner in an ecosystem that she was just beginning to digest.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: In my country, they negotiate quickly.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Here everything is much slower, because pacts are not made between businessmen but between friends.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: First you must build friendship and trust.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: It is necessary to make the interlocutor fall in love, to convince him and that is a very slow process, he recalls today, four years after arriving in Colombia.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But Irulú turned that hazing into a growth opportunity for his compatriots in this country.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Currently in the capital of Antioquia, according to Colombia Migration, there are 85,062 Venezuelan citizens.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And one in five of them, that is, 20, is unemployed, reported in a 2019 study by the National Administrative Department of Statistics (Dane).

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Many of us who come here want to do business, but by not knowing the terrain we make mistakes or we cant get closer to our goals.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And this city has a very rich entrepreneurial ecosystem.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: For this reason, the concern arose to create an organization that could serve as a bridge between Venezuelan entrepreneurs, their possible Colombian strategic partners and the entities that support these initiatives, he says.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And so, in October 2016, Emprecolven was born, a nonprofit organization that, in the words of its creators, of which Irulú is a part, seeks that migrants can have a much smoother landing than the one we had to us upon arrival.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: A highly trained population, poorly paid, submerged in informality and with serious difficulties in having, not only positions consistent with their preparation, but also stable ones.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: This is the scenario outlined in the study Labor Outlook for Venezuelan Migrants in Colombia 20142019, by the Externado University of Colombia, launched at the end of February.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: This document indicates that there are currently 1,771,237 Venezuelan migrants in Colombia.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Of that universe, one million are fit for work.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: In this group, almost one in five, 18, has a university, technical or technological degree, that is, a population with a high level of training.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: However, working conditions are far from fair, if not totally unfair.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Venezuelans earn less than Colombians, although they work longer hours.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: 2 less if they are selfemployed (626,000 pesos per month compared to 710,000) and approximately 10 less if they are salaried (1.27 million compared to 1.39 million), states the Externado report.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And he adds that nine out of every ten migrants who manage to work do not have formal social security coverage.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: This, according to the document, suggests that many Venezuelans are now hired without social guarantees also in larger companies, formal in principle.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But, in addition, sending a resume or applying to a hiring process does not seem to be a viable alternative eight out of ten Venezuelans who seek work do so through word of mouth or the recommendation of an acquaintance.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And that also becomes a focus of informality for them.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: These inequalities persist for several reasons, according to the study on the one hand, few employers know what the requirements are for hiring people from another country and, on the other, there are many problems faced by them to legalize their stay and have a document that allow them to work.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: This, added to the bureaucratic viacrucis in which it is transformed to homologate and certify in Colombia studies done in higher education institutions abroad.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: An example of all this is Iraidely Mendoza.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Insecurity expelled her from Venezuela.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: He felt he reached his limit when all his video and photography equipment was taken from him.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Professional in visual arts and specialist in digital marketing, he decided to try his luck in Colombia.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But the first months were impossible.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: He almost couldnt regularize his migratory situation I didnt have acquaintances here, I didnt know how or what kind of visa to get.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: I had to return to my country several times, until a friend advised me, she explains.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Once he managed to legalize his stay in the country, he was able to do some freelance work, but far from his true ambition to resume visual art and create his own company.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And in the midst of closed doors and difficulties, he managed to connect with Emprecolven.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: She attended some of the free workshops and liked the topic so much that she decided to join the initiative.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: I liked that here a lot of importance is given to networking, to the work of connections in favor of inclusion between Venezuelans and Colombians.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: It seeks to contact the entrepreneur with whom he can support, finance or buy.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: In addition, you can teach and learn how business is done and ties are created in this country, says Iraidely.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: And as part of that learning, he was able to gradually let go of informal jobs, make contacts, form a team, and dedicate energy to his digital marketing company Ideatorio Estudio Creativo, an initiative that meets the advertising needs of companies or personal brands.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: That is our objective in the workshops and training to build bridges.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: We teach how to live with the way of doing business in the country, to understand how the land works.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But we also seek to understand the legal requirements, tax issues, regulations and procedures.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Then, we always provide a space for contacts, so that there are business roundtables and public relations between the members, Colombians and Venezuelans, of the entrepreneurial ecosystem, affirms Irulú Labarca.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Later, Iraidely complements We do not have our own resources.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: We get the room, organize it and make the call.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: We work with our nails, but fortunately it has worked.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: To date, Emprecolven has managed to approach 1,500 entrepreneurs through strategic alliances and free workshops with the support, among others, of the Medellin Chamber of Commerce, Comfama, the ColomboVenezuelan Chamber, Acnur, AcdiVoca and the International Organization for Migration (IOM), among others.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: The difficulties faced by professionals in Venezuela to access jobs in accordance with their preparation reduce their satisfaction in the midst of the Colombian labor market.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: The feeling remains that a focus of talent is being wasted that could bring new business perspectives to the country.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: The Externado analysis shows that while Colombian workers show increasing satisfaction indicators, something totally opposite happens with migrants During the 20182019 period, only 50.9 of Venezuelan workers considered their employment stable , compared to 66.2 between 20142015.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: The proportion of employed persons who are satisfied with their employment also decreased (from 83.5 to 72.4), with the benefits received (from 56.1 to 42.9) and with the working day (from 83. 7 to 69.2).

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: The desire to change jobs increased from 29.2 of the total employed to 48.4.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: For Emprecolven members, business creation and innovation may be the engine, the trigger, to improve these negative indicators.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But not only that, talent could also be promoted and more productively inserted those who had to leave their country.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: According to them, it is about allowing migration to contribute all its enormous potential for the economic growth of this country.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: There are many desired fields and in which there is much to grow if one dares to create their own company.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: We have detected several in our workshops one of them is undoubtedly gastronomy, because we have similar palates there are also many professionals in the hairdressing sector, specialists in online marketing, graphic design, photography and IT, just to mention a few professions where there are plenty of qualified personnel, emphasizes Irulú.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Although for now the organization operates in Medellin, it will seek to expand its radius of action through online courses.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: Likewise, it works on the creation and definition of an entrepreneurs own route, which will become a practical guide to advance step by step in the creation of companies in Colombia, not only for Venezuelans, but also for returned Colombians and nationals who want to join in generating entrepreneurship using binational talent.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: But that will require a lot of perseverance towards the future.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: As Irulú says We are looking for resources, participating in many calls.

title: The network that promotes Colombian-Venezuelan entrepreneurship
text: It has not been easy, but all entrepreneurs know that throwing in the towel is prohibited.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: Sources from the Presidency of the Republic indicated that President Juan Manuel Santos is preparing a speech for Tuesday night in which he will refer to the events that occurred on the border with Venezuela.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: President Juan Manuel Santos arrived this Saturday at noon in Cúcuta, epicenter of the border crisis with Venezuela, in the midst of bilateral tension after the massive expulsion of Colombians by the government of Nicolás Maduro.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: The president visited one of the shelters set up to receive the hundreds of Colombians deported in recent days or who have arrived in the country fleeing from Venezuela.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: Santos assured that the expelled nationals will receive financial support and their children will return to school.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: We are going to help them in everything we can, we are going to give them employment and that children go to school and not miss a single day of class.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: The president added that he is waiting for the government of the neighboring country to authorize the passage of trucks willing to pass and support the transfer of the compatriots waxes to Colombia.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians
text: There we still have the trucks ready.

title: _Here we are to assist you_ Santos to expelled Colombians

title: Border Mobility Card, how is it processed and what is it for?
text: Starting this Wednesday, Colombia again enabled the process of issuing the Border Mobility Card (TMF), an identity document for Venezuelans residing in the neighboring country that allows their free mobility through the border areas of the national territory.

title: Border Mobility Card, how is it processed and what is it for?
text: This identification system, operated by Migración Colombia, began operating in May 2017, and managed to register a total of 1,637,778 foreigners.

title: Border Mobility Card, how is it processed and what is it for?
text: The discovery of more than 90,222 counterfeit cards for extortion purposes forced former President Juan Manuel Santos to suspend his issuance earlier this year.

title: Border Mobility Card, how is it processed and what is it for?

title: Border Mobility Card, how is it processed and what is it for?

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Nicolás Maduro, president of the neighboring country, ordered the border closure after several Venezuelan soldiers in Táchira state were injured in an attack attributed to Colombian criminals.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: After more than three months of having decreed the government of the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, the state of exception and after ordering the closure of the border with Colombia, the effects have not been long in coming.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Justified with the arguments of fighting against smuggling mafias that caused distortions in trade and against those who set the price of the dollar in Venezuela at the border, supposedly at will, the measure has hit trade, employment, tourism and, particularly, to the nearly 19,000 Colombians who were expelled or were forced to leave that country, where they lost their property.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: At the economic level, the effects of the fall in binational trade are evident, although it must be remembered that since 2008, when there was a record in the exchange, the figures between the two countries have been in a clear decline, caused in partly because of political disagreements and also because of the policies imposed by the Government of Caracas that have restricted access to foreign currency by businessmen and the Executive itself, which has caused distortions in trade.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: During last August  the border closure took place on the 20th  Colombian sales to Venezuela totaled 94 million dollars but in September, when the restriction began to be fully felt, exports to that country plummeted to 59 million dollars. dollars, according to the statistics of the National Administrative Department of Statistics, (Dane).

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: In any case, it must be clarified that binational trade also moves by plane and by ship.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: In September 2014, Colombian exports had reached 155 million dollars, very far from those of that same month, but of 2008, when they had been 457 million dollars at the maximum moment of exchange.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: In any case, it is worrying that trade between neighbors, which has been deteriorating for seven years, is now being affected by a more drastic drop, since, according to Dane figures, in the first nine months of the year Colombian exports reached 865 million dollars, and will hardly exceed 1,000 million dollars in all of 2015, that is, half of those sent in 2014.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: And on the part of Venezuela, its sales to Colombia reflect the strong economic crisis that has one of its most visible faces in the drop in production and that is shown in the strong shortage of all kinds of basic products.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: This year (first nine months), that country has sold Colombia just 208 million dollars.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Some voices from Venezuela have said that in the more than three months that the border has been closed, the losses for that country exceed 400 million dollars, represented in the drop in trade and lower income from tourism, especially.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Not to mention a growing shortage of products that also fuels a higher cost of living.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: For Cúcuta, which even before the border closure registered the second highest unemployment rate in the country (14.4 percent of the population of working age), the arrival of Colombians from Venezuela has been adding pressure to that indicator, Well, according to data from the Mayors Office of the northern Santander capital, 3,000 families settled in the city.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Although the Colombian government has adopted measures to alleviate the effects of the closure, such as the VAT exemption for trade until December 31, many see this as a shortterm solution.

title: Border closure, a business relationship in which both lose _R
text: Another affected sector is that of the moneychangers because the not very fluid binational exchange has been paralyzed by almost 80 percent, which affects employment.

text: Around 40,000 Venezuelans in Colombia want to return to their country due to the crisis they are going through caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: But in the last hours, due to the decision of the Government of Venezuela to close the border crossing through Norte de Santander, many of them were left with the uncertainty of how to return to the neighboring country.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Faced with this, the director of Migration Colombia, Juan Francisco Espinosa, spoke with EL TIEMPO and pointed out that this Friday Venezuela informed them that they would open again, but that the Government is skeptical that this will happen.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: What were the reasons why the entry of Venezuelans through the Simón Bolívar international bridge was closed

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: The decision, as we were informed by the immigration authorities, is due to the high congestion of people who come from the other side of the border due to the kind of shelters they have established.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Specifically, this restriction is for the Simón Bolívar international bridge, which is where the steps for this health emergency are taking place.How many people go out there daily

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: What we had achieved is an organized passage of 200 people early in the day where the weather conditions are favorable and they have food that allows them to advance towards Venezuela, where what happens on the other side is unknown.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: In La Guajira there is no permanent crossing and we have managed to establish humanitarian crossings that have been between 5 and 6 times.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: What we do is maintain a balance between the Venezuelans right to migrate and the protection that Colombians deserve in the border area.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: All of this seeks to prevent the border zone departments and municipalities from collapsing, and we have been achieving this.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: The Táchira Integral Defense Operational Zone indicated that it was a disinfection and that they were going to reopen, has the passage been opened

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Normally this border opens at 5 in the morning and 200 people cross the border in a coordinated manner.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: That did not happen today and after we communicated the situation in Venezuela they told us that there was a decision by the Venezuelan army that they were going to open it today, really we are skeptical, but it is our benefit that the permanent exit of the Venezuelan migrant population.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: We believe that it is a fundamental right of a Venezuelan national to be able to enter his country, but we must wait if this was a delayed reaction for today and what will happen tomorrow.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: For now, this governments act that respects human rights is to suspend the movement of buses to the border area and request a greater presence of the public force and Police, which has already been done, and request additional support for the attention of the people who have remained in that border area pending passage by international cooperation.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Did they tell you a probable time to open the border

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: They talked about 10 in the morning, but we are waiting for what will happen.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Apparently they were going to receive some people today.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: What is really important is the sustainability of the passage, this is not solved by allowing a number of people to pass in one day.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: We need a definite decision of a permanent step for the benefit of Venezuelan migrants.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: How many people are waiting to return to Venezuela through Cúcuta

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: That is a figure that varies permanently because it is sensitive to the economic reality of different cities.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: The majority of Venezuelan migrants depend on informal markets and these are absolutely sensitive to the closure or uprising measures generated by the different cities and when the economy of a city begins to reactivate they immediately cease their intention to travel to Venezuela.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: At this time, the records we have would speak of 40,000 people in the national territory who are interested in leaving through the north of Santander, Arauca and Riohacha.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Does this decision of the Venezuelan Government promote illegal steps through that area

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: These types of decisions are absolutely reprehensible for various reasons one of these is that they promote irregularity and the exposure of people through irregular steps and trails that have a proven criminal presence, and these people in a state of vulnerability are subjected to tolls and charges that are absolutely contrary to the law.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: We emphatically reject this type of decision that does nothing but lead the population to irregularity and the exposure of their lives and their rights.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: Now that Venezuela is not going to allow its nationals to enter through the Simón Bolívar international bridge, could there be a collapse of Colombians who want to return to other points

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: At this time there is no traffic jam, there have been some moments of tension and we have gone out to quickly attend to this situation.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: There is always some variable when it comes to walkers, and we have been organizing this.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: You have indicated that a return of Venezuelans to the country is expected again, when is it expected and how are you preparing

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: This return is already taking place and what we have done is generate some devices that enforce the closure of borders that has been established, this seeks to protect the country from the situation of contagion in which it is.

title: _40,000 Venezuelans are trying to return to their country today_ Director of Migration
text: This situation of return is already taking place, a pressing need for people to return to search for a future in Colombia and what we have done hand in hand with the Minister of Defense and the Armed Forces is to increase the control points.

text: That is the last memory released of a minor who ended up recruited by the ELN in Nariño and spent part of her childhood patrolling in the middle of coca fields in that department.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: She is one of the more than 16,800 children who have been recruited by illegal groups throughout the armed conflict and forced to bear arms in the country, according to a report by the National Center for Historical Memory.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: The most recent report of the UN Secretary General to the Security Council of that body says that in all of 2018, a total of 120 cases of recruitment and use were verified, affecting 293 children in the country.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: In 2017 there had been 169 children subjected to this practice, which represented an increase of 73.3 percent, which was recorded when the FARC had already laid down their weapons and it was believed that the children were safe from the considered largest recruiter of minors. from the country.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: But the new dynamics of the conflict, control over illegal income and disputes between criminal gangs ended up putting weapons back into the hands of minors, the vast majority of whom come from rural areas and belong to the most vulnerable families.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: Intelligence sources from the Public Force estimated that there are currently between 45 and 55 minors in the ranks of the Eln, with the Western war front, which commits crimes in Chocó, being the largest recruiter, with some 30 children.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: They also pointed out that the FARC dissidents would have around 100 minors in their ranks, most of them in block 62, who commit crimes in Guaviare, where there would be around 40 minors.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: For their part, sources from the Prosecutors Office, which is in charge of prosecuting those responsible for this internationally banned practice, pointed out that the figures may be higher, but that the lack of complaints by the relatives of the minors, who in many cases continue to live in the areas where the executioners of their children rule, makes it very difficult to have data that is closer to reality and to advance in criminal proceedings against the perpetrators.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: But being forced to leave their homes to join illegal groups is just one part of a chain of violence to which children are forced in the historic tragedy of child recruitment in Colombia.

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop

title: Minors taken to war a crime that still does not stop
text: There is also a record of how many children, in addition to being injured, end up dying, as happened on August 29 after a bombing against a Farc dissident camp in Caquetá, which caused the death of 8 minors.
