title: Registered Venezuelans will have special permission
text: Other destinations where this population is more concentrated are La Guajira, with 11.7 percent, followed by Norte de Santander, with 11.4 percent.

title: Registered Venezuelans will have special permission
text: Then comes Atlántico, with 9.7 percent, where Colombians who were in that country decades ago are also returning.

title: Registered Venezuelans will have special permission
text: Some 300,000 Colombians have returned from Venezuela, many of them to the Atlantic, said Krüger, who added that 60 percent of the migration stays in Colombia.

title: Registered Venezuelans will have special permission
text: While 40 percent goes to the south of the continent.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Also in other provisional shelters that we have created as a diocese, especially in a place called La Parada, practically on the bridge, he said.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: It is in no way an exaggeration to say that the massive migration of Venezuelan citizens is already one of the greatest challenges that Colombia has had to face in its entire history.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: A challenge, furthermore, shared with the rest of the nations of the continent, as was made clear at the meeting that eleven countries from the area held in Quito at the beginning of the month to seek a mandatory comprehensive and coordinated response.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: The raw postcard of this drama is that of the walkers on the roads of the country.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Without money even for a bus ticket, people from the neighboring country march towards urban centers where they can find some relief for their pressing needs.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: The scene that Bumangueses appreciate today in the Water Park, or the one in the lot near the transport terminal in Bogotá, in which the newcomers are under tents, are two of the most visible due to their location, but scenes like this abound in our cities.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: The administration of Enrique Peñalosa has already disbursed 26,000 million pesos to serve migrants and has seen the need to create a management that coordinates the efforts of the different district agencies to offer help to this population.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Returning to the general panorama, it should be noted that the most reliable figures, from the United Nations, speak of 2.5 million Venezuelans who have left their country in the last two years.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: But, according to other sources, this figure may be much higher, and, consequently, the million men, women and children in Colombia today may be ostensibly higher.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Beyond this discussion, the truth is that the flow does not stop nor does it show signs of doing so.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: As long as there is no event that means a real change in the way the neighboring country is governed, migration will continue.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: The debacle of the economy has only increased, as recent measures have exacerbated the shortage of food, medicine and other basic necessities, while inflation advances uncontrollably.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: As several experts have pointed out, this phenomenon surpasses another that has perhaps had greater visibility, such as that of those that reach the European coasts by sea from Asia and Africa, mainly.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Here, a number draws attention from 2014 to today, 1.8 million people have arrived on the beaches of the Old Continent, a figure lower than that of the exodus that concerns us today.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: And, as the president of the InterAmerican Development Bank, the Colombian Luis Alberto Moreno, rightly stated in a column published in The Washington Post, there is a considerable difference between the resources and tools available to the countries of that part of the world to serve those who knock on its door and those available to South American nations, some of which are unable to provide basic goods and services for their own citizens.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Only Colombia will have to allocate to this front a sum that is valued at hundreds of millions of dollars annually.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: A state of affairs like this forces the other countries in the area and, in general, the entire international community to unite in a response that, for now, must begin with attention to the basic needs of those who flee.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: It also imposes the utmost serenity and good sense, two traits that, as is shown every day, ceased to be seen in Miraflores a long time ago, but which the leaders of the region are obliged to show off, particularly when the combination of factors has created a fertile ground for nationalism and xenophobia.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Relying on international law and collective action at the diplomatic level will be essential in the face of the belligerence and aggressiveness of Nicolás Maduro, which will increase as the crisis worsens.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: In this order of ideas, it is valid to echo Morenos call so that international aid, which has already been requested and is beginning to arrive, be channeled through a fund.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Resources must come from it not only for immediate attention to migrants, but also for all the efforts made by the countries so that these people are incorporated into the societies that have welcomed them.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Although today it sounds utopian, it is worth remembering that situations like this, critical and distressing, have the potential to become an opportunity to generate growth and wellbeing for all if the matter is given the appropriate treatment.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: That is that the funds received are administered with total efficiency and transparency so that they reach where they are truly needed.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: In the past, Venezuela welcomed hundreds of thousands of people who, for various reasons, fled their place of origin or were looking for a better future.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: Not only to Colombians, but to people from many latitudes.

title: A huge and unprecedented challenge
text: It is time for this gesture to be returned in spades.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: President of the Autonomous Municipal Sports and Recreation Institute of the Sucre municipality (Miranda State)This column appears today in the Caracas newspaper El Nacional

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The plenary session of the European Parliament approved this Thursday a resolution that praises the reaction of the Colombian Government with all Venezuelans who arrive in its territory fleeing the humanitarian crisis and asks Brazil and Peru to do the same to the best of their ability.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: They consider the protection work through public and private entities and the Catholic Church and private citizens in the region as a whole to be commendable, who have actively helped Venezuelan refugees and migrants and have shown their solidarity.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: In this sense, they also demand that the member states provide an immediate protection response to Venezuelan migrants or refugees in their territory through, for example, humanitarian visas, special stay provisions or other regional migratory frameworks, with the corresponding guarantees. of protection.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: In this sense, they ask the Venezuelan authorities to facilitate and expedite the issuance and renewal of identification documents to their own nationals, whether in Venezuela or abroad.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: In the resolution agreed by the four large groups of the European Parliament, after a visit to the borders of Venezuela with Brazil and Colombia to verify the difficulties of the region in dealing with the humanitarian crisis, it also asks the whole of the international community, including the European Union (EU), that a coordinated response be established and financial aid intensifiedMEPs welcome the Unions humanitarian assistance allocated to date, but call for additional aid to be urgently released through emergency funds, in order to cope with the rapidly increasing needs of those affected by the Venezuelan crisis in neighboring countries.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: On the other hand, the European Parliament reiterated, in line with the more than five resolutions of recent years, the demand that the Venezuelan Government respect human rights, release political prisoners, lift restrictions on humanitarian aid and call as soon as possible democratic elections.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The European Parliament also asked the members of the European Union (EU) to release emergency aid for Venezuela and the regions neighbors, such as Colombia, Brazil or Peru, who suffer from the exodus of Venezuelans fleeing their country.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: MEPs welcome the EU humanitarian assistance allocated to date, but call for additional aid to be urgently released through emergency funds, in order to cope with the rapidly increasing needs of those affected by the Venezuelan crisis in neighboring countries.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The European Parliament also asks the Venezuelan authorities to facilitate and speed up the issuance and renewal of identification documents to their own nationals, whether in Venezuela or abroad.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The debate prior to the vote in plenary also became an almost unanimous condemnation against the government of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, who received criticism from popular, social democrats and liberals, groups that have 474 of the 750 seats in the European hemicycle.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The first to speak was the European Commissioner for Humanitarian Aid and Crisis Management, Christos Stylianides, who thanked the EP for generating a lot of visibility to the situation of thousands of Venezuelans who are fleeing their country.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The UN refugee agency (UNHCR) estimates that Colombia is home to some 800,000 people from the Venezuelan diaspora and Brazil another 50,000 individuals.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: They also flee to Peru, which has received some 400,000 Venezuelans.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: Also to Ecuador, to Caribbean countries, said the Eurocommissioner, who recalled that, according to UNHCR data, since 2014 there are more than 2 million Venezuelans who have left their country, of which more than 60 are in a situation irregular.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The Eurocommissar recalled that the European Union approved in June a new humanitarian aid endowed with 35 million euros (about 41 million dollars) to help the Venezuelan people and neighboring countries.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: As president of the parliamentary mission that traveled to the Colombian border and Bogotá at the end of June, the Spanish MEP Agustín Díaz de Mera, of the European Peoples Party (EPP), recognized that that country is making an effort to help its neighbors, but Colombians cannot do it alone.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The European Parliament on Thursday urged the Venezuelan government of Nicolás Maduro to admit the current humanitarian crisis in his country, and thus allow urgent access to international aid.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: The European Parliament demands that Venezuela allow the entry of humanitarian aid and urges the EU to release more funds to assist Venezuelans fleeing the country.

title: The European Parliament thanks Colombia for the support it gives to Venezuelans
text: pic.twitter.comLjSqLJf4bU European Parliament (Europarl_ES) July 5, 2018By 455 votes in favor, 100 against and 28 abstentions, the MEPs meeting in Strasbourg (northeastern France) express in a resolution their deep dismay and alarm at the bleak humanitarian situation in Venezuela.

title: What happened in Venezuela deserves condemnation from the whole world
text: The European Parliament demands that the Venezuelan authorities urgently allow unrestricted access for humanitarian aid to the country to prevent the aggravation of the humanitarian and public health crisis.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: For Michael Shifter, president of the InterAmerican Dialogue based in Washington DC, the decision was due to purely electoral calculations Maduro calculated that he could generate some internal support and distract attention from the countrys serious economic and social problems, but he He was wrong, as last Sundays elections showed.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Ronal Rodríguez, a researcher at the Venezuelan Observatory of the Universidad del Rosario, believes that the different views of the governments regarding the border is decisive in the clashes.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Venezuela sees it as a security problem and a threat against Chavismo, while Colombia sees it as an exercise in economic development.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Historically, bilateral relations have always been strained in the midst of brotherhood, especially due to the tendency of Venezuelan governments to encourage nationalism with antiColombianism when internal political crises arise, but due to the political and ideological affinities between the rulers, Finally, relations focused on trade, with Venezuela being the main market for Colombia.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: This exchange continued with the arrival of the leftist Hugo Chávez to power, when trade between the two nations reached 7,000 million dollars, until the ideological differences with President Álvaro Uribe Vélez deteriorated relations and the border line became an issue. security for both countries.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: When Juan Manuel Santos took office, relations with Venezuela became more conciliatory and pragmatic, to the point of Hugo Chávez being essential for the FARC to sit down to negotiate peace and that country act as guarantor of the process.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: But the cost for Bogotá has been the silence it has had to keep in the face of constant verbal attacks from Caracas.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Something that Shifter describes as caution, while Rodríguez describes it as a soft attitude that has allowed the neighboring country to assume a dominant position in the relationship.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: However, after the closure of the border, Santos has toughened his speech against the Maduro government by pointing out that the economic crisis is the sole fault of Venezuela and that insecurity is on both sides of the dividing line.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Even the head of state called for transparency in the legislative elections and came to interfere in internal affairs, such as requesting the release of opposition figure Leopoldo López, and even had the luxury of not accepting a meeting at the request of Maduro for last month.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: According to analysts, this attitude of the Colombian President has several reasons.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: First, that the peace process with the FARC is already on its own and the presence of Venezuela is not vital for its continuity the commercial exchange in the first nine months of the year barely reached 954 million dollars, and with the border closed, little could be worse.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: In addition, both Uribe and Santos are totally opposed to the Venezuelan economic and political model, which is why their relations with the Bolivarian revolution have been more of convenience than of political, ideological and even personal affinity.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: The overwhelming victory of the opposition in the December 6 elections and the new political reality in Venezuela, in Shifters opinion, could lead to a reopening of the border, since Maduro knows that this aggressive policy did not help him, and I did not I would be surprised if a policy of conciliation begins and that it avoids more confrontations.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: On the other hand, for the researcher from the Venezuelan Observatory, the situation is not as easy as it seems because Colombia has created distrust both in the government and in the opposition.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: The country has played a role in favor of the Bolivarian revolution, either due to silence or political convenience, so the opposition could have a collection bill saved, adds Rodríguez.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: And this is where it is urgent that Colombia decide what role it is going to play in the long and complex Venezuelan transition that is coming if it is going to be a rapprochement between the parties, in favor of one of them, or it will distance itself and let them solve their problems, what has to be given as a State policy, not just a government policy, explains Rodríguez.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: The problems at the border are common and deep.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: Cúcuta is a city with one of the highest unemployment and informality in the country, as well as poverty a GDP below the national average and with very little industrialization.

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R

title: Colombia and Venezuela, a crisis that does not end_R
text: It is hoped that this crisis in the area will finally help the central governments to see the need to work together for comprehensive measures to get it out of the social, economic and security emergency in which it finds itself, and that the historical abandonment to which has been subjected to be a thing of the past.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: PEDRO MIGUEL VARGAS NÚÑEZFor the timeCucuta

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: The Tax and Customs Police delivered a balance of the operations carried out since last August 19, the date on which the president of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, ordered the closure of the border with Colombia.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: 215 Colombians and 45 Venezuelans have been captured since the closure of the border crossing, likewise 34 illegal crossings have been dismantled on the border of the departments of La Guajira and Norte de Santander.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: We are exercising drastic control on the trails that connect Venezuela to Colombia (.), the criminal chain of smuggling is being attended to in each of its components, said General Gustavo Moreno, Director of the Fiscal and Customs Police.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: Likewise, the authorities have dismantled 128 stalls where contraband products were sold.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: The Fiscal and Customs Police, the Directorate of National Taxes and Customs (DIAN), with the support of the National Army, have been intensifying border controls, which have allowed the seizure of merchandise valued at 347,594 million pesos.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: In a meeting with the Governor (of Norte de Santander), it was decided to install the departmental committee against smuggling, money laundering and tax evasion, in order to recover not only the departmental sales that target investments in health , education, recreation and sports, said the general.

text: In the operations, 406 vehicles have also been immobilized 103 Colombians and 303 Venezuelans.

title: 260 people captured in 196 days of border closure
text: In the 2,219 kilometers of the ColombianVenezuelan border, the authorities have 47 operational control points in six departments 20 points in La Guajira, 4 points in Cesar, 13 in the department of Norte de Santander, 3 in Vichada, 3 in Arauca and 4 in Guanía.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He assured that new EPS should be enabled to enter regions to protect the lives of Colombians.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: 197,000 health protection actionsJorge Enrique Calero Chacón, deputy ombudsman, said that the main barriers are that there are not enough service networks due to the illiquidity and accumulation of insurance portfolios, which adds to the uncertainty due to the liquidation of some EPS.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: Regarding guardianships, he said that of 607,000 guardianships in 2017, 197,000 actions were for the right to health, 32 percent of the total.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He said that the most supervised EPS are Medimás (Cafesalud), with an increase compared to 2016.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He said that he identified 74,000 cases of denial of services in the subsidized regime, and in the contributory system more than 1.7 million denials due to prescriptions without supply.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: The deputy defender said that the specialties with the most tutelage are neurology, orthopedics, oncology, and urology.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He also said that for this year there will be more guardianships, since until October there were 178,734 actions, 33.95 percent of the total number of guardianships filed.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: At the end of the year, guardianships will exceed 210,000 actions, said the deputy defender.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: In 2017, he assured, 71 percent of health technologies were denied, which means an increase of 32 percent compared to 2016.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: Finally, he said that the structural problems that gave rise to the Courts ruling in 2008 have not been overcome by the statutory health law.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: There are EPS that do not meet the operating conditionsThe Delegate Attorney for Health, Luis Adolfo Díazgranado, pointed out that he is concerned that there are EPSs that have special surveillance and have not improved or corrected their path.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He assured that there are 16 entities with special surveillance, of which many of them have been under surveillance for more than 6 years.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: That is why the Attorney Generals Office asked to remove the fiscal auditors from these institutions and appoint special comptrollers who can monitor these entities.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He said that the Attorney Generals Office has received more than 3,700 complaints this year due to poor service and noncompliance by the EPS.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: He also said that there is corruption such as recognition of incentives so that procedures are not carried out, delay in assigning appointments, mainly specialized ones, which can generate service congestion.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: The delegate attorney said that the deficit in the health service has not been solved, it has been getting worse, and there are worrying situations such as recoveries it is a tumor that was generated in the health system, that was not intervened in time, and that adds to the issues of corruption.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: The portfolio between insurers and providers is also worrying.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: The prosecutor said that guardianships have grown every year and last year there were more than 87,000 guardianships, while the Court has received more than one million guardianships for health services The gateway for users to health recognition is the judicial route, and that cannot be.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: Faced with corruption in the health sector, he assured that although it cannot be generalized, there are people who are immersed in this behavior It is a trend that is becoming more perfect every day, such as diversion from the UPC, payments for services not provided, cartels health, HIV, hemophilia, down syndrome, the cane, the cartel of embargoes, said the official.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: Convictions for mismanagement of health moneyThe Comptroller General assured that in the last 8 years that body has produced 267 rulings with fiscal responsibility that add up to 2.1 billion pesos for mismanagement with Colombian health resources.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: The Comptroller Delegate for the Social Sector, José Antonio Soto Murgas, affirmed that 437 people have been sentenced fiscally (322 natural persons and 115 legal persons) and the main causes of the convictions areAcquisition of goods or elements that have nothing to do with the health serviceDuplication of records in databasesAnother form of corruption is that the resources of the Capitation Payment Unit (UPC), the money that each EPS receives for its number of affiliates, is being used for administrative expenses.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: In addition, the Comptroller detected bonus payments to EPS officials irregularly.

title: Convictions for mismanagement in health total 2.1 billion Comptroller
text: Of the money lost from health resources, the Comptrollers Office has recovered 179 billion pesos within 829 open processes. Of the processes, some 187 have come from citizen complaints.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: If the exit is given in violation of the law, by trail, they are exposed to sanctions.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: The odyssey of the two daughters and six grandchildren of Íngrid González began more than two weeks ago, when they began the walk from Barranquilla to Maicao, with one goal to return to Venezuela, something that has become a drama for many Venezuelans.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: The daughters, in their 30s, and who had been working for six and two years respectively as domestic workers, lost their jobs during the covid19 quarantine and could not afford their rent, says Íngrid from Venezuela.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: In Maicao, the daughters and grandchildren have been waiting since May 29 to cross the border.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: When they succeed, since a formal humanitarian corridor has not yet been established in La Guajira and passage is sporadic, they will join the number of more than 74,000 Venezuelans who, according to Migration Colombia, have returned to their country in the framework of the pandemic. .

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Many more will join them until reaching 330,000 returnees, according to estimates by the InterAmerican Development Bank (IDB).

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: The figure, however, is tiny, when compared to the around 5 million Venezuelans who are estimated to have left their country.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: The fact that 50,000 people have returned (according to the Nicolás Maduro regime) is an interesting number, perhaps a difficult number for the Government to manage, because many of the returnees have had to be isolated () But grossly mode is a insignificant number, compared to the number of people who have left, Gerardo González, professor at the Institute of Higher Administration Studies and project manager at the market research firm Consultores 21, told EL TIEMPO.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: By February, before the arrival of the pandemic, Migration Colombia estimated that there were more than 1,700,000 Venezuelans in this country.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: The problem is not the quantity but the dimension of this return, how bad this forced return has been.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: It occurs in conditions just as vulnerable, just as dangerous as when they left Venezuela, added Venezuelan sociologist Claudia Vargas.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: For Íngrids family, returning has not been easy.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: One of those nights, while they were sleeping on sandbags on a balcony that had been given to them, some men threatened to pour kerosene on them and set them on fire.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Added to situations like this is the fact that the Venezuelan regime reduced the flow of migrants authorized to return.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: According to Migración Colombia, the transit of people can only be carried out on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in groups that do not exceed 300 people for the Simón Bolívar bridge, in Norte de Santander, and 100 for the José Antonio Páez bridge, in Arauca .

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Javier Tarazona, general director of the Redes Foundation, confirmed that yesterday there were no entries through the border with Táchira.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Not only did they leave the country due to an emergency, but they are forced to return and they are not allowed to enter, he assured.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Before the pandemic, Consultores 21 already measured the return of many Venezuelans, not only for economic reasons but also due to discrimination.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Íngrid was one of those who tried to settle in Colombia a couple of years ago, and she only lasted four months, precisely for this last reason.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Now, he assures, his daughters are also returning to Venezuela to stay.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: They say that they never go there again, he insists, while assuring that three other children who are based in Colombia have plans to return, once the pandemic is over.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: But, according to local experts, this will not be what the majority will do.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: As the quarantines are lifted or the mechanisms for the prevention of the pandemic in the receiving countries are made more flexible, these people are going to return from Venezuela, said Vargas, who insisted that this will not be immediate and perhaps not in large masses either. but that they could even drag other relatives or new migrants with them.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: People are going to continue trying their luck (in other countries), for two reasons economic () and that there is a strong demand for these people to continue sending remittances.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: What happened in these last four months was that family reunification was cut off, said Gerardo González, who stressed that this time it will not be so easy to leave due to the restrictions that other countries have imposed.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: And there is a third factor that would also cause this new exit, in Vargass opinion the way in which the regime has received them, with restrictions, in shelters that have been compared to concentration camps and stigmatizing them as traitors, sources of contagion.

title: Return to your country, the new drama of Venezuelans
text: Recently, the Secretary of Government of the border state of Zulia, Lisandro Cabello, said that those who return are biological weapons and on Monday Vice President Delcy Rodríguez affirmed that the threat to Venezuela today is the return of its migrants.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: The national director of the Accusatory Penal System, Camilo Burbano, said that the Prosecutors Office is attentive to initiating investigations to establish if there was any type of sexual crime in the shelters of Cúcuta that were destined for Colombians deported from Venezuela as denounced by the Prosecutors Office this Weekend.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: The official specified that in this investigative process the victims will be asked to specify what were the events in which the alleged abuses occurred.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: The first thing that must be established is where the events took place, people will be listened to and then it will be established whether Colombia has the competence to do so, Burbano said.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: He added that the accusing entity has preliminary information on certain excesses that would have been presented against the nationals who were expelled from Venezuela.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: Over the weekend, prosecutor Ilva Myriam Hoyos, who is in the border area visiting shelters, said she has received statements from women who were allegedly sexually assaulted by members of the Venezuelan guard during their transit to Colombia.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: He indicated that the abuses would have occurred on the trails.

title: Prosecutor will investigate alleged sexual abuse at the border
text: Hoyos also indicated that there are mothers in the shelters who are denouncing that their minor daughters have been touched and groped during their stay in those places.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: Fortunately, we have received medical attention in several places and now we are heading to Pamplona, where we can also check our condition after so many hours of walking, said Sandra Cadis, a migrant who is getting ready to travel nearly 300 kilometers this weekend. , spend the night in Bucaramanga and continue with your journey to Peru.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: The promotion of relations between the two countries and accelerating the diplomatic siege against Venezuela were two of the axes on which the meeting that Presidents Iván Duque and Mauricio Macri, of Argentina, held in Buenos Aires on Monday, focused.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: The two presidents signed agreements and memorandums of understanding on support in the field of agribusiness, fight against corruption and a memorandum of understanding for a platform on creative economy.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: President Macri said at the end of the meeting that it was an intense agenda regionally and globally.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: He said that they talked about what it has to do with agribusiness.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: We want to help increase and promote production capacities that manage development, said the Argentine president.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: Regarding the fight against drug trafficking, he said that Argentina will be there to help complement it.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: The two leaders also referred to the importance of supporting creative industries and highlighted what has been achieved in terms of tourism between the two nations.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: Another of the issues addressed by the leaders and something in which Macri has a special interest, is working on the convergence of Mercosur and the Pacific Alliance, which is an important bridge that we have to strengthen.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: Of course, one of the key issues of the meeting was the situation in Venezuela.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: Reiterate our deep commitment to the Venezuelan people, help do the impossible to restore democracy, end the usurper of Nicolás Maduro, who is seriously affecting the lives of millions of Venezuelans who are forced to leave their country, he said.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: He added that the care of migrants cannot be a sustainable solution over time.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: He added that Venezuelans have the right to regain freedom in their countryRegarding the Copa América, he said that it is an unprecedented and very stimulating experience.

title: Colombia and Argentina will seek to accelerate the diplomatic siege of Maduro
text: For his part, Duque thanked Macri for his support in the search for a democratic solution to the crisis in Venezuela.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: At the regional level, you have been a great ally of a just cause and a necessary cause today I want to recognize the support you gave against the dictator Nicolás Maduro before the InterAmerican Court of Human Rights, said the Colombian head of state.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It had been almost a decade, since 2010, that coffee growers had not had a yearend with all the indicators in positive territory.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: For some, it is even the first time in history that everything works in favor of those 500,000 families that the country today has dedicated to farming.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The internal price of grain exceeding one million pesos, which had not happened since November 23, 2016 the price on the New York Stock Exchange, well above a dollar a pound the coffee plantations, renewed and younger than ever, and the production of sacks per hectare, higher with a decrease in the extension of land used.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In other words, productivity and profitability will be what coffee growers will celebrate this Christmas.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The manager of the Federation of Coffee Growers, Roberto Vélez Vallejo, gives his vision of this panorama.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: With high prices and production, how much profitability have you recovered

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: If we make a global balance of what 2019 has been, we cannot be overwhelmed by the fact that we have had good prices in the last 4 weeks.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Of the two batches that coffee has in the year, the first semester was very bad in terms of prices.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It must be remembered that there are regions in which the main harvest is that of the first half of the year.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Those who have the main harvest, in the second semester are doing better.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: For this reason, raising the victory flag and saying that the coffee growers are perfectly fine is not telling the truth.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That is, they are flush between cost and profit.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The second semester has allowed more or less to overshadow what happened in the first.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The coffee pot comes flush with quantity.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Those who have the largest harvest now, which was their turn at the end of December, are surely going to have better returns.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: However, as a sector, taking into account that the cost of last years harvest was 6.5 billion pesos, this year we are going to close in the order of 6.8 or 6.9 billion pesos more.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It is 300,000 or 400,000 million pesos more.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There is an improvement in income that will allow a greater irrigation of money in the coffee zones.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It is always said that coffee growers complain a lot, because now, at least, it is a good Christmas.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: What will be the volume of total production

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Coffee growers at least have a good Christmas.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Initially we had calculated that the crop was going to close between 13.8 and 14 million bags, but, as things are going, I would not be surprised to see a coffee crop closing with 300,000 bags more.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This is good news not only for coffee growers, but for the agricultural sector and the economy in general.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: And all that extra coffee has a market

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: All that coffee has been sold, it has been dispatched.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: We are going to end up with exports of 13.1 or 13.2 million bags.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Colombian coffee already has a place in the international market, all the coffee that is produced is sold.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The difference that the market recognizes to Colombian coffee for its quality also had one of the best years in its history.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It was the fight they had when they announced that they were going to leave the fold of the New York Stock Exchange.Thats how it is.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The difference with the stock price is traditionally 4 cents, this year we have been 30 cents above the stock price.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That has helped that the crisis has not been so deep.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Part of what called these spread levels is that we said, Were not going to let coffee sell for less than 1.40.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It was a bit of a threat to the international market, but it ended up being a strategic move because the industry understood that it had to pay better levels for Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That differential, which is around 30 cents, today is paid for an ordinary coffee, we are not talking about specialty coffees.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Meanwhile, coffee from Brazil is sold at market price minus 5 cents.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This dispels the problem that led them to rebel against the New York Stock Exchange.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The IPO thing was a misunderstanding.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: What we said was We are going to untie the Colombian price from the stock market and we are going to put it at 1.40 dollars, whoever does not pay it does not buy Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It is a bold bet, but the industry interpreted it as it was you have to pay a higher price for Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: From then on, the spread started to rise and today it is still above 30 cents.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Colombian coffee is today in the international markets at 1.60.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It means that the good moment of coffee growing is something lasting.I wish.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: What is clear is that the industry is willing to pay better prices for Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That reflects a growing international demand for Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There is a competition between industrialists for our coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In part because our competitors, which have traditionally been Central American coffees, have been going down and down because they have not had devaluation, they have not had the premium of Colombian coffee.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: What one sees is a Central America that is withering.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Costa Rica, which used to produce 3 million bags, today only produces 600,000 El Salvador, which produced 3.5 million bags, barely made 1.5 million Guatemala, which produced 5 million bags, today only puts out a little more than 3 million.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Honduras, which reached 7 million, today has 6.5 million.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In a way, the results of the annual renewal scheme and of keeping the coffee sector lively are being seen.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: While our competitors are slowly starting to fade away, Colombian coffee is positioning itself in highvalue markets.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That demand is reflected in the differential they pay us.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: They have a biennial harvest, a large one and a small one.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Prices went to 90 cents because this country had a harvest of 65 or 67 million bags.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This year, the estimates are 57.58 million bags, almost 10 million less.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: But next year will surely come with a big harvest.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: At the moment I see prices hovering around these same good levels.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: And, also, I want to emphasize that it is not a lot of money, it is a price of 1.30 dollars.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: But its better than being under the dollar.True, but prices are still very low.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: We have two fortunes, one is the exchange rate and the other is the differential.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: With this we can say today that there is calm.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The coffee grower is seeing the benefits of having followed and maintained the renewal scheme.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: We closed with the best indicators in all of history, production, productivity, bushes per hectare, age of the coffee plantations (we have the youngest coffee growing), all of that helped.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The disservice would have been if prices had risen, and us with a drop in production.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: How is the price formula

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The price of the New York Stock Exchange is added to the premium that is being paid internationally for Colombian coffee and multiplied by the exchange rate.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This gives the internal price, which today is 1,050,000 pesos.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That price, with production costs, which are around 750,000800,000 pesos, leaves a profit for the producer.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The money that the Government made available for when prices are low. what will finally be done with it

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: It all goes to our Coffee Stabilization Fund.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The Government is in the process of issuing the decree, then some regulations will come then a contract.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Everything has to be done before December 31.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Those silvers (there were 2 one, when President Iván Duque began his government in September, he gave the coffee sector 100,000 million for the Igec (government incentive for coffee equity).

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In March, when the price was half lopsided, they gave us another 100,000 million.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: From there we have used something, and we have a little more than 180,000 million left that would go to seed capital of the Coffee Stabilization Fund.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: From the coffee contribution, which is currently 6 cents, which goes to the National Coffee Fund, half a dollar is taken and put into the Price Stabilization Fund.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In other words, next year, we coffee growers will put between 27,000 and 30,000 million into the Stabilization Fund.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: With this, this fund in 2020 will have a seed capital, adding what the Government and the coffee growers put in, of the order of 210,000220,000 million.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Migrants Avoid Labor ShortageThis year, even the labor shortage problem was solved with migrants.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Fortunately, the migration of Venezuelans has been assisting the labor deficit for the coffee harvest.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There are no concerns on the part of the coffee growers in relation to labor.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There is enough labor, largely by Venezuelans.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There was the experience of a coffee grower that out of every ten of his workers, nine were Venezuelan.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: But we also continue to work on tools to collect.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This year, for the first time, the meshes were used so that the coffee grower simply drops the coffee into the meshes.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Harvest productivity increased by 20 percent.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: The first 180 bulldozers have also been sold, with which we started only a month and a half ago.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Why with less cultivated area there is more harvest

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: Before we had 925,000 hectares and today, only 850,000.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: This is because the area has been purged.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: There were reports in our system of areas that had not been in coffee for a long time.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: In contrast, we have not changed production.

title: "I hope that the good moment of coffee will last" Federation
text: That is greater productivity, making better use of the land.

title: Colombia deports 21 Venezuelans for prohibited commercial activity

text: That is to say, create from certain cases major actions that allow transforming the law and generate sentences in the high courts.
