text: And it tells how the high number of tutelas on pregnancy rights in Arauca caught the attention of the Constitutional Court.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: The fact of having 870 guardianships, the majority on pregnancy, was reflected in the Court, which selected one of them, in Saravena, as the basis for a unification sentence in which the rights of the refugee population in a state of pregnancy were recognized , says Juan Carlos Villate, representative of Tame.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: And he adds that, also thanks to the Network, Arauca is the only department where the issuance of the Special Permanence Permit (PEP) can still be issued, the most important document for the Venezuelan migrant population when it comes to claiming rights or looking for work.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: On April 27, the system closed, but we have achieved, through guardianships, that those who did not obtain their PEP on that date can have it.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: We have argued the rural context and we invoke the principle of family reunification.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: In other words, the family that arrives following the father or mother can also issue it with equal rights.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: We will take that line to the high courts.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: We have already filed, in addition, a claim of unconstitutionality of the rule that imposes the term to issue this permit, says Villate.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: Currently, the Red de Ombudsmen of the Border is preparing a case to obtain, before the Constitutional Court, the recognition of the refugees as victims of the armed conflict.

title: This is how the border officials protect refugees
text: This, for them, is a fundamental advance, almost a point of honor for which they will fight this year.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Similarly, the official requested the application of a regulatory and legal framework to strengthen humanitarian assistance programs and mitigate the effects caused by the high irregular migratory flow that has been increasing since 2015.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The European Union (EU), under pressure from the United States, is heading to tighten its sanctions against officials from Nicolás Maduros Venezuela, while trying to promote a way out of the political crisis and alleviate that of the refugees.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Days after the announcement of a conference of solidarity with Venezuelan refugees and migrants, the ambassadors of the 28 European countries supported this Wednesday the adoption in the coming days of the new package of sanctions.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The EU plans to ban travel to the bloc and freeze the assets of seven members of Venezuelas security and intelligence forces for torture and other human rights violations, according to diplomatic sources.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The Europeans also gave their approval to the future adoption of a sanctions regime for the crisis in Nicaragua, paving the way to penalize those responsible for the repression and the deterioration of democracy in the country.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Venezuela became in 2017 the first Latin American country sanctioned by the EU.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: In addition to the arms embargo, the Europeans imposed individual sanctions on 18 officials in 2018, which will rise to 25 with the new package.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: But the bloc is the target of criticism from opponents of the Venezuelan government for not increasing pressure on Maduro, to the level of the United States, which even froze Venezuelan assets.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Washington calls for a tougher stance and more sanctions from the EU.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Its representative for Venezuela, Elliott Abrams, accused the bloc even from Brussels at the beginning of the month of being a kind of tourist complex for regime officials.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: For Gaspard Estrada, specialist in Latin America at Sciences Po in Paris, the EU should not give in to pressure from the United States so as not to help Donald Trumps electoral claims ahead of the 2020 elections.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: It is becoming increasingly clear that for Donald Trump it is not an issue of democracy, but rather an electoral issue (.) especially in the state of Florida, Estrada explained.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: According to Anna Ayuso, a researcher at the CIDOB think tank, the EU is trying to distance itself from Trumps position, after being accused of following after the recognition in January by most countries of Juan Guaidó as interim president.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The EU has a different vision than Trump, even though they share objectives, adds Ayuso, for whom the selective sanctions adopted by the EU are focused on the violation of human rights and seek to sow doubts in the more moderate and pragmatic sectors. of the ruling party.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The 28 countries, whose foreign policy is unanimously, are reluctant to increase pressure to the maximum, with sanctions against Maduro or economic sectors, so as not to close diplomatic channels or worsen the humanitarian crisis.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: In February, the EU launched an International Contact Group (ICG) together with European and Latin American countries, an instrument that paved the way, in his opinion, for a dialogue between the government and the opposition sponsored by Norway.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: But, in a context of deadlocked dialogue, the bloc focuses its concern on the refugee crisis, one of the greatest humanitarian crises of our time, according to the head of European diplomacy, Federica Mogherini.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR) estimates that some four million Venezuelans have emigrated since the end of 2015 after the political and economic crisis that plagues the country, especially neighboring nations.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: In August, the head of the UNHCR, Filippo Grandi, warned that the march of Venezuelans from his country will continue if there is no internal political solution and that Latin America will need international cooperation to confront it.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The EU thus scheduled, together with two United Nations agencies, a conference on October 28 and 29 in Brussels focused on the refugee crisis to call for greater international cooperation at the financial and technical level.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: The CIDOB senior investigator sees the event as additional pressure on Maduro, but above all as a message that there is a rush to act in the face of the humanitarian crisis.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: Its a way to avoid a regional crisis, he explained.

title: With sanctions, the European Union intensifies the pressure against Venezuela
text: To promote the conference during the UN General Assembly in New York, Mogherini met with the Lima Group and the Pacific Alliance, considering the crisis in the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CELAC).

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: A woman is by nature a mother, and, as human beings, we all need one, says the nun as she distributes plates of food in a dining room full of love.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The four candidates who will compete next Sunday for the votes of the citizens to govern Bogotá during the fouryear term, took out this Thursday, in the debate of EL TIEMPO, Citytv and La W, their last letters on issues little raised throughout the campaign.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: What to do against the TransMilenio castes, with the problems of coexistence due to mobility chaos, whether or not to involve the army to respond to violence in social protest, how to act with the brave bars in football or what to do with the Sanitary landfill of Doña Juana, were issues that were not expected.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The citizens of Bogota were able to appreciate the talent of the candidates, who, placed in those specific situations, reflected their ability to govern the city in case of winning the elections on Sunday.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: For example, in the scenario of a social protest in which the National Government asked to bring the army into the city, Claudia López and Carlos Fernando Galán were forceful they would not allow the army in urban areas, although they would use it to monitor the outskirts and tickets to Bogota.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Soldiers are trained to load rifles and to kill, López said.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: I do not agree with the military forces entering to control the social protest, said Galán.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: We have to prevent disagreements, said candidate Hollman Morris, who did not answer whether he would allow it or not if he was in the dilemma of making the decision.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: On the other hand, Miguel Uribe did not rule out the use of the army and even cited specific cases such as surveillance of critical infrastructure, such as electrical substations and access control points for cyclists.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The director of EL TIEMPO, Roberto Pombo, asked the four applicants to explain which of their opponents proposals they considered dangerous or inconvenient for the city.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Morris, who insisted throughout the debate that the elevated subway will destroy the city, said that López, Galán and Uribe represent the continuity of the current mayor Enrique Peñalosa.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López questioned Galán about his intention to build TransMilenio along Carrera 7a and on Avenida 68, and because, according to her, Galán is going to develop the Thomas Van der Hammen reserve and she is not.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The Bogotá para la Gente candidate replied that his intention is to build a TransMilenio with ecological buses and pointed to the Alliance candidate as inconsistent.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: And just as Morris insisted on the underground subway, Galán reiterated that he will put an end to polarization, setting an example, and Uribe, that he has the experience that, according to him, Galán lacks.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Uribe questioned Morris about wanting to destroy the subway that we have heard so much about, and the Colombia Humana candidate replied that the elevated route will destroy the city.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: An issue on which the candidates made the same decision, with some variations, was that of the TransMilenio leaks, since the majority announced that they would establish differential rates, although with different emphases.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Morris justified future differential rates in the deterioration of users purchasing power and even anticipated that he would freeze TransMilenios rates, while Uribe assured that he aspires to offer a 30 percent discount to the rate of students of strata 1 and 2, but with the condition of reducing leaks in the system.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: For López, the first thing is to improve the service, with the extension of frequencies and the improvement of the stations because, deep down, there is social injustice that makes citizens pay for national corruption.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: On how to act against Venezuelan migrants, the candidates agreed that they must be supported.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López recognized the work that has been carried out in the current government, but reiterated the proposal he has made to expel those who commit crimes.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Morris said that it is key to get migrants into the labor route, but also to punish whoever is committing a crime.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Uribe said that the regularization of immigration status is urgent and Galán said that we must take advantage of the citys vocation to receive migrants in order to work with them.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López warned that it is necessary to review the effect that informality with migrants is causing in the jobs of Bogota citizens to guarantee that nationals and foreigners have equal conditions.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The issue of how to act in the face of the conflicts generated by the chaos of mobility brought to light the proposals that the candidates have been defending throughout the campaign.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López reiterated that the chaos of mobility will be solved with a network of subways, including the construction of the one that is contracted, while Hollman Morris insisted on the underground subway.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: This issue generated a reaction from López who warned that it is not responsible to talk about throwing back a subway that will be contracted, because the city is exposed to lawsuits.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: What distinguishes us is that Hollman wants to throw the half meter high contract into the bin and I dont, she said when speaking of a difference between her and her opponent.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Galán distanced himself from the subject by pointing out the importance of the city having effective traffic management and announced that his government will have road managers to solve problems that generate congestion in real time and on the roads.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López, Galán and Uribe agreed on the importance of citizen culture to face mobility problems, but in the case of Miguel Uribe, he was emphatic in pointing out the need to enforce the rules and punish offenders.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: The candidates differed in the emergency plan that they would implement if elected, in the face of the mobility problems that will be generated in the city due to the massive construction of works.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: In practice, none spoke of concrete actions to ease traffic jams, as they took advantage of the stage to reiterate their proposals for mobility.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: However, Carlos Fernando Galán said that the smart traffic light plan will end.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: López warned that he definitely will not build TransMilenio for the seventh, and that during his government he will build the regional network taking advantage of the existing railways.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: Uribe took advantage of this issue to charge his containers for what he called a lack of experience.

title: The issues that put the four applicants to 'exercise' for Bogotá
text: It shows that they do not know what they are going to do, he said, noting that the works will generate traffic pressure but will improve the quality of life of citizens.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: During the debate, the candidates focused on explaining their proposals and avoided confrontations and friction.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: With a couple of sheets of paper and colored pencils, the Venezuelan migrant and refugee children who have arrived at the makeshift settlement located a few blocks from the Transportes del Salitre terminal in Bogotá, are distracted from the reality that surrounds them while their parents go out in search of money through the sale of sweets, which is the most common source of income.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Migration Colombia indicates that, as of August 30, 2018, a total of 935,593 Venezuelan migrants and refugees have crossed the ColombianVenezuelan border, of which 156,575 are under 17 years of age.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: According to María Mercedes Liévano, deputy director of the Colombian Institute for Family Welfare (ICBF), the situation of Venezuelan children and adolescents who have arrived in Colombia is critical.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: We are talking about boys and girls who arrive in very complex conditions of vulnerability and poverty, which makes them subjects of risk in the face of problems that may affect them.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: We are talking about cases of intrafamily violence, sexual exploitation, child labor, recruitment, bonding, homelessness and begging, risk of sexual abuse, among others, says the deputy director.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The ICBF is currently assisting more than 55,000 Venezuelan minors throughout the national territory, of which 49,258 are boys and girls under five years of age.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: In addition to this, there are 2,477 Venezuelan pregnant women on accompaniment routes.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The number of attentions has increased significantly, going from 3,219 cases in 2017 to more than 55,000 in 2018.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Atlántico, Bogotá, Guajira and Norte de Santander are the territories with the highest rate of care for migrant children and adolescents and refugees from the neighboring country with 52.77.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: For the office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, UNHCR, in these processes of mixed migratory flows, children and adolescents can be separated from their families and other support networks, disrupting their education cycle and their projects. of life.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Boys and girls from 9 to 13 years old, the most affectedEmotionally, Venezuelan boys and girls have been affected by the strong and unexpected changes to which they are subjected.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Many parents are disoriented when it comes to helping to face the migratory grief that the boy or girl is going through.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Faced with this situation, the National Secretariat of Social Pastoral CareColombian Caritas (SNPS), of the Catholic Church, has been making efforts in the solidarity response to the humanitarian crisis caused by Venezuelan migration.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: This institution has been activating psychosocial care routes for more than 50 years to support families in migratory grief, focused on the life project during any of the stages of migration origin, transit, destination or return.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: According to the cases that María Camila Calderón, from the psychosocial team of the Pastoral care program for asylum seekers, refugees and persons of interest, has attended, not all children experience the migration process in the same way.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: For boys and girls whose ages range between 0 and 8 years old, the process in the transit or destination stage is easier to assimilate than for children between 9 and 15 years old.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The youngest children face the situation differently, many times they assume it as something new a new house, new friends, a new environment and they manifest it in their narratives.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: But older children are quieter when it comes to sharing or engaging in dialogue.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: They compare the situations they are currently experiencing with those they left behind in their places of origin, that is to say  I used to go to a nicer school, there I had clothes, here I dont there I ate this, here I dont , says the professional.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: According to the psychosocial support processes, the older brother or sister, or the only male child in the family, begins to attribute responsibilities and obligations that are not in accordance with his or her age, since he or she feels that it is a duty to take your family ahead.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: These situations can generate symptoms of anxiety or sadness in boys and girls between the ages of 9 and 15, which, being persistent, increase their vulnerability.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: It can even lead them to seek refuge in other unsafe environments where they are sold a false comfort places of consumption of psychoactive substances, or organized crime networks for begging, sexual exploitation and risk of living on the street.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The psychosocial support offered by the SNPS is based on an assessment of needs and capabilities.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: We provide support tools to parents and adults who contribute to the coresponsibility of the care and protection of minors, we encourage the formation of support networks and coping resources to understand the emotional suffering of children in forced migration and thus minimizing possible risks.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: This strategy is complemented by the legal response to the gaps in protection that are evident, says Calderón.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The interinstitutional support network and that of close people consists of energizing care and solidarity groups that are committed to coresponsibility for the best interests and the prevalence of childrens rights and their wellbeing.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Regarding coping resources, the best way to distract the minor to help him face his migratory grief is through a hobby that helps him manage his time in a creative way.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Another fundamental aspect is related to constant communication with relatives who are far away.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: This strengthens the family bond and makes them feel important to the rest of the family.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: What is a migrant or refugee boy or girl entitled to in any country

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Venezuelan migrant and refugee children and adolescents have the same rights as the entire child population in the world.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: International Law enshrines the rights of the child and includes the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: States must ensure the effective enjoyment of rights for these children, as well as their effective application without distinction of race, color, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national, ethnic or social origin, economic position , physical disabilities, birth or any other condition of the child, their parents or their legal representatives (Article 2, UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, 1990).

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Education, for example, is a basic human right and is enshrined in the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the 1951 Convention.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The New York Declaration on Refugees and Migrants points to education as a key element in the response to refugees and that is why the UNHCR works together with the Colombian Government and other international organizations to guarantee access to quality education for children and young refugees, says Johanna Reina, UNHCR CommunityBased Protection Officer.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Currently, the District Secretariat of Bogotá has registered 3,808 enrollments of Venezuelan students, all distributed in different public schools in the capital.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The district mandate is clear children and young people come first in Bogotá.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Regardless of their origin, their stratum or their cultural, social or physical differences.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: For this reason, the Ministry of Education guarantees access to public education for Venezuelan migrants and refugees with the same conditions of wellbeing, quality, and safety that Bogota students receive, including school meals, says the District Secretary of Education, Claudia bridges.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Likewise, since March 2018, the Secretariat has been carrying out an awareness plan in each of the educational institutions in order to prevent xenophobia in administrative, social and cultural environments to which children may be exposed, Venezuelan migrant and refugee girls and adolescents.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The house to house search is another initiative that is an active part of this awareness plan whose objective is to identify the outofschool population.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Challenges and public protection policiesAlthough United Nations System Agencies such as Unicef, IOM, Acnur and national institutions such as the ICBF and the SNPS have created and strengthened protective environments for children in different points of arrival for the Venezuelan population such as Rumichaca, Maicao, Riohacha, Cúcuta and Bogotá, among others, much remains to be done to guarantee adequate protection for Venezuelan migrant and refugee children.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: At the current juncture, UNHCR is working to ensure access to legal documentation for boys and girls, as well as birth registration procedures to prevent statelessness.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Hand in hand with the Colombian State and the ICBF, UNHCR has committed to strengthening national protection systems and services and advocating for all refugee children, without discrimination, to have access to them, says Johanna Reina.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: For its part, the ICBF is preparing a Conpes document in order to organize the institutional offer that has to be given around the needs of the Venezuelan population.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: We are in the plan to more quickly identify their needs.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: Being able to continue articulating ourselves to be able to speed up the route of action.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: In La Guajira there are plans to open a boarding school that will have capacity for 50 boys and girls.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: It will be a center where children are received while their situation is resolved, says María Mercedes Liévano, deputy director of the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare (ICBF).

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: For María Mercedes Liévano, the migratory situation that Colombia is experiencing is one of the largest that has been registered in Latin America and for which the country was not prepared.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: The situation is so complex and so great that it is overflowing the capacity to help.

title: The worrying situation of Venezuelan minors in Colombia
text: In this context, focusing attention on the specific needs of children and adolescents and how to guarantee their protection is one of the greatest challenges.

text: The relatives also denounced that they have been prevented from seeing their loved ones and that they have not received a response from the Arauca authorities and the Colombian consular representative in the neighboring town of El Amparo.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, María Ángela Holguín, announced this Monday that on August 4 she will meet with her Venezuelan counterpart Delcy Rodríguez, in order to seek solutions for the definitive reopening of the border between the two countries, which is closed. since August 19 last year.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: We have on the horizon the reopening of the border.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: But we will do it when we are certain that it will be a much safer and more convenient border than the one that was closed, Holguín assured.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: This meeting between the foreign ministers will be preceded by meetings that will be held by the military and customs authorities of both Colombia and Venezuela.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: As confirmed by the head of Colombian diplomacy, it is expected to maintain an open dialogue between the two countries to reach concrete agreements that facilitate a meeting between President Juan Manuel Santos and his counterpart Nicolás Maduro.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border
text: Holguín also referred to the expansion of the humanitarian corridor that allowed this Sunday the entry of nearly 30,000 Venezuelans to Cúcuta in search of food and medicine that they cannot find in their country as a result of the shortage of supplies in Venezuela.

title: Foreign Ministers of Colombia and Venezuela will seek to reopen the border

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: The absence of vehicles that would carry out the school transport to the students who arrived in Colombia on Monday from the municipalities of San Antonio and Ureña, in Venezuela, to receive classes after the resumption of the humanitarian corridor through the international bridges led the departmental administration to decree the educational emergency in Norte de Santander to create the administrative conditions that would allow him to carry out the rapid contracting of that logistics.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: According to Governor William Villamizar Laguado, the decision to declare that state came after receiving official confirmation from the Foreign Ministry that the border with the neighboring country will not be opened in the short term.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: A measure that will allow us to quickly resolve the provision of school transportation for those children who reside in Venezuela and study in Colombia, explained Villamizar Laguado.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: He added that the Ministry of Education authorized the use of resources from the General Participation System to finance the transport service for students who arrive in the national territory through the humanitarian corridor set up at the Simón Bolívar and Francisco de Paula Santander international bridges, which communicates the Venezuelan populations of San Antonio and Ureña, with Villa del Rosario and Cúcuta, respectively.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: Indeed, at 545 in the morning on Tuesday, more than 20 buses waited for the arrival of schoolchildren to transfer them to their educational institutions.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: He added that many of the students from the neighboring country, whose number last year amounted to 2,500, are still in the enrollment process.

title: In Norte de Santander an educational emergency was decreed_R
text: We already have transportation like we did last year, with the support of the Cucuta Governors Office and Mayors Office, in this corridor where more than 2,500 children passed.

text: At the citizen level, we can all help, hopefully with support of different kinds, but it would be enough not to fall into the trap of choosing them as scapegoats for a crisis that, paradoxically, knows no nationalities.

title: Migration Colombia is getting ready for the return of Venezuelans after the pandemic
text: In dialogue with EL TIEMPO, the director of Migration Colombia, Juan Francisco Espinosa, said that nearly 80,000 Venezuelans have left the country to return to their country, in the midst of the pandemic.

title: Migration Colombia is getting ready for the return of Venezuelans after the pandemic

text: Comprehensive health care for the entire Venezuelan migrant population needs to be progressive, since it requires complex efforts on the part of the State and the availability of sufficient resources that do not put the system at greater risk, the Court concluded when evaluating two cases of citizens of the neighboring country.

text: The decision, known this Tuesday, June 12, specifically protects the rights of a twoyearold minor and a 34yearold woman, both Venezuelans in Colombia who left their country due to the serious socioeconomic situation they are going through in their country and to the need to receive urgent medical attention, assures the high court, and orders the State to take general measures regarding the entire migrant population.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: In the case of the woman, she would have left five minor children in her country.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Already in Cúcuta, she was diagnosed with a cervix jail at the Erasmo Meoz university hospital, in the capital of Norte de Santander.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: There he began treatments such as radiotherapy cycles, but they did not perform chemotherapy, for which he filed a guardianship action.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: In the first instance, a court in Cúcuta denied guardianship, considering that he should have legalized his stay in the country and, therefore, have a document that proves it.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: In addition, he assured that the emergency services had been provided effectively.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: In the second case, that of the minor, it was his mother, also Venezuelan, who filed the guardianship, since she traveled from her country to Colombia with her son, who has suffered from a scrotal hernia since birth.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: He assures that he could not be operated on in Venezuela due to the lack of anesthesia.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Although the first instance ruled in favor, another court later revoked this decision, which also considered that the minor did not have a document that proves the legalization of his stay in the country.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Despite the fact that the Court calls for progressive protection in the cases of the citizens of the neighboring country, the Government of Colombia must work with its institutions to obtain international and national cooperation resources to advance as expeditiously and efficiently as possible towards the realization of the right to health of migrants with higher standards than mere medical urgency, says the decision of the Sixth Review Chamber of the Court.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Emphasizes the situation of migrants in conditions of greater vulnerability and urged the State to review the regulations that become barriers when providing health care to migrant citizens of Venezuela, to reduce the disproportionate burdens of those regulations about Venezuelans.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The Court ensures that in exceptional cases, emergency care may include the treatment of catastrophic illnesses such as cancer, when they are requested by the treating physician as urgent.

title: Court orders health care for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The National Institute of Health, in Norte de Santander, must respond, within 48 hours, for the womans cancer treatment and authorize the minors surgery.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: That institute will be responsible for the two wards until they are affiliated with the General System of Social Security in Health.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: According to data from Migración Colombia, 197,979 Venezuelans live in Norte de Santander.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: A figure that increases daily if the moderate entry of migrants through the trails on the border is taken into account.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: However, Venezuelan migration could skyrocket again if the legally authorized border crossings between the two countries are opened.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: Jairo Yáñez, mayor of Cúcuta, told EL TIEMPO how they are preparing to control a possible reopening of the ColombianVenezuelan border, which would take place after the visit of President Iván Duque to the area.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: How are you preparing to reopen the border between Cúcuta and Venezuela

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: The opening of the border is a multidimensional situation, which is due to several issues.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: In micro issues, it is due to see how around 300, 400 or 500 people move in difficult humanitarian conditions on the trails, where there are illegal groups.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: For this reason, we have to have projects with a longterm vision because the border is going to be there all the time.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: The most dramatic and critical part is that there is no communication with the community in Venezuela. If we had some mechanism that would allow us to integrate coordination work between the two countries, we would not have major difficulties so that this planning would be as accurate as possible.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: Are you worried about the massive arrival of Venezuelans if the border is opened

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: The concern is total because an uncontrolled, unplanned opening, and without knowing exactly how many migrants or how much pendulum population is going to be generated, would be to assume a very serious risk.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: However, we are, through an opening management that is leading the Cúcuta mayors office, talking weekly to prepare the visit of the President who is going to make the decision to open the border and under what conditions.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: For this reason, we need a characterization of the population in order to comprehensively register commuting or noncommuting migrants.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: We have to facilitate the opening of micro, small, medium and large companies for them.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: We want to attract them to invest in Cúcuta, through the strategy of the Special Social Economic Zones (ZESE), which allows companies located on the border of Cúcuta to have a 50 discount imposed over 5 years.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: What are the strategies to integrate Venezuelans into the productive force of the country

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: An important point is that Venezuelans can repatriate their capital, through local banks, and that it be the starting point of investment capital for new companies, and to the extent that they can be banked, they enter the economy.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: We are carrying out an analysis to carry out preliminary attention next to international bridges to try to control and coordinate the demand for goods and services that this population may demand in a massive way, and thus also seeing how to strengthen the PRASS strategy (tests, tracking and sustainable selective isolation) in the border area, to carry out rapid tests that allow us to identify possible people who are infected with the covid virus, and depending on the number of migrants we will have to have more screening stations in the border area.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: When is the Presidents visit to define when the border will open

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: So before that date the border will not be opened

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: The president is the only person who decides if it is opened and under what conditions.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: How is your proposal to create the Border Migration Management

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: It is a whole task of strategic planning to coordinate actions not only in health, but also in transportation and logistics at each point of contact with Venezuela, the biometric registry, the characterization of the population and to create the structure that allows us to serve the Venezuelan population. .

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: In addition, at this time we have a very restrictive capacity due to covid, so if 2,000, 3,000, 5,000 or 10,000 people pass through each day, we would have nowhere to serve them and it would generate a very complicated process for us to face.

title: This is how Cúcuta gets ready to reopen the border with Venezuela
text: When will the biometric identification mechanism of the Venezuelan population come into operation

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: When the presence of the foreigner in the national territory is considered inconvenient.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: On a daily basis, the Police in Santa Marta attend to up to 15 cases of fights involving Colombians and Venezuelans, who remain at odds over the domain of public space where they carry out all kinds of informal activities.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: The lack of job opportunities in the city, added to the massive arrival of migrants, has caused street sales and rummaging in the streets to skyrocket.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: The authorities indicate that every week up to 50 vendors, window cleaners, car keepers and others dedicated to various trades appear, who want to earn their daily livelihood on the platforms of the avenues and spas.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: This situation has generated an increase in the number of fights and disputes, due to the fact that the public space is totally invaded and apparently there is no place for new informals.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: Fights occur in all parts of the capital of Magdalena, but mainly in the Public Market, downtown area and resorts such as Bahía and Rodadero.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: In these places, problems between Colombian and Venezuelan vendors have become common, with unfortunate consequences, said the commander of the Metropolitan Police, Colonel Gustavo Berdugo.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: These clashes have already left one dead this week in El Rodadero.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: There, two Venezuelans went from verbal to physical aggression, to the point that one of those involved armed himself with a knife and stabbed to death his compatriot, who refused to leave the public space.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: A trader from the seaside resort stated that informality, especially in the beach area, is out of control, since every day there are more street vendors and illegal service providers.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: The most worrying thing is that their presence not only creates disorder, but also alters public order and increases insecurity for locals and visitors.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: The owners of restaurants and commercial establishments in the city center also denounced that mafias have been formed in different sectors that have taken over public space and charge informal workers for occupying a place.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: Those who do not pay what is asked of them, which is between 200 and 300 thousand pesos a month, they have them removed by force and with threats.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: There are some who agree and pay what is demanded of them, others withdraw, and some more decide to stay and face the consequences for not having a different option, said Alberto Gómez, who owns a store.

title: Informality triggers fights in public places in Santa Marta
text: The legal trade of Santa Marta considers that the Police is not enough to control the informality that is on the rise.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: The same as restaurants and travel agencies, commerce that has not been able to recover its business levels.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: At 66 years of age, when he hoped to enjoy a modest pension, life took a turn for Roque Díaz, who says he was reborn, but without reals (money), without a house or car, without friends and out of his country.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Díaz is one of the thousands of Venezuelans and ColombianVenezuelans who have arrived in Colombia fleeing the serious political, social and economic crisis facing the neighboring country.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Migration Colombia estimates that 470,000 have entered, but the NGOs that provide humanitarian assistance to these migrants believe that there are more than a million and that number continues to grow.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Many of these foreigners have taken refuge in cities such as Cúcuta, Bucaramanga, Barranquilla, Medellín and Bogotá, and although some have had better luck because they got a job, others live by selling arepas, empanadas or exchanging bolívares for a few pesos, while still others wait for help on the streets.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: In Venezuela there is no future, says Roque Díaz, who worked in the National Assembly and affirms that he traveled in October of last year from Caracas to Bogotá, in the company of a journalist daughter.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: His belongings were two suitcases and a few bolivars.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: A month later, and after touring a city that was strange, intense and congested for them, in search of an apartment that would suit their conditions, they were joined by his wife, another daughter and his publicist son.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: This man from Caracas has a degree in social sciences and history and his wife, in languages.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Both are pensioners, but since they arrived in Colombia they have not received any allowance, and if they did receive it, they would add close to 26,000 pesos between the two of them, which would hardly be enough for a corrientazo for each one.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Until today, they have all survived on what Roque earns as a driver of a loaned car, on the salary of a daughter who works in a call center, on what his wife earns selling jams and on what the publicist does with the video production.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: And although what they all get together is barely enough to survive in Bogotá, Roque says he feels a certain calm because they are not going hungry, as they were in Caracas.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: A minimum wage in Venezuela is only enough to buy a kilo of rice and a kilo of pasta to cover the basic food basket there are about 20 minimum wages left, says this pensioner who completed a year in the country and who has managed to adapt to the cold and congestion in the capital, but deep down he hopes that things will soon change in his country and be able to return to his family, to rebuild their battered lives and, as he hopes, enjoy the modest pension that he and his wife receive, go to the movies and eat an ice cream in the street, which they have not been able to do for years do.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: A similar story has been experienced by Ilich Márquez, a Venezuelan son of a Colombian who migrated in the 1970s in search of a better future.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: But, almost 50 years later, things have turned around.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: After being the victim of an armed robbery in Caracas, this business administrator decided, with his wife, a dentist, to leave their country.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: For two years the couple dedicated themselves to preparing the trip.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: That was the time it took for Ilich to go three times to the border to complete the paperwork for Colombian citizenship and send his bags to Bogotá.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: I didnt come like others, who have left with nothing, says this ColombianVenezuelan who arrived last January with his wife and little daughter.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: For several months the family survived with the temporary jobs that Ilich managed, until they gave him the opportunity in a Venezuelan company.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: He alternates that job with the sale of empanadas on the corner of Calle 140 and Carrera 13.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Colombia is not in the best moment, but we are much better here than we can be in Venezuela, he says while lamenting that his father and mother continue in the neighboring country, where, although they have a job, it is very difficult to survive. with 800 percent inflation.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: The drop by drop migration has not stoppedAs long as the serious political, economic and social crisis in Venezuela is not resolved, the drop by drop migration of citizens from the neighboring country will not stop, and even of compatriots who in the past crossed the border fleeing violence or looking for a better future.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: This is the opinion of foundations and NGOs that have been providing humanitarian aid to these foreigners who are in precarious conditions and know firsthand the growth of this migration, which already mainly affects Colombia and Ecuador, Peru, Chile and Argentina.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: The situation in Venezuela is not going to change soon, and the migration to Colombia, which continues drop by drop, could be worse, warns Martha Varón, secretary of the NGO Venezolanos por Decisión and who settled in the neighboring country several decades ago. , but returned with his entire family as a result of food and medicine shortages.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: In fact, from Washington, Foreign Minister María Ángela Holguín expressed her concern this week about the effects of that exodus.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: It complicates the postconflict to the extent that the resources that the Colombian State has to respond to the commitments made in the (peace) agreement  in health, education, roads, productive projects  are added to the large additional cost (of) receiving a number of Venezuelans, Holguín explained.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: For this reason, Guillermo Pérez, director of the ColomboVenezuelan Foundation (Fundacolven), points out that the special residence permit (PEP), which has benefited some 79,000 Venezuelans, is not enough, and warns that the time may come when the The Colombian government will not be able to attend to the growing Venezuelan population or the problems that this generates.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: The Colombian State must make the international community aware of the growing migration from Venezuela and its impact.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: It should be a call to a common cause to help solve the problem, suggests Pérez.

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Christian Krüger, director of Migration Colombia, calculates that there are some 472,000 Venezuelans in the country, of which 202,000 are there on a regular basis (they met the requirements to enter the country).

title: 'In Venezuela there is no future'
text: Of these, nearly 79,000 processed the special residence permit (PEP), a kind of relief that allows them to join the working, social and economic life of our country.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: In any case, the number of Venezuelans who return is very low compared to those who remain in Colombia.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: Next Wednesday, June 26, at the InterContinental hotel in Cali (Cra.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: 1 272), about 200 people will participate in the forum How to deal with the exodus that changed us forever, the first of a series of forums that will talk about Venezuelan migration in Colombia, which will be held by the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), ACDIVOCA, Panas in Colombia and Casa Editorial EL TIEMPO.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: The event, with free admission, hopes to bring together the community of Cali and make them participate in the analysis that will take place on the construction of public policies to attend to Venezuelan migration since the magnitude of this migration and the challenges for humanitarian assistance and the socioeconomic integration of migrants, require the development of longterm measures that link different actors in society.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: During the forum, representatives of the local government, public entities, academia and private companies will have the opportunity to discuss, based on contributions and ideas, the challenges and opportunities for the construction of public policies that help the regularization and inclusion of Venezuelan citizens.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: One of the speakers who will be part of the forum is Peo Hansen, professor at the Research Institute on Migration, Ethnicity and Society (Remeso) at Linköping University (Sweden).

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: Hansen teaches political science, European Union studies, international relations, discourse analysis, international migration, and ethnic studies.

title: How to attend to the exodus that changed us forever
text: This forum will be held within the framework of the Alliances for Reconciliation Program of USAID and ACDIVOCA, which promotes transformative alliances oriented towards the generation of economic and social opportunities, in which the public, private and civil society sectors participate, under a Reconciling Approach that includes the recognition of the past as a mobilizing instrument, the psychoemotional approach and the inclusion of the different most vulnerable population segments.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: The meeting will start at 800 a.m.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: A transcendental step for the reopening of the border between Colombia and Venezuela is about to take place with the consolidation of the Binational Center against Transnational Organized Crime (Cebcot).

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: The two governments both Bogotá and Caracas know that a fundamental point for the border crossing to return to normality is to guarantee security on both sides of the border and jointly and vigorously combat the criminal phenomena that hit that area.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: That is why a meeting is budgeted for this Tuesday that will allow the Armed Forces of the two nations to consolidate this binational center, which will facilitate the tasks of controlling smuggling and fighting illegal gangs that use the border crossing to commit crimes.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: Foreign Minister María Ángela Holguín told EL TIEMPO that in this sense, both governments agree that the security agenda is essential for a safer common border.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: And he announced A very important meeting must take place next Tuesday, which will enable the Public Forces of both countries to advance in the consolidation of the Binational Center against Transnational Organized Crime (Cebcot).

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: This strategy allows us not only to fight more effectively against smuggling, but also against all forms of crime that have done so much harm to the border.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: This step began to take shape at last Thursdays meeting in Caracas (Venezuela), where Holguín met with the president of the neighboring country, Nicolás Maduro, and his foreign minister, Delcy Rodríguez.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: Colombia and Venezuela share more than 2,000 kilometers of border region and for 11 months the border crossings  by decision of the Maduro government  have been closed.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: This closure is what has motivated the two governments to analyze joint and substantive measures that allow normalizing the daily activities of the border, and especially when the neighboring country is experiencing a severe social crisis and food shortages that when allowed the passage to Colombia  has caused thousands of Venezuelans to cross into Colombian territory in search of food and basic necessities.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: We are making substantial progress towards the main objective of this moment, which is to achieve the fundamental conditions for the reopening of a secure and controlled border, added the Colombian Foreign Minister.

title: They prepare a security center for the Colombian-Venezuelan border
text: Of course, the decision to reopen will only be made after a meeting between Maduro and President Juan Manuel Santos, for which a date and, of course, a thematic agenda are being defined.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Among them, the effects on migrants.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Jesús Alfredo Suárez is a 24yearold Venezuelan from Aragua State, Venezuela.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: He is a mechanical engineer, he worked in the automotive area in a wellknown company in the country, and like many Venezuelan professionals, he has had to dedicate himself to other jobs to be able to support his family.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Six months ago, it arrived in Santana, a municipality in the department of Boyacá that is strategically located on the route that leads from Bogotá to Bucaramanga, whose economic base revolves around sugarcane crops for the production of panela, reaching volumes of almost 4000 tons per year This generates approximately 1,000 to 1,500 direct and indirect jobs, according to statistical data from the municipal mayors office.In the last two years, more than 800 Venezuelan refugees and migrants have arrived in the municipality of Boyacá, according to partial data given by the Municipal Police Command, of which the Municipal Mayors Office only has a census of 196 102 women and 94 men.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: From professionals to cane pressers and saddlersDwuayxo Guzmán, a professional basketball player, and Rafael Silva, an electrical technician, both from Carabobo State, Venezuela, are part of the group of Venezuelan professionals who have come to Santana to work in the sugar mill mills.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Dwuayxo, for example, had to exchange basketballs for sugar cane and professional courts for the electric mills of the mills.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: He had never worked in the field and much less had knowledge about panela production.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I was a Carabobo national team and I played in many tournaments, I traveled to Barquisimeto, Caracas and other cities.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I had the opportunity to play in professional leagues, but all of that is behind me because I had to leave my country to help my family.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I didnt know anything about this trade, I had to learn and it seems good to me although the work is a bit heavy, you have to work at dawn, in the morning, in the afternoon and at night, that is physically exhausting, says Dwuayxo.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Rafael Silva, 32, arrived in the municipality of Boyacá two years ago and worked for five years at PDVSA, a Venezuelan state company that is in charge of the exploitation, production, refining, marketing and transportation of Venezuelan oil.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I worked in the electrical area with a normal schedule.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: At PDVSA I worked at the office level, with air conditioning, ventilation, without exposure to the weather We didnt walk like that, sweaty, but very elegant and dressed.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The work seemed a little hard to me because I wasnt used to this routine, but what else Its time to work.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I do it more than anything for my family, my wife and my children, says Rafael.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: For Jesús Alfredo Suarez, who is part of the group of Venezuelan professionals, it has been more difficult to adapt years ago he never thought that he would be miles away from his native Venezuela and that he would go from an office to a panela production mill.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: I work as a presser and saddler.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The first day I felt that I left destroyed, but when you pick up the rhythm everything flows.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: It was hard because I didnt know anything, but my colleagues helped me and I learned quickly, says the engineer.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Increase in panela production and labor demandAccording to the owners of sugar mills and coffee plantations in Santana, the arrival of Venezuelans in the municipality has brought benefits to panela production, since they have found personnel to work in the mills, a labor force that had been decreasing for some time now. becoming a problem for the producers of the municipality.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Wilson Rafico Fajardo Naranjo is a producer of coffee and panela cane in the municipality. Six people from Venezuela currently work with him. They have helped him speed up production by strengthening harvesting and grinding work.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The arrival of the Venezuelan brothers in our municipality has generated more peace of mind for us, the bosses, because really for some time now the labor force in the region was scarce.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: And now, even when I grind, I work with them, I trust that they wont let my work go to waste and I havent had any problems with them, says Wilson Fajardo.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The municipality of Santana currently has 84 mills that for each production of panela can employ more than 30 workers in different trades, working intermediate weeks, depending on the cultivated areas and production capacity.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: The trades that are carried out in the mills begin with the socalled silleros, who are in charge of collecting the cane then the pressmen, whose task is to feed the mills the juice cleaning cycle continues, an activity carried out by a recleaner then there is the person in charge of the burner, in charge of the oven and of concentrating the honey.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: And when the honey is ready and thick, it goes to the cooling process and panela mold.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Due to this demand for labor, both Venezuelans and Santaneros producers have benefited.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: We can work in an articulated way and diversify into other types of crops because we have the supply of labor.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: There can be work for everyone, says Fredy Fernando Fino Hernández, in charge of the Municipal Unit of Agricultural Technical Assistance, UMATA of the municipality of SantanaThe municipality of Santana has a first level health center where they only carry out consultations and prenatal controls.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Attention to the Venezuelan population is minimal due to the fact that the majority is in an irregular migratory situation.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: For Dalmis Giovanni León Quítian, manager of the E.S.E Santana Health Center, the situation has been complex because more and more refugees and migrants are arriving in the municipality, increasing the services and costs of care at the health center.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: Here we can only attend to priority consultations because we are a first level center that is not enabled for emergencies.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia
text: We have as a priority the special attention to pregnant mothers and those under seven years of age, says the manager of the E.S.E Health Center of the municipality.

title: The boyacense field, an opportunity for Venezuelans in Colombia

title: Cúcuta, near social emergency by Venezuelans sleeping on the streets

King.

title: Venezuelan citizen files guardianship against Claudia López
