title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: If we wanted to measure with figures the magnitude of the work of Father José David Cañas, who since last year has dedicated most of his time to feeding Venezuelans who live poorly on the border between Colombia and Venezuela, it could be said that numerically he has given at least one portion of rice, potatoes, meat, lentils, or whatever is in the pantry, to all the citizens of the neighboring country who have arrived in our territory since 2017.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Because the Casa de Paz Divina Providencia, a charity founded by this 57yearold diocesan priest in Villa del Rosario (Norte de Santander), has distributed 500,000 lunches in one year.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And according to the first census carried out by the National government for two months and whose results were recently released, there are 442,462 Venezuelans in Colombia.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Obviously, this is a loose example.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: But it is enough to set foot in the place to understand that more than a simple meal, this place offers relief for those who, without a penny in their pocket, begin to face the tremendous challenge of being Venezuelan migrants in Colombia.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And its location is strategic.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: It is barely one kilometer from the Simón Bolívar bridge in La Parada, one of the poorest and most conflictive corregimientos in that municipality, 10 minutes from Cúcuta, and one block from the street through which all the contraband that enters through the trails and river weeds.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: An area where the law of money prevails.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Nothing is free sleep crowded up to 50 in a room three thousand pesos.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Sleep in the neighborhood park, a thousand pesos.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: There money is not important.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Yes, discipline and respect.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Every morning, from 700 in the morning, at least 1,500 Venezuelans, many times two thousand, patiently wait their turn.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They line up in an orderly manner at the door, while inside the temporary house the work is going on with intensity.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: In a simple shed, almost in the open air, is the kitchen.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: In it, the priest Cañas directs a team of at least 50 people, including volunteers and members of Catholic communities attached to the diocese of Cúcuta.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Robust, darkhaired and with an easy smile, he doesnt miss a detail of what happens in the kitchen.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: He can always be seen wearing a blue apron with a huge red cross on the front, made especially for that job.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: His special cassock for this charitable battle.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Dressed in it, she coordinates, directs, gives instructions and, of course, cooks.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: His work is divided between attending to administrative tasks, providing spiritual advice and checking that the lentils that are boiling in the giant pot do not burn.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Beside him, in the midst of five multicolored bins for washing dishes, tables where bags full of bread rest, a green bucket full of pieces of ripe banana and a cauldron with scrambled eggs, the volunteers work like ants.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Fortunately, that morning is cool, because the heat in the cauldrons is intense.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Everyone, Colombians and Venezuelans, chop onions, peel bananas and crack eggs to beat them.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Breakfast and lunch for two thousand Venezuelans who cross the border offers the Casa de PasoPhoto Courtesy Casa de Paso Divina ProvidenciaWhile this is happening in the kitchen, in the huge patio, on a platform covered with a zinc roof, where there is a speaker with a microphone and a lectern to put the Bible, a priest reads some verses and talks about mercy, reconciliation, forgiveness, courage and solidarity.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Then he invites everyone to hug.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Its almost 730 in the morning and the dining room, which consists of long rows of wooden tables and plastic chairs, covered by zinc tiles and white tarps, is full.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They close their eyes tightly, clench their fists and repeat what the priest says.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The women, most of them young with the delicate beauty of Venezuelan women, comfort their children, who are coughing, crying or trying to escape from their hands to run around or go to the playground at home.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Others, indifferent to the others, look towards the kitchen.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They know the reason for your visit and look forward to it.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The atmosphere smells of burning firewood.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: A sancocho with the family on the banks of a river.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Although many of the diners smile when they see the camera, there is deterioration on their faces.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They are sunburned, their hair looks tangled and thinness already marks their cheekbones strongly.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The clothes, dirty and deteriorated, take on opaque tones despite the fact that many wear brightly colored sports shirts.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The day helps in this panorama, which has dawned gray and cold, far from the characteristic heat of this area of Norte de Santander.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The Casa de Paz Divina Providencia has distributed 500,000 lunches in one year.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: With the bearing of a basketball player and at least two meters tall, Luis Martínez looks nothing short of uncomfortable bent over a small table next to several buckets of eggs.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: With a delicacy that does not match his big hands, he takes out an egg, cracks it gently and deposits it in a container.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Then he whisks them and throws them into the boiling cauldron.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Luis has been in Colombia for 5 months.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: He sells malts and sweets in the border area.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: What he earns is barely enough to guarantee shelter and send money to his mother, father and three brothers in Maracay (Venezuela).

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Therefore, he decided that it was better to save the food.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Here I asked Father Cañas if I could work in exchange for food and he said yes.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: So here I come, I help and they give me a little bit more than those who come every day.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: I am guaranteed breakfast, lunch and dinner, he says.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And he is not the only one who made that pact with the father.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Also Andrés, Diomel, David and Jennifer, four of his roommates in a nearby residence.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Like them, there are at least 30 Venezuelans who have decided to change food for work at home.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: As the father explains, everyone who knocks on the door is guaranteed bread and a hot drink for breakfast and a full lunch at noon.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: But those who decide to help and do their part to support their compatriots, receive a more complete breakfast and the same lunch as everyone else, but with the plus of an additional portion for the night.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Do not give the fish, but teach how to fish.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Along with the 30 Venezuelans who work, there are 400 volunteers from various Catholic organizations supported by the Diocese of Cúcuta.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They rotate during the days.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They work for free, while the Venezuelan boys, one could say, work for food, says Father Cañas.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: From a daily mute pot to 1,500 lunchesThe work grew by itself.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And a lot, since that June 14, 2017 when the priest and his right hand, Fabiola Ruiz, decided to make a community mute for Venezuelans who arrived from the border.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: We made for 200 and 250 arrived.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And many, when it was finished, asked us for the pot to scrape the bottom with their hands and eat.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: That hit me and thats why I decided to accompany the father, recalls the woman.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: There are many stories that intersect in the Casa de Paso Divina Providencia.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Photo Courtesy Casa de Paso Divina ProvidenciaAfter the mute experience, it was decided that on the 14th of each month there would be a lunch.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: But one day, when the number of people hungry for food exceeded 500 and more, Cañas made the decision to open a temporary home where there would be food every day.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Today, more than a year old, the work is no longer in diapers, but instead wears long pants.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Soon there will be restrooms and clinics for volunteer doctors.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Not everyone has money to pay for their needs, says Fabiola.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And Father Cañas adds First we had to do it alone, get donations.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And lunch was whatever was in the pantry.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: If there were eggs and lentils, then that was the case.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Later, the NGO Caritas arrived, but it supported the market until May.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: It seemed to complicate everything, but thank God now the WFP (United Nations World Food Program) has arrived, adds Fabiola.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Now, they have a guaranteed market for two thousand people each month.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: There are many voices that intersect in the middle of a glass of oatmeal and two pieces of bread.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And in doing so they run over the words.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: The ideas come out of eagerness and mixed.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They swim between complaints and gratitude.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Between the discomfort of having fled his country and the hope of a soon return.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: María Arcia agrees, 57 years old and two daughters she had to leave behind, as well as her beautiful restaurant in Valencia.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: I came to suffer, but not them, he says and then complains about the mistreatment of many Colombians, but also thanks these kitchens, God bless them.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And he affirms that he will return to his beloved homeland because Venezuela has the guarumo to get ahead.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Father Cañas works as hard as any of the volunteers who accompany him.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Photo Courtesy Casa de Paso Divina ProvidenciaKenya Zambrano coincides, a former motocross practitioner, with two years of law and one in performing arts.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: He lost a leg in an accident and for not voting in two elections, Chavismo denied him a prosthesis.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: He arrived 15 days ago in Colombia.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: They burned everything and told me that they were going to kill me for sleeping on the riverbank (Táchira, on the border).

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: I need a shelter and a job.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: This is where I eat, because I have no money.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: I can wash, iron, do whatever.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: But I will return to my country, even in 10 years, but I will return.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: And Ronny Pérez agrees, 48 years old, born in Vargas State and with strong vitiligo on his skin.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: He has been hungry, cold, but he has never denied help to a compatriot I sell hot dogs.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: If they ask me for food, I give them.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Until we can go back, because Venezuela is going to rise up, we have to protect ourselves.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: But also solidarity and support.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: In the end, they are together in a country that sometimes wants to leave them alone.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Sitting at the table, with a glass of oatmeal, two loaves of bread or a lunch, Casa de Paz Divina Providencia is your oasis.

title: The priest who feeds two thousand Venezuelans every day
text: Perhaps the only one they will find throughout the day.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: The IFJ research establishes that there is no solid information to analyze the relationship between insecurity and migration.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: The social photograph of the country in terms of poverty, before the scourge of the covid19 pandemic on the countrys social and economic indicators, showed that in 2019 there was a reduction of 1.6 percentage points in the Multidimensional Poverty Index, which It went from a level of 19.1 percent in 2018 to another 17.5 percent at the end of 2019, according to the Dane, which also highlighted the impact of the second wave of Venezuelan migration.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: The decrease in the indicator, which took into account the incorporation of data from the 2018 National Population and Housing Census (CNPV) as part of the methodological update and calibration of some variables, reflects public policy actions and targeted strategies, according to director of the entity, Juan Daniel Oviedo.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: In number of inhabitants, the Dane indicators show that between 2018 and 2019 there were 615,000 people who came out of multidimensional poverty, a percentage that was led by Nariño, with a reduction of 162,000 of 145,000 inhabitants in the Valley and another 143,000 who came out of this condition in the department of Atlántico.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: With this, at the end of 2019, according to the Dane, in 2019, of the total population of the country, 8.56 million inhabitants were in a situation of multidimensional poverty, against 9.1 million that were reported in 2018.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: By number of households, the figure fell from 2.33 million in 2018 to 2.22 million households in 2019, but the effect of Venezuelan migration on some variables, such as critical overcrowding and lack of health insurance, caused it to rise. the proportion of poor households with at least one foreigner (90 percent is Venezuelan) with respect to the total.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: According to the official, although between 2016 and 2018 there were the most important changes in the role of foreign migration in the composition of poor households, the participation of poor households with at least one foreigner went from 8.8 percent in 2018 to 10.7 percent in 2019, which is relevant because the number of households with multidimensional poverty decreased.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: That means that in that second wave of Venezuelan migration that we saw in 2019, we have some socioeconomic impacts on the conformation of the different variables that allow us to approach poverty from a multidimensional perspective, Oviedo indicated.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: Thus, in 2019 the Caribbean region reported that 48.52 percent of poor households had foreign migrants, a percentage that was 25.89 percent in the Eastern zone, made up of Boyacá, Cundinamarca, Meta, Norte de Santander, Santander and Bogotá, a city where the percentage was 8.93 percent.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: At a general level, the percentage of households with foreigners deprived due to critical overcrowding went from 11.4 percent in 2018 to 14.9 percent in 2019, while the proportion of poor households with migrants without health insurance went from 24, 6 percent to 31.8 percent.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: Strong impact on the situation in BogotáLooking at the results by region and city in which the measurement is divided, the one with the greatest increase in its multidimensional poverty was Bogotá, where the indicator had an increase of 3 percentage points, considered statistically significant, going from 4.1 per percent in 2018 to 7.1 percent in 2019.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: In other words, in Bogotá at the end of last year some 233,000 people entered this condition, for a total of 537,000 inhabitants in multidimensional poverty.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: According to the Dane measurement, in the countrys capital the indicators that caused multidimensional poverty to rise three percentage points were that of barriers to access to health, which due to the effect of migration led to the percentage of households deprived of this condition will go from 1.2 percent in 2018 to 10.3 percent in 2019, that is, an increase of 9.1 percentage points, while deprivation due to low educational achievement affected 21.8 percent of poor households, a percentage which in 2018 had stood at 18.5 percent.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: According to the figures, in the municipal capitals, multidimensional poverty  an indicator that weighs in equal parts variables related to the educational conditions of the population, children and youth, the work situation, health conditions and the physical characteristics of housing and access to public services went from 13.2 percent in 2018 to 12.3 percent in 2018, while in rural Colombia (populated centers and dispersed rural population) it also had a decrease, being located in 34.5 percent in 2019 compared to a percentage of 38.6 percent in 2018.

title: Multidimensional poverty was reduced, but the impact of migration increased
text: According to Oviedo, in indicators such as informal work and longterm unemployment there were declines compared to 2018, a situation consistent with the result of the unemployment rate, which closed last year at a level of 10.5 percent. .

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: In January of this year, 164 Colombians residing in Venezuela were deported, according to the director of the UNHCR (United Nations refugee agency) office in Cúcuta, Hans Hartmark.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: According to the official of the multilateral organization, between December and January mass deportations to Cúcuta have increased, which have been attended by the UN agency together with other entities.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: These people have been deported because in some cases they have not regularized their immigration status in Venezuela and they are people who have been detained for not having documents or not having them in force.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: The problem is that they may have lived for several years or even decades in Venezuela and therefore have their families in that country, explained Hartmark.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: The phenomenon of the deportation of Colombians from the neighboring country has increased considerably in recent years.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: Figures from Migration Colombia cited by Hartmark show that this problem is so acute that in 2014 1,772 Colombians were deported from that country.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: One of the great concerns of the United Nations agency is that among those deported are displaced Colombians who have had to leave for Venezuela and who require international protection.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: Hartmark added that what is done with the deported nationals is to provide them with humanitarian aid  lodging and food  and logistics to be able to return to their places of origin.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: This increase in deportations of Colombians from Venezuela had also been recently denounced by the Migration Center of the North American capital.

title: In January alone, 164 Colombians were deported from Venezuela
text: Neftalí Gómez, an official of that entity, affirmed that while before three Colombians were served on average per day, since December of last year more than twenty compatriots have been received asking for actionsIn addition to this phenomenon, this Wednesday the president of the Conservative Party, David Barguil, asked the Government to study a contingency plan to protect Colombians living in Venezuela from a possible humanitarian crisis in the neighboring country.

text: The Minister also indicated that in order to resolve the situation of the pimpineros, it would be desirable to formalize them by facilitating the establishment of service stations, either through cooperatives.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The newspapers The Washington Post and The New York Times dedicate two separate editorials this Wednesday to the border crisis between Venezuela and Colombia in which they coincide in accusing the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, of manufacturing the dispute with the neighboring country .

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The main border crossing between the two countries has been closed for two weeks, leading to a crisis manufactured by an increasingly unpopular president (Maduro) who is desperate to shore up support for his party ahead of parliamentary elections scheduled for December. says the New York newspaper.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The New York Times states that Maduros popularity fell to 24 percent in July, reflecting growing public dismay over government policies that have led to rising inflation, a seriously undervalued currency, and a worsening of food shortage.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: In addition, as relations between Washington and Caracas have improved marginally, Maduro has chosen to divert attention from his countrys problems by provoking unnecessary fights with his neighbors, says the New York newspaper, citing the territorial dispute between Venezuela and Guyanese.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: Regarding the current dispute with Colombia, the newspaper points out that Maduros eccentricities have interrupted an important commercial corridor, separated families and displaced hundreds of people from their homes.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: According to a report released this Monday and carried out by officials from UN agencies who visited the area, 1,100 Colombians have been repatriated in the last thirteen days by Venezuela and at least another 10,000 have returned to their country out of fear.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: Along the same lines as the Times, The Washington Post says in its editorial that Maduro has resorted to provoking a crisis with Colombia while his populist government seems to be heading for a major defeat in the legislative elections scheduled for December, if the vote is free and fair.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The Washington newspaper affirms that illegality and smuggling are common currency along the border between Colombia and Venezuela, but the problem does not come from Colombians, but from the disastrous economic policies of the Maduro government.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: Sadly, the Organization of American States (OAS) has proven incapable of dealing with the outrage of Maduro, according to the Post, which recalls that on Monday the allies of Venezuela blocked in that organization a request from Colombia to for the foreign ministers of the continent to address the border crisis.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: Meanwhile, the government of the US president.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: US President Barack Obama has limited himself to a lukewarm expression of concern over the degradation of the humanitarian situation, laments the newspaper.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The two newspapers also agree in praising the handling of the crisis by the government of Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos, of whom the Post states that he has reacted with moderation to Maduros cynical provocation.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: The Colombian authorities have wisely refrained from initiating a dialectical war that could increase nationalist fervor in Venezuela, says The New York Times.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: EL TIEMPO is also busy this Wednesday in its editorialHe also mentions that the country would be wrong to let this crisis be politicized or mixed with electoral or jingoistic interests, since it would be giving reason to Ambassador Chadertons argument.

title: Editorials of major US newspapers charge against Venezuela
text: In this sense, the support that the political parties have offered to the government of President Santos is key, since in international affairs nothing is worse than showing fissures.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: On Saturday, September 8, José Rodríguez, a Venezuelan migrant, was clubbed to death in Romaira, a state in northern Brazil.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: The people of the area accused him of having murdered a local who persecuted him after robbing a store, and the Army had to occupy the neighborhood, where 250 Venezuelans are concentrated, to contain the excesses.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: And on October 17, in Posorja (Ecuador), three people were lynched at a police station after a rumor was spread that they were cell phone thieves.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: In several Latin American countries, a part of the population agrees with taking justice into their own hands.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: This is revealed by a recent study by the Free University.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: The list is headed by Paraguay, Peru, Ecuador, Bolivia and Colombia.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: Here, about 25 percent of the population accept this practice.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: In fact, in Bogotá, 64 percent of citizens support it.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: According to Legal Medicine, between 2014 and 2017, 300 people died by lynching.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: And although, for Henry Murrain, executive director of Corpovisionarios, there is a tendency to reduce the validation of justice by ones own hand, the phenomenon remains high, since, he explains, one in three citizens considers it legitimate.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: In Colombia there is something that we must review carefully as a society and it is how we allow the removal of dignity and basic respect from certain people some hurt us and others seem insignificant to us, Murrain said.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: The teacher warned about an additional element that society is facing and it has to do with the spread of false information through social networks and that, as in the case of Ciudad Bolívar, mobilizes emotions that lead to irrational actions.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: We need to train critical citizens, with the ability to carefully review the information that arrives on the Internet, and that is not the fault of social networks, but of the skills and competencies of citizens to handle this situation, he added.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: Regarding the case of Ciudad Bolívar, Jerónimo Castillo, director of the area of security and criminal policy of the Fundación Ideas para la Paz (FIP), agreed with Murrain, pointing out that citizens do not have criteria to assume these situations from a critical perspective.

title: Alarm for cases of xenophobia and justice by own hand
text: It is not, as some analysts point out, to say that the media should broadcast in X or Y way, but rather that what must be tried is to provide elements of judgment so that citizens can get an adequate idea of the problems , He suggested.

title: Public calamity decreed in Puerto Carreño due to blackouts in Venezuela
text: Puerto Carreño, Vichada, decreed public calamity as of this Sunday due to the blackouts that have been taking place in the capital of the department due to the energy crisis that Venezuela is suffering.

text: For now, the city has had to rely on ACPMbased power plants since last Wednesday, March 6.

title: Public calamity decreed in Puerto Carreño due to blackouts in Venezuela

title: Public calamity decreed in Puerto Carreño due to blackouts in Venezuela

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: This Monday, the Ministry of Finance, in the MediumTerm Fiscal Framework (MFMP) presented to Congress an analysis of the salary gap between Venezuelan and Colombian migrants.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: The analysis ensures that for every 100 pesos per hour of work that an inhabitant in Colombia earns, the migrant only receives 65.1 pesos, so it is calculated that the salary difference is 34.9 percent.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: After knowing this information, two specialists in the subject analyzed the dataThe director of the Institute of Migratory Studies and Peace, Sergio Bueno, explains that the analysis of the Ministry of Finance ratifies the need for Colombia to advance with the documentation that must be given to foreigners, so that there is equal competence within of the labor market.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: Indeed, there may be a more dynamic process of economic and labor inclusion of the Venezuelan and foreign population in the countrys economic system, says Bueno.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: For the Chilean Rodrigo Sandoval, a consultant for the Institute of Migratory Stages and Peace, the report that we have just learned ratifies what several studies, the accumulated experience and many researchers have been pointing out for a long time, and that is that for migrations to have a positive in the national economy, require positive actions on the part of the State to ensure that this inclusion is in formal terms.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: Sandoval also explains that in the country important decisions of the State are required so that those people who participate in the economy do so in a formal way.

title: Experts analyze the wage gap between Venezuelans and Colombians
text: Finally, Sandoval exposes the responsibility that the States have in the matter.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: The UN on Thursday urged Latin American countries to continue welcoming Venezuelan refugees, and denounced the new border requirements implemented by Ecuador and Peru.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: In a joint statement, the UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), Filippo Grandi, and the Director General of the Organization for Migration (IOM), William Lacy Swing, called for greater support from the international community as the exodus is increasing, and they declared themselves concerned about several recent events that affect refugees and migrants who come from Venezuela.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: The two UN agencies referred in particular to the new requirements regarding passports and entry at the borders of Ecuador and Peru, as well as the modifications introduced to the temporary residence permits of Venezuelans in Peru.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: Colombia, which has received more than a million Venezuelans in the last 16 months, and has temporarily regularized 820,000 of them, denounced the measure taken by its neighbors, alleging that it favors clandestine migrations.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: On the other hand, more than 400,000 Venezuelans entered Peru in the last two years, within the framework of the opendoor policy that the authorities initially offered in the face of the social and economic crisis that Venezuela is experiencing.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: Peru then decided to require a passport from Venezuelans fleeing their country, when they detected income with false IDs.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: Migratory tensions are also increasing in other Latin American countries, such as Brazil, where there have been violent disturbances between immigrants and the local population.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: According to IOM and UNHCR, of the 2.3 million Venezuelans living abroad, more than 1.6 million have fled since 2015, when the country plunged into a serious economic and political crisis.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: 90 percent of them have taken refuge in countries in the region.

title: The UN returns and asks Ecuador and Peru to remove restrictions on Venezuelans
text: According to the UN, the most vulnerable, such as adolescents, women, people looking for their relatives and unaccompanied children, do not have the capacity to satisfy documentation requirements, and therefore are exposed to greater risk. exploitation, trafficking and violence.

text: We recognize the growing challenges in the face of the largescale arrival of Venezuelans, Grandi admitted, stressing that it is essential that any new measure continue to allow those who need international protection to be safe and able to make their asylum claim.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: 2019 will be the year with the highest budget in the history of Bogotá, and, with it, the return of major infrastructure works, after a decade in which the only work that was delivered was the trunk complex of Carrera 10th and Calle 26, with everything and the debacle of the hiring carousel.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: The last mission of the year for the Bogotá Council, approving the city budget, implies on this occasion a commitment to the reactivation of public works, after three years of procedures to obtain the resources and carry out the studies and designs of many of the the projects that the Mayors Office hopes to tender and contract in its last year of government.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: On the agenda is the contracting of the first metro line, three new trunk lines for TransMilenio (68100 avenue, 7th avenue and Ciudad de Cali avenue), the expansion and connection sections in the old trunk lines, the start of the construction of the Canoas plant to decontaminate the Bogotá River, 30 new schools, works on the Butterfly Trail in the hills, contracting for two new hospitals (Santa Clara and Usme) and 16 works financed by recovery.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: Parks, synthetic courts, kindergartens and health care centers are on the list.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: According to the budget processed before the Council of Bogotá, 86 percent of the resources will be for investment (see graph), out of a total of 22 billion pesos coming not only from local taxes but also from credit resources from the debt quota that the administration will begin to make effective in 2019, and transfers from the Nation.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: The trigger for the new works will only occur in the last year of government, since the first three went to the administration in the procedures to obtain the resources and prepare the tenders.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: Although between 2016 and 2018 at least 12 works that had already been paid for recovery were unlocked, but were underfunded, the new ones only come now.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: They will be hired and up and running, but they will not be delivered.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: According to the budget message from Mayor Enrique Peñalosa, the aim is to make the inhabitants of the city happier and for the capital of all Colombians to increase competitiveness, helping to drive the countrys economic growth.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: In 2019, the Bronx Creative District project should take shape, which will begin with the implementation of a Seine headquarters and the headquarters of the Los Mártires mayors office.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: It is one of the emblematic projects of the administration after the eviction of the drug traffic that had colonized the territory of downtown Bogotá.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: The aim is to make it the axis of the scenarios for innovation and promote the orange economy.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: The Mayors Office also hopes to start in 2019 the construction of the Las Mariposas trail, in the eastern hills, which it seeks to turn into an icon of tourism.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: During the study that was carried out in the Treasury commission, the councilors increased the items in which they considered that the administration had fallen short when it came to distributing the resources.

title: The Council Plenary approved this Sunday the 2019 budget
text: The Secretariat for Women won 3,000 million pesos in the discussion the Secretariat of Social Integration, 21,454 million and the Institute of Protection and Animal Welfare (recently created) also obtained an additional 3,000 million.

text: The lack of Police personnel was one of the reasons for the District to postpone the transfer of the nearly 300 Venezuelan migrants who are located in the area surrounding the transportation terminal in Salitre to the temporary camp located in a public property on Carrera 69 with Calle 47, Luis María Fernández neighborhood.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Cristina Velez, Secretary of Social Integration, stated that we had everything ready to make this transfer at dawn this Friday, but as a result of yesterdays demonstrations (Thursday) there was not enough force available to be able to do it as it should.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: This is a temporary camp and the idea is that it will be a solution until January 2019.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: According to the official, a new social infrastructure is going to be built on these lands for the most vulnerable in the city and they cannot remain occupied.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Some neighbors were concerned and uneasy about the decision to transfer Venezuelans to this part of the city.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: In this sense, they demanded greater controls, security, health, and that they be guaranteed that it will not be a permanent site for the arrival of more families to that site.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: The migrants arrived a little over four months ago at a public space known as El Bosque, next to the transport terminal, on Carrera 68 D with Calle 23.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Little by little, more and more families joined, until reaching more than 180.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Given this situation and after several incidents, the area was cordoned off and protected with metal fences.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: This led to at least another 200 people stationing themselves in the outskirts in stretched plastic cabins, almost out in the open.

title: Insecurity and migrants, debate after controversial phrase by Claudia López
text: The transfer operation had been scheduled for the early hours of this Friday, but it was not achieved.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: The information from the Social Secretariat warns that before taking them, commitments were signed and they were given a coexistence manual to minimize the impact on the new place where they are going to live temporarily.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: It is a point with a popular neighborhood on the north side, a home for grandparents and former street dwellers on the south, the Entre Verde residential complex on the east and a school lot on the west side.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: In addition, the area is bordered, less than a block away, by public and private offices.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Cristina Vélez, regarding the management of the situation in the new site, specified that all the protocols designed for this case are being complied with, based on the management given to the migration from Syria to Paris, in addition to having the support and joint work of the Agency for Refugees of the United Nations Organization (UNHCR), the International Office for Migration (IOM), Migration Colombia and the accompaniment of district entities such as the Ombudsman, the Police and the local mayors officeIn the new camp there are at least 10 bathrooms, each tent has between 4 and 8 cots, and other larger ones are equipped to serve people who are going to be in free beds, that is, more than 10 people.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: The site was illuminated, there will be rules of coexistence, greater control and there will be vaccination days, health care, medications, condoms, and food will be nonperishable.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: There will also be a unified command post (PMU) with all the district authorities to minimize the impact in the area and have control of the new neighbors.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: The children will be guaranteed a balanced diet, the same as what is delivered in the Amar centers, in compliance with the nutritional parameters, guaranteeing their rights and also quotas for kindergarten and school.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: For the entry and exit of the site, entry cards will be handled.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: All the aid will be channeled through the Colombian Red Cross, and the call to citizens is to deliver the support to the offices of this humanitarian aid entity.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: In the old camp there were several problems of coexistence, there were even injuries because they fought for food, clothing and sleeping.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: The situation was of such magnitude that even the one who managed everything there was a Colombian man who was called el paisa.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Neither rejection nor xenophobia we ask for securityThis Thursday night, neighbors and sector leaders met with District officials to analyze the impact of the arrival of migrants.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: Luis Guillermo Niño, president of the board of directors of the group that is across the street, told EL TIEMPO that there is no type of rejection or xenophobia with the arrival of the Venezuelan brothers.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: He warns that there was no planning, but it was a measure taken from one day to the next, and what is worrying is that before solving a problem, it will go deeper into it.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: A humanitarian solution is required, and what it will generate are tensions and difficult situations, he said.

title: Everything ready for the transfer of Venezuelan migrants from the terminal
text: In this sense, he asked the district and national authorities that participated in this process to make them aware of the protocols and plans that are going to be implemented, in such a way that we can prevent issues of insecurity, health, and vehicular congestion, said Niño. .

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Carlos Arturo Chanagá, president of the community action board (JAC) of the Luis María Fernández neighborhood, told this newspaper Venezuelans are welcome, but with safety, health, public health and control over overpopulation conditions in the sector.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Cándida Flórez, 36, cant stop thinking about the house that was about to be completed in the Colombian settlement My Little Barinas, in San Antonio del Táchira, and that she had to abandon when she was evicted by the Venezuelan National Guard.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: She says that seven years ago she arrived in that neighborhood, located on the other side of the border, on the banks of the Táchira River, opposite Villa del Rosario (Norte de Santander).

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: At that time, hundreds of Colombians arrived at the invasions in San Antonio.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Some were displaced by the violence and others were looking for work and the economic benefits that the government of Hugo Chávez gave them.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Along with My Little Barinas, the Ezequiel Zamora and Che Guevara settlements had also been built.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: They were Chavista neighborhoods and the deportees say that they even received identification cards issued by the late former president so that they could vote for him.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Now, many of those documents have been destroyed by the National Guard.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Flórez remembers that as a time of prosperity.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: He says that at that time they sold them mercales, that is, markets that they bought for the equivalent of 37,000 Colombian pesos.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: It was enough for six people a week, he says.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: In addition, she says that she lived with her husband, Ómar Calderón, and four children in a ranch made of canvas and sticks.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Her husband, who worked as a construction worker in San Antonio, kept cement blocks for four years, until in December of last year he began to build the family house.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: When President Nicolás Maduro ordered the closure of the border on August 19, due to the alleged attack on three members of the National Guard, Flórez only needed to install a new water tank and a couple of doors in the house.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Two days later, the Venezuelan president declared a state of emergency, deported 1,097 Colombians from the settlements and caused at least 6,000 more to decide to return to the country for fear of mistreatment by the Venezuelan authorities.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: After the border blockade, on Wednesday, the National Guard surrounded the neighborhood and kept its inhabitants locked up for two days.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Some men fled down the trails and left their families, for fear of being identified as criminals.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: They also knocked down a bridge that all the inhabitants of the neighborhood had built over a nearby ravine and that served them to go to San Antonio.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Then, house by house, Venezuelan officials removed all the Colombians they found, including Flórez, her husband and their four children, and sent them to Colombia, without their belongings.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Now, this family spends the nights under a red tent in the shelter of the coliseum of the Inem de Cúcuta school.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Without knowing yet what will become of her house, Flórez offers prayers so that nothing happens to her husband and son, who have ventured to cross the border on a trail to try to rescue their belongings.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: In the shelters there is pain and also anger due to the accusations that the Venezuelan government has launched and that associate Colombians with smuggling and paramilitarism.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Marcela Zambrano, who also spends her nights at the Inem shelter, says that the young people from the settlements were used by Venezuelan smugglers as porters to smuggle contraband products along trails and across the Táchira River from San Antonio to Villa del Rosario. .

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: According to several testimonies from deportees, Venezuelan smugglers offered 30,000 pesos for each 80kilo package of contraband goods that they moved from one side of the border to another.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: They add that, although some inhabitants of these settlements dedicated themselves to the job of porters at night to obtain extra income, the majority worked as workers and small informal merchants in San Antonio.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Many women, like Zambrano, did domestic work in the homes of Venezuelan families.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: In another shelter in Cúcuta, in the Migration Center, the expulsion has also left families fragmented.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Graciela Portilla, a 44yearold Colombian, says that her two eldest children, who are Venezuelans, remained in the neighboring country, and she believes that she will not be able to see them again due to the immigration sanctions imposed on deportees.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: For now, Portillo says that his drama has not been worse, because on Monday he was able to recover his three small children.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: The children had been left alone in Venezuela and for two and a half days they had to survive with a kilo of flour, bread and some potatoes that they had in the house, until members of the Jesuit community of the neighboring country found them and contacted their counterparts in Cúcuta to carry out the reunion.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: Graciela says that, during the time she was separated from her children, the minors called her on the phone.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: They cried and told me Mommy, the machines are here nearby, she says.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: His anxiety ended when he was able to hug them again.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: The three, hand in hand, crossed the Simón Bolívar bridge to meet him, to start over, a new life in Colombia.

title: The drama of the neighbors of My Little Barinas
text: I fell to my knees when I saw them, I never thought I would go through this.

title: The elephant in the room
text: CAROLINA RINCON AND ALBERTO MARIO SUAREZ

title: The elephant in the room
text: The gringos have a wonderful phrase to describe something that everyone knows but that no one dares to talk about the elephant in the room (the elephant in the room).

title: The elephant in the room
text: A metaphor that fits like a glove on a thorny issue on which we are playing blind the AIDS epidemic that is plaguing Venezuela and that threatens to reach our soil.

title: The elephant in the room
text: Nobody in Colombia wants to talk about that.

title: The elephant in the room
text: Or nobody wants to see the seriousness of that fact.

title: The elephant in the room
text: But the truth is that the neighbors are experiencing an HIVAIDS epidemic that is out of control.

title: The elephant in the room
text: And that threatens to reach Colombia as is happening with footandmouth disease, diphtheria and measles.

title: The elephant in the room
text: Diseases that returned to the country after many years, courtesy of the Chavista disaster that destroyed Venezuela and is generating the growing avalanche of migrants to our land.

title: The elephant in the room
text: But now it is about something much more serious HIVAIDS, a disease for which there is no vaccine or definitive cure.

title: The elephant in the room
text: It is estimated that there are 130,000 Venezuelans with the Human Immunodeficiency Virus.

title: The elephant in the room
text: But only 10 are using antiretrovirals, according to UNAIDS estimates.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The vast majority  90 of those infected  have not had access to medicine for four years.

title: The elephant in the room
text: And the reason is that the government of Nicolás Maduro ran out of money to be able to import them.

title: The elephant in the room
text: This is a gigantic problem deaths from AIDS in Venezuela have increased 75 since 2011, due to the lack of antiretroviral drugs.

title: The elephant in the room
text: And now with the massive migration flows, contagion is expected throughout all of Latin America.

title: The elephant in the room
text: A deadly epidemic whose gateway will be the Colombian borders.

title: The elephant in the room
text: And whose contagion vector will be the thousands of Venezuelan women and young people who are prostituting themselves in our faces.

title: The elephant in the room
text: All under the indifferent gaze of our men and the Colombian political class.

title: The elephant in the room
text: Just look at what is happening on the streets of Bogota one in three prostitutes is Venezuelan.

title: The elephant in the room
text: This was confirmed by a study carried out by the District Secretariat for Women and the Observatory of Women and Gender Equity of Bogotá.

title: The elephant in the room
text: An Xray that is repeated in several Colombian cities where Venezuelan women between the ages of 16 and 35 are coming to prostitute themselves.

title: The elephant in the room
text: That as a consequence of the lack of job opportunities and the accumulated hunger after decades of the Bolivarian revolution.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The numbers set the standard a Venezuelan sex worker in Colombia can earn in one hour the equivalent of a months minimum wage in Venezuela.

title: The elephant in the room
text: This is how the magazine The Economist calculates it in a report in which it warns about the dangers of the wave of women coming from the other side of the border.

title: The elephant in the room
text: There it is estimated that some 4,500 Venezuelan prostitutes are currently working in Colombia.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The mess is that many of them are carriers of HIV.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The double mess is that they have not received antiretrovirals for four years.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The triple mess is that they cannot afford the cost of these treatments, which cost between US10,000 and US30,000 a year.

title: The elephant in the room
text: I understand that this topic is complicated.

title: The elephant in the room
text: And that we choose not to see it because we are afraid to panic.

title: The elephant in the room
text: But you have to face it quickly and put the bell on the cat.

title: The elephant in the room
text: We are on the verge of an AIDS epidemic that may be more problematic and costly than any recent problem we have faced.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The problem is for our families and for the Colombian State.

title: The elephant in the room
text: The Government is in default of initiating mass campaigns of sexual education, distribution of condoms and circumcision for homosexual men.

title: The elephant in the room
text: Three effective ways to prevent contagion, according to epidemiological studies.

title: _It was a difficult meeting, but necessary_Foreign Minister Holguín_R
text: We have to hurry fast we have a huge elephant in the next room.

title: _It was a difficult meeting, but necessary_Foreign Minister Holguín_R
text: Colombia did not arrive at this Mondays meeting in Quito with the expectation of making great progress, but in the end it managed to start developing a common agenda with Venezuela to seek substantive solutions to the difficult problems that have been recorded on the border for decades. common.

title: _It was a difficult meeting, but necessary_Foreign Minister Holguín_R
text: The private meeting between presidents Juan Manuel Santos and Nicolás Maduro was not easy, although it did pave the way for promoting diplomatic dialogue around definitive decisions to fight drug trafficking, smuggling and other problems that afflict the border region.

title: _It was a difficult meeting, but necessary_Foreign Minister Holguín_R
text: EL TIEMPO even knew that the two talked completely alone in the Carondelet Palace for almost an hour.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: DANIEL VALEROSpecial envoy of EL TIEMPOQuito, Ecuador)

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: We ask you to please come to an understanding and help us.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: We Wayuu have nothing no roads, no water or sewage, we depend on the two nations and that is why we must come to an agreement, the message is from Sergio Cohen Epiayu, one of the highest authority Wayuu palabreros in the border area of La Guajira and Venezuela.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Sergio is part of a group of Wayuu palabreros who met yesterday in Maicao (La Guajira) to analyze the situation and make a joint statement to the Venezuelan and Colombian governments to open the border, The Alijuna (not Wayuu) first do things without exhausting the dialogue.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Nothing is gained by fighting, says the man who wears dark glasses, because he lost his vision in an accident.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: The Wayuu palabrero is an intermediary of the indigenous community.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Responsible for taking requests from the offended party to the aggressors, to resolve a conflict.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: And they are vested with great authority among the indigenous, thanks to the seriousness and preparation that experience gives them to face any problem that alters the peace between the families of the community.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Now he has offered his services to iron out the crisis between the two nations, which erupted after an attack on three members of the Venezuelan National Guard in the city of San Antonio at the hands of unknown individuals, and for which President Nicolás Maduro first closed the border with Norte de Santander on August 19, then decreed a state of exception for the state of Táchira after which 15,000 Colombians returned to the country, and added a new border closure between the state of Zulia and La Guajira last Monday.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Since the conflict began over the closure of the border in La Guajira, the Wayuu have been the most affected, as they do not recognize limits and claim their ancestral right to free mobility between the two nations.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: María Josefa Paz Epiayu recounts that since the closure there have been many indigenous people who have returned from the neighboring country to avoid mistreatment by the Venezuelan Guard and Army, and it pains her to know that they are leaving behind their ranches, which they built with a lot of work.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: The Wayuu Nation, as they call it, is made up of some 700,000 inhabitants who occupy 15,300 square kilometers in La Guajira, and 12,000 square kilometers in Zulia State, Venezuela.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: In the Koushorojuna ranchería of the Apushana clan, in the desert area of Paraguachón, there are 15 families that depend on trade on the border.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Katy González says that they market with the purchase and sale of goats, this has been what we have done all our lives, no one can block our paths, because we will always find another one, she says.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Only until yesterday at noon, when a table was set up with a Wayuu woman in charge of certifying that it was her countrymen who were asking to pass, the Venezuelan Guard kept the indigenous people from entering the neighboring country restricted via the Paraguachón road, so They had to look for the trails to go from one side to the other since Monday.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Thats where the pain of the palabrero comes from.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Both countries are our mothers for us, between the two parties we are the Wayuu, that is why the first affected by this tragic measure are the Wayuu, who live on the border, emphasizes the man, who is considered by his people as a messenger of peace, understanding and understanding.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: We have to tolerate in order to get out of a problem, presidents forget that they are elected by a people to seek quality of life, not to fight.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: The palabreros offered the millenary experience in the search for harmony between the two States, clarifying that there are no judges or arbitrators between the two governments, only simple, transitory and solemn messengers of words of peace.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: We are convinced that aesthetics is a guiding principle of human transactions.

title: Wayuu palabreros seek to mediate in border crisis
text: Consequently, the dialogue must be woven with the application and skill with which our artisan women make a beautiful backpack and be as harmonious as a delicate necklace.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: Leonardo Herrera DelghamsSpecial envoy of EL TIEMPO

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: The Venezuelan Foreign Minister, Delcy Rodríguez, called this Monday a reality show the meeting that her Colombian counterpart, María Angela Holguín, held in Geneva with the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Zeid Raad al Hussein, to explain the border problem between the two countries.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: Foreign Minister Holguín wastes his time in Geneva spreading falsehoods about the border with Venezuela  in the best style of a reality show, Rodríguez said on his Twitter account.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: He reiterated that Venezuela took sovereign measures to protect the people from crossborder crime that has overwhelmed the Colombian authorities at the border with the decision to close the crossings through the state of Táchira, ordered on August 19 and that since August 28 same month is total by this entity.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: The head of Venezuelan diplomacy wondered if Holguín actually exposed to Zeid the humanitarian exodus of Colombians to Venezuela fleeing from violence and poverty or the families abandoned in poverty in Colombian territory as a result of the failed neoliberal model .

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: It was also asked if Holguín spoke with the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights about the mass graves found with hundreds of dismembered and mutilated corpses.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: Cancellor Holguín have reported in Geneva how Colombia became the first producer of cocaine in the world

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: He added, always through his account on that social network.

title: Venezuela calls Holguín board and commissioner of UN_R a reality show
text: Holguín met this Monday in Switzerland with Zeid as part of the international tour to present his point of view on the border problem with Venezuela.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: On Wednesday, he plans to go to the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) or meet with the UN Secretary General, Ban Kimoon.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: Through its Twitter account, Migración Colombia reported that on Thursday night it was notified of Venezuelas decision to restrict the entry of its nationals to that country, starting tomorrow (Friday, August 21) by the Simón Bolívar International Bridge, in Norte de Santander.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: According to the immigration authority, the reasons of the Venezuelan authorities have to do with the high number of people who are in the state of Táchira complying with the isolation measures.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: Given this decision, Juan Francisco Espinosa, director of Migration Colombia, gave instructions to suspend the transit of buses with Venezuelan citizens to that department, in order to avoid possible traffic jams of people in the region.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: The decision to suspend the transfer of Venezuelan citizens to Norte de Santander seeks to guarantee the safety of the region, of the migrants and of those people who remain in the border area, both on the Colombian and Venezuelan sides, added the immigration authority.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: Espinosa explained that, in the next few hours, they will begin to organize, together with the mayors and governors, a new transfer schedule, addressing this situation that is occurring in the neighboring country.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: In addition, he called on the Venezuelan population to avoid moving at this time.

title: Venezuela restricts passage of its citizens from Colombia
text: This is not a time to mobilize, this is a time to take care of each other, he said.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: And he was a Chavista because he saw in him an option for change, but according to him, 16 years have passed and things are going from bad to worse.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: Due to different fragilities in the execution of the 2018 Population Census, the country will now have to wait until October 30 to know the consolidated data of the count, which in addition to quantifying the number of inhabitants, which will not reach 50 million, will give an xray of the distribution and level of aging of Colombians, among multiple variables.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: The director of Dane, Juan Daniel Oviedo, said that as of September 21, when the final court date had been set, 57 municipalities from eight regions are still pending.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: In addition, he recalled that the process began years later than expected, since the fall in state resources, due to the oil crisis, reduced the budget to apply the measurement in 2015 and 2016, so it ended up being applied in 2018. .

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: But this has been a complex year from the political point of view says Oviedo, since the law of guarantees came into force, there is little reaction capacity of Dane and Fonade in the face of events such as winter and security problems, as well as with the questions to look at conditions of disability.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: Likewise, the official pointed out as another reason for the delay the governance crisis of the electronic census, which could have quantified at least 10 million households, but only managed to cover half of that figure.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: The UN accompanied the electronic census, in which we did the bear because we did not give Colombians the assurance that it was a reliable platform.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: My technical doubts about the census operation are not about depth, they are about governance, emphasized Oviedo.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: And it is that, for example, one of the most complex cases has been registered in the archipelago of San Andrés and Providencia, a region in which, due to protests by the Raizal inhabitants, at least some 9,000 homes have not opened their doors to the Dane census takers, and if the partial data were closed, about 30,000 inhabitants would be left out.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: Similar situations have been seen in Cali (Valle del Cauca is the department with the most pending municipalities), because while in the Morichal de Comfandi neighborhood, which is of stratum 2, people do not allow access arguing that they are going to cross the bases of data to get them out of Sisbén, in other highstratum homes the pollsters have not been able to enter either.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: Oviedo maintains that when he took office, he found in the entity that the census budget lacked 25,000 million pesos, of which 14,000 million had been managed until last week, a figure that the official warns should be optimized.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: In very specific areas there are also security issues.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: For example, it is being studied whether it is possible to reach the rural area of Tumaco, where there were difficulties due to the operation carried out by the authorities around alias Guacho.

title: The messes that have not allowed to finish the census
text: On the other hand, a revealing fact that the final result will have is the number of Venezuelan citizens in the country, and that would be much higher.
