title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: THE TIME (ELTIEMPO) April 14, 2019Pompeos tour of the regionThe head of US diplomacy, Mike Pompeo, ended his visit to Peru this Sunday and arrived in Cúcuta around 4 in the afternoon, the first destination of hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans fleeing the crisis in their country.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: After attending a Palm Sunday mass in a Protestant church in Lima,Pompeo left shortly after noon for Colombia, the last leg of his South American tour, which began Friday in Chile.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Pompeo, after speaking about the Venezuelan crisis with Peruvian President Martín Vizcarra and his Foreign Minister Néstor Popolizio, declared that Peru was experiencing the effects of the disastrous Nicolás Maduro and the pain it has caused the Venezuelan people.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: As a result of the crisis in the once prosperous oil country, Peru had to take in 750,000 Venezuelan migrants, said the Secretary of State.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The politician also visited Paraguay and said that Peru has shown enormous leadership in responding to this challenge (the migratory avalanche).

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: They, the people of Peru, have generously welcomed nearly threequarters of a million refugees from Venezuela.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: More than three million Venezuelans, about 10 of the population, now live outside their country.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The UN projection is that by the end of 2019 there will be 5.3 million, in the largest humanitarian crisis in Latin America in times of peace.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Peru is the second country, behind Colombia, that has received the largest number of Venezuelans, 750,000 according to Popolizio, which has tested the capacity of Peruvian public services.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Lima projects that by the end of April there will be almost 800,000 Venezuelans in the country and the million barrier will be overcome in a few months if the current migratory flow is maintained.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Popolizio affirmed that the crisis in Venezuela is a global problem, and announced that the Lima Group, at the meeting it will hold on Monday in Santiago, will discuss new measures to reinforce Maduros isolation.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Pompeo praised Peru for welcoming so many Venezuelans, but bristled when asked by a reporter if this contrasts with President Donald Trumps decision to build a wall to prevent Central American migrants seeking a better life from reaching the United States.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The Secretary of State also spoke by phone on Saturday about the Venezuelan crisis with Brazilian Foreign Minister Ernesto Araújo, according to his spokesman.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: They (.) promised to continue working together to address the political, economic and humanitarian crisis in Venezuela, (and) its effects on Venezuelas neighbors, and the need for external actors, including Cuba, Russia and China, stop supporting Nicolás Maduro, Morgan Ortagus said in a statement.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The head of US diplomacy reiterated Washingtons support, in this very difficult time of transition, for the Venezuelan opponent Juan Guaidó, whom more than 50 countries recognize as the ruler in charge of Venezuela.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Peru was the promoter of the Lima Group, created in 2017 by a dozen American countries in search of a peaceful solution to the crisis in Venezuela.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: In addition, it was one of the first nations to recognize Guaidó when he proclaimed himself interim president following an interpretation of the Constitution, on January 23.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Pompeo praised Perus antidrug campaign that has eradicated thousands of hectares of coca crops, the raw material for cocaine.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Peru is one of the three largest producers of cocaine in the world and produces more than 400 tons a year, according to official figures.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Despite the seriousness of the situation in Venezuela, Pompeo stressed that the issue did not monopolize his talks in Lima, noting that they also discussed how Peru has been fighting public corruption as one of its priorities.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The future of four former Peruvian presidents is in the hands of justice in cases linked to the Brazilian construction company Odebrecht, which admitted to the US court that it paid 29 million dollars in bribes in Peru to be awarded public works contracts.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: The Secretary of State reiterated in Lima the criticism he made in Santiago of China, which has expanded its ties with Latin America and is now the largest trading partner of Peru and Chile.

title: Colombia and the US want a better future for Venezuelans Pompeo
text: Pompeo had a meeting on Saturday with the staff of the US Embassy in Lima and their families, and later had dinner with a dozen select Peruvian businessmen at the residence of the US ambassador, Krishna Urs.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: The organization insisted that the authorities seek new alternatives for effective assistance to the Venezuelan population and that their transfer be carried out in the most dignified and appropriate manner.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Silently, daily, they are arriving in Venezuelan Caribbean municipalities fleeing the crisis in their country.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Due to the closure, they do it by trails and exposing their lives to the gangs of thieves that haunt the illegal passes of the upper Guajira.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: In the Atlantic, with outreach through the main towns in the south of the department, irregular immigrants from Venezuela are being searched for, to register them and include them in the care plans for health and education services, especially for children, offered by the department.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: According to the Secretary of the Interior, Guillermo Polo, these actions are being developed in coordination with the Foreign Ministry and are aimed at having an official record of the number of immigrants.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: There are many people who entered through the trails of La Guajira and we do not have a report of those, that is why we cannot talk about how many immigrants from Venezuela have arrived, said the official, who added that although there is no official record of the number of Venezuelans, it is clear that in municipalities such as Santa Lucía, Suán and Candelaria, in the south, is where they are most concentrated.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Polo explained that they do not need many documents for the census, simply with the report in good faith, the records of the Venezuelans who have arrived, especially in the southern zone, are being made, he said.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: In different parts of the Caribbean there are stories of neighbors who came looking for job opportunities.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: In Maicao, Maritza Ramírez, 45, says that she had to cross the border by trails, to work as a domestic servant in a family home, where she earns about 200,000 pesos a month.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: He says that three children were left in the care of his eldest daughter, 17 years old.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Its either this or let them starve.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: On Sundays I travel to visit them, he says.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Stories like Maritzas are repeated both in the main cities of the Colombian Caribbean and in the most remote towns.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: The authorities have also detected that in some border areas many arrive for days, to work, and return to Venezuela.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Eliécer Quintero, secretary of the Government of La Guajira, assures We have an influx of Venezuelans and Colombians residing there who enter our territory to carry out work of all kinds construction, general services, domestic.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: The authorities have drawn attention to the risk that citizens who do not regularize their stay in the country may end up being exploited for work.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: There are people who take advantage of the condition of migrants in an irregular situation to make a profit, said the general director of Migration Colombia, Christian Krüger.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: The official added that operations are being carried out in La Guajira, Norte de Santander and Arauca, to initiate investigations and financially sanction legal or natural persons who hire citizens of the neighboring country with irregular stay in the country.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: Krüger explained that this is done because if those hired do not have a work permit they cannot be affiliated by their employers in the social security system.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: In the long term, from a pension point of view, these people are going to be left with a void, he added.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: The idea, he pointed out, is to protect migrants even if they have not legalized their stay.

title: With loudspeakers they search for Venezuelan migrants in Colombia
text: They have their rights and we have to ensure that they are not violated, he concluded.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Name changed at the request of the source.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: With 8,652 Venezuelans, belonging to 4,272 families, the Administrative Registry of Venezuelan Migrants (RAMV) in Bucaramanga ended.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Now, these people expect the National Government to regularize those who are not and implement public policies with which resources will be made available to serve them in areas such as health and education, among others.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Together with the capital of Santander, the registration was made in 1,019 enabled points in 30 departments and 413 municipalities in the country.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: It had the support of 23 municipal, departmental and national entities and 1,210 people in logistics work.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: This work, which took place over two months, resulted in a total of 819,034 Venezuelans registered in the country, of which 376,572 have regular status and 442,462 are irregular.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: To this figure must be added the 250,000 Colombians who returned, which means that 1,069,034 are waiting for aid.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: The director of the Bucaramanga Risk Management Office, Luis Ernesto Ortega Martínez, indicated that with the information collected, it is possible to demonstrate the state of the population in terms of education, health, level of schooling, who works and who does not. , if they plan to stay permanently, if the population that is here has their family nucleus or not and if they plan to bring them, among others.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: What we hope is that once the public policy is defined on how they are going to be attended, the Colombian Ministry of Education, Labor, Health and Migration will tell us how to apply it.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Likewise, receive the resources to be injected into the population because the resources of the municipality are insufficient, said Ortega Martínez.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: The personero of Bucaramanga, Omar Alfonso Ochoa Maldonado, who accompanied the registration sessions, pointed out that based on the information provided, it was detected that the ages of the migrants are between 18 and 45 years old and only 10 percent is a population of the elderly, have secondary education, there are 10 percent of pregnant women and pregnant women.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: The bulk of the population are young people with secondary education, some technicians and professionals.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: We continue to serve the population on different issues.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In terms of education, we have worked with the Secretariat and in an articulated work and 90 of the children who requested education were located.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In some cases it has been difficult because some do not have identification, but we have also worked with the Registry to resolve this issue, said the Personero.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Ochoa Maldonado pointed out that to date his office has served 939 Venezuelans in various consultancies.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In health, 36 procedures have been carried out (20 for pregnant mothers, 15 for emergencies and one psychological care) 50 in the Notary, 60 in the Registrars Office, commercial establishments have been operative that left 41 humanitarian transfers and two sites were sealed.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In the controls to establishments, 15 companies registered a possible breach in the hiring of migrants, for which the sanctioning processes that are underway were initiated.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: The sanctions could be between 1 and 15 legal monthly salaries in force, said the Personero.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: On the educational issue, the Secretary of Education of Bucaramana, Ana Leonor Rueda Vivas, pointed out that in the public schools of Bucaramanga there are 1,113 children and adolescents from Venezuela receiving classes, of which 580 are girls and 533 boys.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: They are in all schools and in all grades.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Some of them have Colombian nationality, so it cannot be said that they are all Venezuelans, said the official.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: Venezuelans who did not register will not have the possibility of receiving aid, because telephone numbers and emails were requested, to be contacted by the Government when the aid plans begin.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In terms of health, to date the Bucaramanga Health Institute (Isabú) has attended, between January and April 2018, 1,211 Venezuelans.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: During 2017, 8,752 health services were performed.

title: Venezuelans in Bucaramanga, waiting for government aid
text: In the case of the University Hospital of Santander, 1,086 Venezuelans have been received between 2017 and 2018, whose value for services reaches 3,358 million pesos.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: The inhabitants of the neighborhoods Albania, Álvarez and a sector of Morrorico in Bucaramanga, lost the first legal battle to try to relocate nearly 500 Venezuelans who are living in small campeches in this residential sector, outside the Parque del Agua.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: The 19th Municipal Civil Court of Bucaramanga declared the guardianship inadmissible, arguing that, since it was about collective rights, it should proceed under a popular action.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: It is an argument in form but not in substance, the violated rights remain the same, said the person who filed the guardianship, who prefers to reserve his name for security.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: Community leaders from the affected neighborhoods affirm that they are already organized to file a popular action, as ordered by the judge.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: In the meantime, they will have to continue to solve this complex situation by their own means.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: More and more migrants arrive on the platforms of these neighborhoods.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: There are already more than 500 Venezuelans living in public spaces, and the fear of the community has increased, as there have been several fights that have occurred in recent days.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: Last Wednesday, June 24, there was a strong fight between the same migrants, in this video it is evident how, between approximately eight people, they attack another with sticks, stones and even knives.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: The Metropolitan Police of Bucaramanga (Mebuc) has had to make a presence in the sector several times to maintain order.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: EnVideo a strong fight with stones, sticks and knives appeared this morning, apparently, between a group of Venezuelan migrants, who have been living in small cambuches in the area surrounding the Water Park of Bucaramanga for several weeks.

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: pic.twitter.commvJ1K8AiUg DNA Bucaramanga (ADN_Bucaramanga) June 24, 2020This morning, the Fundación Mujer y Futuro made a donation of personal hygiene kits for the population located in this sector, a vital gesture for this community, since due to their condition they cannot access the slightest hygiene care .

title: Guardianship to relocate Venezuelans in Bucaramanga did not prosper
text: AEstaHora The Foundation Mujeryfuturo1 delivers hygiene kits to the migrant population that is living in cambuches near the Water Park.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: On the same Friday, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said that 15,174 Colombians have left Venezuela following the order of Maduro, who in turn highlights that some 6 million Colombians reside legally and are part of the population of 30 million inhabitants of Venezuela.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: Nicolás Maduro ordered this Friday the reopening of the border crossings that are located in the state of Táchira and border Colombia, in the department of Norte del Santander.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: In full exercise of our sovereignty, I have ordered the opening of the border crossings with Colombia in the state of Táchira, starting this Saturday, June 8.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: We are a people of peace that firmly defends our independence and selfdetermination, the president said on his Twitter account.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: The president did not specify whether the border bridges will also be enabled for land transport, prohibited since August 2015 after two Venezuelan soldiers were injured at the hands of alleged smugglers.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: Maduro ordered the closure of the border crossings that Venezuela shares with Colombia through the state of Táchira on February 22, a day before the opposition tried unsuccessfully to force donations of medicines through those borders to alleviate the national shortage of medicines. .

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: Since then, relations between the two countries, which share a 2,219kilometer border, have been formally broken.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: After this episode, pedestrian passage through three of the four binational bridges located in that area has been restricted, although with access for people for medical or school reasons.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: The fourth bridge, that of Tienditas, has never been opened for the passage of pedestrians or vehicles.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: In recent years, the Venezuelan government has ordered the closure of land and sea borders on several occasions, alleging alleged foreign interference and other causes against the socalled Bolivarian revolution.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: Venezuela shares a border with Colombia in two other regions of the country, where the pedestrian crossing has been kept open with the same restrictions as in Táchira.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: The migratory flow between Colombia and Venezuela has been maintained through irregular steps, some located very close to the posts controlled by the authorities and security forces of both countries.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: Numerous Venezuelans cross illegally on alternative roads every day to stock up in Colombia, due to the deep shortage of basic goods.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: The authorities of both countries denounce that drug traffickers, fuel smugglers, paramilitaries and guerrillas of the Colombian National Liberation Army (Eln) operate in that territory, the latter, according to Colombia, with the tolerance of Maduro.

title: Maduro orders the reopening of border crossings with Colombia
text: On May 10, the Venezuelan government also decided to reopen its land border with Brazil and the sea border with Aruba.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: The limits with Bonaire and Curaçao remain closed.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: The governors of the country warned this Monday that the arrival of Venezuelans in Colombian territory is massive and that the accounts that the Government manages on the subject do not agree with the situation.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: This was expressed at the end of a meeting they held in the Casa de Nariño with President Juan Manuel Santos and with the mayors of the territories most affected by this migratory phenomenon.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: There is a situation of figures that do not agree.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: We have been clear about the work that has been done and we know that the numbers do not add up.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: And in the face of this, what we have said is that the situation is more serious than is thought, expressed the governor of Bolívar, Dumek Turbay, who spoke for the leaders.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: According to statistics from the Government and the International Organization for Migration (IOM), until December 31, some 600,000 people from the neighboring country remained in Colombia.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: The number could be higher if one takes into account that along the 2,219 kilometers of border there are some 280 crossings through which no entry control is exercised.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: Turbay explained that, for example, there are cities like Cartagena, where new neighborhoods are being created with Venezuelans and Colombians who are returning from the neighboring country, who do not have the basic conditions for survival.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: What most worries the sectional leaders is the lack of regulation with which Venezuelans enter, many of whom do not appear in the official records.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: That was, according to Turbay, the express request of the governors that the people who are entering Colombia can be fully identified.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: Precisely one of the objectives of the Santos government is that Venezuelan migrants enter through the seven registration posts enabled throughout the border, with the purpose of improving the information system and assistance.

title: Governors warn that the migration of Venezuelans 'is serious_
text: Santos will travel to Cúcuta this Thursday to see the situation firsthand and provide a multisectoral response, not only to the border municipalities but to all the areas affected by this event.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: One of the priority measures that the Government will implement, according to what emerged from the meeting on Monday, will be the implementation of the socalled humanitarian attention centers in the border areas, which are transit shelters for citizens arriving from Venezuela.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: Migration has shown that it has memory, it recognizes paths, it remembers the roads it passed through and the ways in which the arrival journey unfolded.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: So now, trying to escape the pandemic, many Venezuelans have started their journey back to the same place where they entered the first time the Simón Bolívar international bridge.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: This is how Víctor Bautista, Secretary of Borders and International Cooperation of Norte de Santander, narrates the current migratory ebb.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: Since the word coronavirus became one of the most pronounced and paralyzing, it is as if for many Venezuelans all roads lead to Norte de Santander, an area that over the years has become a strategic entry and exit corridor for millions of people. people.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: For Bautista, understanding this department is fundamental, since it has been years since its inhabitants know what a day is like without hearing from crisis committees or unified command posts.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: Instability has been implanted in peoples minds, and the anguish generated by seeing thousands leaving with children on their shoulders, empty hands or half a life in a suitcase will never be something that can be easily processed, but rather feeds impotence and need to help.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: Consequently, in times of covid19, Norte de Santander has been joined by a hodgepodge of additional problems to those that already existed on the one hand, there is the presence of walkers, as those who decided to embark on their path of turn on foot also the eternal wait of those who have lived for years on the border and are now waiting for authorization to return, and, in addition, those who arrived on buses, either regularly or illegally, looking for a transit quota to their nation.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: The pandemic closed the borders, although nobody was supposed to travel, that remained on paper.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: We were told that it was an exceptional process, but from exception to exception we are already seeing 60,000 people who have arrived in these regions, Bautista testifies, but not before thanking the Government for its great efforts in trying to contain the mass departures in the midst of a a situation that can hardly be controlled by one side, since the mobilization depends on the provisions dictated by Nicolás Maduro.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb
text: In official figures provided by Juan Francisco Espinosa, director of Migration Colombia, it is revealed that since March 14, 2020, more than 70,000 Venezuelans have returned in more than 945 buses ordered by the Colombian authorities.

title: What is lived and suffered in Norte de Santander with the migratory ebb

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: According to the institution, social networks facilitate the contact of the victims and in addition to offering money or items that attract attention, they encourage other young people to convince others.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The childhood expert agrees with this, assuring that criminals enter groups of Venezuelan migrants or are included in chats to make these offers.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: They do it because they are digital channels that are not frequently monitored by the authorities and the information is shared word of mouth, he says.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Within the identified organizations, the police assure that there are gangs that are dedicated to commercial sexual exploitation, labor exploitation trafficking, servitude and servile marriage, a modality under which the victims marry to obtain legal papers and end up being sexually or labor exploited.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The Papaz Network, an organization that also coordinates the alliance between organizations of the national complaint line TeProtejo.org, emphasizes that children are subject to special protection and that by law all material of a sexual act with minors is an abuse.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Although in Colombia the age of sexual consent is 14 years old, Quintero argues that the legislation defines as illegal any audiovisual content that contains sexual material with minors under 18 years of age and that its carrying, distribution or storage configures pornography with minors.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: According to the authorities, the crime is punished depending on the fact and the age of the victim.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The penalty can range from 8 to 60 years in prison.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The number of years can also indicate whether there are multiple crimes in a case, such as child pornography and abusive carnal access or abusive sexual act.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: From 2012 to date, 34,979 URLs containing child sexual abuse content have been blocked.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: According to the annual data provided, it is identified that there was a blockage of 2,210 pages in 2012 to a blockage of 2,234 pages so far this year.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: In the last 8 years, the Police, together with Interpol and other investigative units, have made 276 arrests related to the crime in nine operations dedicated to child sexual abuse on the Internet.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: In 2018 alone, 43 captures were made.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: According to figures from the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare (ICBF), during the first 8 months of 2018, the institution opened a total of 9,102 administrative processes that seek to restore the rights of minor victims of sexual abuse.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: A number that represents an increase compared to the immediately previous year represented in 38 daily cases in 2018 compared to 31 that were attended in 2017.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The scourge of sexual abuse has a face in the regions.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: According to Family Welfare data, the largest number of cases this year have been filed in Bogotá, with more than 2,200 processes.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The five areas with the highest number of cases are Valle del Cauca (946), Atlántico (569), Cundinamarca (553), Magdalena (389) and Huila (350).

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: The call of the authorities is to denounce and protect minors.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Complaints can be made either through the Attorney Generals Office, the nearest SIJIN Police unit, or the virtual platforms  or  .co.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Also, citizens can make reports of child abuse content on the Internet through the virtual complaint line Quintero for his part also assures that it is vital to invite the migrant population to participate.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: In case of mistreatment and abuse of minors, they can call the national line 141 of the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare and report the situation.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Migrants can also contact UNHCR camps and care points in different cities.

title: Stolen childhoods thus deceive and profit from minors online
text: Even if the victim is not Colombian, according to the convention on the rights of the child, to which Colombia adhered, the State is obliged to protect all minors who are in the national territory, regardless of whether they are registered with another nationality.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: In times like the one we are experiencing is when human beings have to show the best of our essence.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: The general director of Migration Colombia, Christian Kruger Sarmiento, during his visit to the border between Colombia and Ecuador, assured that he respects the decisions adopted by neighboring countries, but urged them to evaluate and reconsider them so as not to affect migrant populations.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: The official spent more than three hours between Rumichaca and Ipiales with the purpose of making a balance of the first eight days of the imposition of the visa for Venezuelan citizens by the Ecuadorian Government.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: We respect the sovereignty of the countries, but we call to reconsider the measures that are imposed, which are detrimental to a population that migrates out of necessity, he said.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: Then he made one more exhortation we have to work as sister territories, as sister countries to be able to address this situation in a joint and coordinated manner.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: For Kruger, there are living borders such as those between Colombia and Ecuador, so closing them or requiring visas from populations that migrate more out of necessity than simply for pleasure all it does is encourage irregularity and illegality.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: The director of the agency, after holding a meeting with authorities, security agencies, the Ombudsmans Office and international cooperation entities, declared that we cannot believe that demanding a visa or closing a border is going to stop a population that is dying of hunger and in need.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: He stated that his presence in the border zone is due to the fulfillment of precise instructions from the Foreign Minister of Colombia, Carlos Holmes Trujillo, and added we are not responsible for the situation in Venezuela, but we are called upon to lend a hand to this sister nation in these moments.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: As for the figures for the arrival of Venezuelan migrants in Rumichaca, they have now changed.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: According to the official, after the implementation of the visa by the Ecuadorian government, an average of 50 Venezuelans are passing through the authorized points daily, but there is a considerable difference with respect to those who decide to go through the illegal trails or steps.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: We are aware and based on conversations with Venezuelan migrants they have told us that many of them have passed through the trails putting their lives and those of their families at risk, he added.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: Regarding the impact caused by the presence of Venezuelans in terms of security in the border city of Ipiales, according to Migration Colombia, it has been positive since 7 crimes committed by citizens of that country were identified.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: The visa is not for a migration that is hungry, the only ones who benefit from this kind of impediments are the criminals, they are those transnational networks that take advantage of the vulnerable situation of this entire population, he noted.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: More than 80 percent of Venezuelans who wish to enter Ecuador, according to Migration Colombia, do not intend to stay in that nation but to continue to other countries on the continent such as Peru, Chile and Argentina where they are expected by relatives to reunify their families.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: These types of measures also affect the essential core of society, he specified and called for a humanitarian corridor to be set up on the border, as proposed by the Ipiales Mayors Office.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: Another of the great difficulties for Venezuelans arriving in Rumichaca is related to the high cost of obtaining a visa.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: While in Colombia the special residence permits and border mobility cards are completely free, the visa in Ecuador costs 50 dollars, much higher than the minimum wage in Venezuela, which amounts to 3 dollars.

title: Colombia asks Ecuador to reconsider visa requirement for Venezuelans
text: Added to the above is the requirement of a valid passport that most migrants have not processed.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: Kruger finally sentenced during his visit to the EcuadorianColombian border that the definitive solution is that all the countries receiving migrants apply the same principles and criteria, because restrictive measures such as those adopted by Ecuador generate underreporting that influences the security of the receiving communities. .

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: Soacha will not have a shelter for migrants, but it will have a hospital tent with 100 beds.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: This was confirmed by the mayor of Soacha, Juan Carlos Saldarriaga, after the Minister of the Interior, Alicia Arango, spoke of the possibility of installing a temporary home there, in agreement and under the approval of the municipality.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: Arango had contemplated the opening of eight shelters in various regions of the country, starting with Soacha, Cúcuta, Nariño and La Guajira.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: These are border sites where we have the greatest migration and the mayors and governors have asked us for help to be able to isolate the migrants in such a way that they can comply with the mandatory preventive isolation, Arango explained, adding the coordination will be done with the Mayors and Governors to establish service points in an alliance with the departmental Health Secretaries.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: Articulated work with mayors and governors is fundamental.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: The dialogue began last week.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: However, this Friday the Mayor of Soacha denied that possibility We just spoke with the presidency and we managed to arrange that this shelter tent does not reach the municipality of Soacha but a hospital tent, which will be installed in the Cardiovascular Hospital.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: It is estimated that 30,000 Venezuelan migrants live in the neighboring municipality of Bogotá.

title: Soacha will no longer receive the shelter for migrants
text: On the other hand, the municipal president asked the Presidency and Migration Colombia for the presence of a patrol in the city.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: The Ciudadela 2000 and Villa Fanny neighborhoods were the first sectors of Cartagena that were the scene of strong operations carried out by the District in search of Venezuelan citizens who are illegal.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: During the inspection it was found that 11 homes in the Ciudadela 2000 neighborhood are being inhabited by Colombians who, as a result of the situation in the neighboring country, decided to return to their land in search of new opportunities, said Fernando Niño Mendoza, Secretary of the Interior. and Citizen Coexistence.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: In Villa Fanny, the authorities located a pregnant Venezuelan woman and her Colombian husband in extreme poverty.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: According to the mayor of Cartagena, Manuel Vicente Duque, hundreds of Venezuelans have tried to take over several properties in different parts of the city and for this reason the authorities will increase control measures and a census is being prepared that will be accompanied by Migration Colombia to evaluate the state of illegality in Colombia of many Venezuelan brothers.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: In the entire north coast of Colombia, because they tell me that Barranquilla is the same, we are paying the consequences of the disaster in Venezuela.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: For example, in town three of Cartagena we went to dismantle an invasion of Venezuelans and they have been moving from one sector to another in search of invading, and we cannot allow this, although it is true that we are facing a humanitarian crisis, said the Mayor Duque who assured that the problem had already been communicated to the Ministries of Health and Housing.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: We have to study the cases in a particular way because many have Colombian families and they are return operations, for this reason it is necessary to carry out a census and characterize each of these people, explained Niño Mendoza.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: Niño Mendoza explained that these people came to the city as a result of the social and economic crisis that Venezuela is experiencing and stated that their needs are in terms of health, education for their children and basic public services to be able to live in decent conditions.

title: Cartagena prepares census for Venezuelans
text: I left my two children in Maracaibo, a 7yearold with their father and a oneyearold with my mother, and Im willing to do anything because I have to return in a month. there, in my house, in my land , debts dont wait, narrates Nancy, a 26yearold who hangs around the Historic Center at night.

title: Venezuelans come to market in Barranquilla_R
text: The president of the National Union of Merchants (Undeco), Orlando Jiménez, said that one of the factors that is contributing to inflating the prices of the family basket in Barranquilla is the arrival of Venezuelan merchants, especially in the public market and Granabastos, where they make large purchases to take back to their country.

title: Venezuelans come to market in Barranquilla_R
text: For eight days they have been buying perishable and nonperishable products to take away, making good offers to local merchants, said Jiménez, who acknowledges that at this time the Barranquilla merchants are doing great business with the neighbors, who buy in large quantities. and at a good price.

title: Venezuelans come to market in Barranquilla_R
text: Trucks loaded with merchandise leave the plazas of Barranquilla for Maicao and Riohacha, where they transfer to the neighboring country.

title: Venezuelans come to market in Barranquilla_R
text: In the Paraguachón sector (La Guajira) they are received and escorted by the Venezuelan guard to Maracaibo, the final destination of many of these products.

title: Venezuelans come to market in Barranquilla_R
text: If there is a lot of demand and little supply, things become more expensive, Venezuelans are the ones who are offering good prices and hoarding what is in the local market, explained Jiménez.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: That is not done, Santos said.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Humberto Araque, 70, was of no use this Wednesday showing the Venezuelan guards that he had an ID from that country and that he has lived in Barinas for 50 years.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: In a low voice, a guard, armed with a pistol, simply replied that the order they had received since midnight was that the border had to be closed and that only students would be allowed to pass.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: And indeed, since dawn, the Venezuelan uniformed men put up some fences and crossed two trucks over the bridge, about 40 meters from the beginning of the structure.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: On the Colombian side of the barricade, a score of Araucanians were not resigned to the measure.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Marina, who did not want to give her last name, said that she arrived at the viaduct around 530.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: m. because she had a medical appointment in Guasdualito (Apure state).

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: On the other side of the fences, a guard carrying a rifle limited herself, in a friendly tone, to asking not to be asked anything.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: They only gave us the order to close, they have not told us anything else, he said.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Meanwhile, Gleydis Rodríguez hurriedly appeared, bringing her daughter by the hand, who studies at a school in Arauca.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: I came walking from the Marina (about 400 meters) and they let me pass because I brought the girl, he said.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: According to her, at the passage of the boats (two kilometers above the bridge) they did not allow parents to pass with their children.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: While the guards remained on the bridge, below, on the Arauca River, and as if displaying strength, two boats with Venezuelan soldiers, and with a huge machine gun mounted on the front, moved up and down along the border. .

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: For the mayor of Arauca, Luis Emilio Tovar, the decision of the president of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, was something that could be seen coming.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: According to Tovar, the measure particularly affects a significant number of Colombian families residing in El Amparo (Apure), where rents and services are much cheaper.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: He added that trade has been significantly reduced, since in Venezuela there are no products from the family basket to smuggle.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Of course, he admitted, gasoline smuggling continues.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Hopefully, with the closure of the border, they will prohibit the passage of everyone, not just good people.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: On the other side there are guerrillas who hide only to attack our Armed Forces, said the mayor.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Meanwhile, Gisela Garcés, executive president of the Chamber of Commerce, pointed out that this measure also affects many Venezuelans who work in Arauca, since in the neighboring country the minimum wage does not reach 100,000 pesos.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: He highlighted as favorable the measures taken last Monday by President Juan Manuel Santos, such as removing VAT from some products at the border.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Part of the problem for Arauca lies in the communication difficulties it has with the rest of the country.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Going to Cúcuta, through Venezuelan territory, takes about five hours, and through Colombian roads at least 14.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: This Thursday morning there will be about 50 Colombian children who will try to cross the border to study in Arauca, as they do every day.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: Most will do it by boat, passing the swollen Arauca River.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: And Araque plans to return to the bridge.

title: This is how the first day of border closure was experienced in Arauca
text: He does not lose hope that they will let him pass.

title: Common border is now open
text: His face was seen and he looked like Santander, Maduro said.

title: Common border is now open
text: After a year of closure, the border between Colombia and Venezuela was opened.

title: Common border is now open
text: At five in the morning yesterday, the unblocking occurred, which was announced on Thursday by the presidents of both countries, Juan Manuel Santos and Nicolás Maduro, after the meeting held in Puerto Ordaz, a town located in the state of Bolívar, in neighboring territory. .

title: Common border is now open
text: The massive arrival of Venezuelans was immediate.

title: Common border is now open
text: According to Migration Colombia, until noon this Saturday, more than 28,000 people had entered Colombian territory.

title: Common border is now open
text: The report revealed that only through the Simón Bolívar bridge, which connects Villa del Rosario (Norte de Santander) with the town of San Antonio, in the state of Táchira (Venezuela), more than 22,000 people had entered Cúcuta.

title: Common border is now open
text: By Port Santander (North Santander), 3,700 by Arauca 1,500 and by Paraguachon (La Guajira) 1,2

title: Common border is now open
text: On the Simón Bolívar bridge, Venezuelans walked slowly through the large crowd of people Many of them carried the flags of the two countries in their hands, along with unoccupied suitcases, bags and backpacks ready to be filled in the Colombian markets, some of which increased the range of products in the basic basket by up to 50 percent, such as rice, sugar, corn flour, pasta, oil, panela and personal hygiene products.

title: Common border is now open
text: With an empty basket, Fabiola Mendoza eagerly crossed the limit line.

title: Common border is now open
text: The 42yearold woman, like many, came to Colombia from the city of Valencia, in search of scarce food in her country.

title: Common border is now open
text: I come for food, because there is none there.

title: Common border is now open
text: When you can stand in line for maybe eight hours, you get two packages of flourpan.

title: Common border is now open
text: But sometimes you stand in line and you dont get anything, said the Venezuelan.

title: Common border is now open
text: Others lined up with medical formula in hand to try to get the medicines that Venezuela hasnt been able to get for months.

title: Common border is now open
text: Merchants from Cúcuta, such as Horacio Sánchez, manager of the Los Montes supermarket, pointed out that although there has been a large flow of people, sales have been more calm compared to the weekends of July 10 and 17, when Two days were held so that Venezuelans could go and buy (in Colombia) basic necessities.

title: Common border is now open
text: This time, as agreed by both countries, the border crossing will remain enabled from 5 a.m. Until 8 pm. (Colombian hour).

title: Common border is now open
text: Hand in hand with this unlocking, which began yesterday, Migration Colombia began the registration of people entering the country.

title: Common border is now open
text: For this, the citizens of the neighboring country had to fill out a form called the Border Transit Migratory Card, whose information will be systematized, which will be an input for the issuance of a future Migration Facilitation Document.

title: Common border is now open
text: As the hours went by, the number of travelers increased, to the point that the immigration authority managed an average of 5,000 travelers per hour.

title: Common border is now open
text: Víctor Bautista, director for Development and Border Integration of the Colombian Foreign Ministry, said that, in a first phase, the delivery of the Migration Facilitation Document, which is expected to take place in about 20 days, will be for students and workers that frequent the binational crossings.

title: Common border is now open
text: However, it will go into evaluation which other people could also have access to that credential.

title: Common border is now open
text: It is the first time that this type of control has been carried out on a border that previously had free movement and that will now have this type of procedure, said the official, who added that anyone who has not registered could be subject to expulsion or deportation.

title: Common border is now open
text: Therefore, citizens must keep a copy of the form that must be stamped at each entry and exit from the country.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: While the authorities of the national order try to formulate strategies to alleviate this fiscal gap, through palliatives such as the allocation of resources to guarantee attention to migrants, Venezuelans who arrive in the national territory, look for a way to hold on to their new home, with a view to filling institutional gaps, such as in the health issue, which has led to the political and humanitarian crisis in Venezuela in its citizens.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: Due to the mandatory quarantine in the country to stop the spread of the coronavirus, more and more Venezuelan migrants are looking for a way to return to their country.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: In Eastern Antioquia, a proposal was made to pay for a humanitarian flight for those citizens who wish to return to Venezuela.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: The Associated Municipalities of the Altiplano of Eastern Antioquia (Masora), which include El Carmen de Viboral, El Retiro, El Santuario, Guarne, La Ceja del Tambo, La Unión, Marinilla, Rionegro and San Vicente, expressed their interest in helping these people who voluntarily wish to return to their country.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: As manager of the crisis, appointed by the mayors of the East, we anticipate taking action, announcing that we are going to pay with resources from Masora and the municipalities for our Venezuelan brothers to return to their territories, said Fabio Ríos, president of Masora.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: The person from the neighboring country who wishes to make use of this support must go to one of the mayors offices of these municipalities of the East to be registered.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: For now there is no date for when the trip would be, as it is expected to have a consolidated number of registered first.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: It is expected that there could be between 1,000 and 5,000 Venezuelans who are in this subregion of Antioquia.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: As of October 2019, 78,622 people from that country had arrived in Medellín and 136,829 in all of Antioquia.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: Mónica Alejandra Gómez, Secretary of Social Inclusion, Family and Human Rights of Medellín, reported the implementation of a strategy called Humanitarian Corridor to guarantee the return of 40 people to their country of origin.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: From our Undersecretariat for Human Rights, this management was carried out with the different authorities, to guarantee the return in dignified conditions to these people who expressed the desire to return to their country, where they have their families, said the secretariat.

title: In Antioquia they will pay for the trip of Venezuelans who want to return to their country
text: The transport, food and summer logistics are in charge of the Municipal Administration, who assured that each person underwent the respective health screening and characterization, before making the transfer.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: In their plans they see a return to Venezuela as far away.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: While the Finance Commission of the Council declined on Tuesday to study the Bogotá budget for 2020 and unanimously approved the paper that asked not to approve it, the plenary gave free rein yesterday to 109 new positions in the Bogotá Personería, of which 4 are for managers and 105, for professionals.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: These 109 positions are the first of 220 that, according to the personera of the city, Carmen Teresa Castañeda, the entity needs to face a work overload and strengthen the work of orientation to citizens and surveillance of the health sector.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Along with the increase in the staff, which will go from 893 to 1,002 positions, the Council authorized, with the 43 votes of the councilors who were present at the plenary session, a restructuring of the entity that includes the creation of a delegated legal capacity for the attention and guidance of people, a delegate for the health sector, an internal control office and a knowledge and innovation management department.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: The new positions will cost 13,905 million pesos and will cause personnel expenses to go from 107,508 million pesos this year to 126,171 million in 2020.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Councilors José David Castellanos, Manuel Sarmiento and Rolando González highlighted, in their positive presentation, the importance of restructuring and increasing the plant to guarantee compliance with the rights of Bogota citizens through the strengthening and improvement of the entitys actions .

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Castellanos, coordinator of speakers, assured that these new positions do not represent an additional burden for the citys budget because, according to him, the District Personería will make internal transfers to compensate for the new personnel expenses.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Among the reasons put forward by the Personería, and which were accepted by the Council, is the increase in charges due to the new Police Code, the victims law, the consumer law, the modification of the municipal law, the migration of Venezuelans and the obligation to attend hearings called by judges, prosecutors and family commissioners.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Among the functions performed by the Personería are the disciplinary oversight of District officials, the defense and promotion of human rights, the role of public ministry acting in legal processes to defend the legal order and the collective rights and interests of citizens.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Castañeda cited figures such as the requirements met, which went from 49,624 in 2008 to 218,000 in 2018.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: In health, which has a special group called PAS that works 24 hours, it went from attending 6,214 requests in 2018 to 13,110 in 2019, more than double.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: He also assured that the workload has increased due to issues such as the increase from 39 to 103 police inspections and the arrival of Venezuelan migrants, which from January 2018 to June 2019 forced to provide 26,177 services to those citizens, which implies procedures as guardianships to support them.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: The personera said that the need of the entity is for professionals who go out on the street, make visits and attend to users.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Therefore, most of the positions are of that category.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: At least 32 will go to the local personerías.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería will cost $13,905 million
text: Defending the project in plenary, Castañeda affirmed that the workload of the current officials is overwhelmed, even situations of permanent illness of 10 percent have been reached.

title: Council authorized 109 charges to Personería that will cost $13,905 million.docx
text: Likewise, he pointed out that many of the entitys servers have occupational medical recommendation and some, psychiatric.
